author: {'steamid': '76561198269548567', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6339, 'last_played': 1623318333}
review:
I can't really think of my favorite character in this game. I do like Caesar out of all of them. The rest of the characters are alright. They're not bad. The story is pretty good too and by story, I mean the epilogue and grand finale. I like the voice acting. I think what annoyed me was having to play Caramia, Kyrie, and Axel four times each to get all of their CGs in their routes. 

Spoiler alert?: [spoiler] I have read that someone thought Soh was creepy but I don't really find him creepy. I thought he played a major role in the story because he couldn't be with the main heroine for some reason. I did feel really sorry for Kyrie because he was the only one who remembers everything and he expressed his pain. [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561199052011984', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2126, 'last_played': 1659695496}
review:
La mia è una recensione a caldo dopo aver finito il gioco, e devo dirlo: lo ricomprerei ancora!
Non è privo di pecche, perché ce ne sono, ma queste non mi hanno impedito di godere della storia e dei suoi personaggi.

CONTRO
- Doppiaggio solo parziale (per il prezzo intero del gioco mi sarei aspettata un doppiaggio completo)
- La storia principale devi ripeterla tutte le volte: ogni “settimana” sceglierai che personaggio incontrare, ma gli eventi principali sono sempre quelli. Se si considera che ci sono almeno due ending per personaggio e che per il terzetto di Oz parliamo di praticamente sei finali, direi che la cosa risulta essere un tantino seccante alla lunga.
- Assenza di vere bad ending – il che può non essere un vero punto a sfavore se non piacciono - [spoiler](se escludiamo la route di Soh, dato che sia la good che la bittersweet mi hanno fatta piangere come solo una bella bad ending può fare. Forse anche la route di Robin Hood rientra nelle bad ending mancate)[/spoiler]
- Fuka, la protagonista, per me è stata caratterizzata un po' male. Certi atteggiamenti che mostra in alcune route le trovo completamente fuori dal suo personaggio per come ci viene mostrato in tutte le altre route[spoiler]in particolare nella route del bordello[/spoiler]. A tratti sembra troppo ingenuotta, in alcuni momenti invece l'esatto opposto, e non per un discorso di evoluzione/crescita. Per il momento, fra tutti gli otome che ho giocato, è quella che mi è piaciuta meno. In più, il suo essere banderuola nelle route principali mi ha fatta storcere il naso.
- Non esiste un vero e proprio “Good choice indicator”, inoltre non è possibile accedere, come accade spesso negli otome game, né a un archivio musicale, né a quello dei vari capitoli (o delle scene – alcuni giochi come Amnesia o Hakuouki, permettono tramite l'archivio delle immagini, di rivedere la scena della CG all'interno del gioco).
- Non è un vero punto contro, ma non è possibile fare screenshot tramite i tasti rapidi (l'unica è usare lo stamp e andare su paint o simili).

PRO
- Doppiaggio fantastico (adoro Caramia, Kyrie e Caesar *^*, e anche gli altri non scherzano)
- Varietà di personaggi con personalità diverse, alcune magari un po' stereotipate, ma non vedo come questo possa essere un problema. Essendoci un'ampia scelta, è quasi impossibile non trovare almeno un paio di personaggi di proprio gradimento.
- Grafica e CG splendide, sono una vera gioia per gli occhi!
- Ottima musica di sottofondo (alcune di queste verranno riciclate anche per Steam Prison, e in entrambi i casi hanno fatto il loro lavoro)
- Non abbiamo solo storie con lo sfondo romantico, prima fra tutte la route di Pashet, e per certi versi anche quella di Scarlet [spoiler]dalla quale almeno un bacetto me lo sarei aspettato T_T. La più deludente è comunque la storia di Robin Hood IMHO[/spoiler]. 
- La storia di base non è originale (tema fiabe, tema amnesia...), ma il tutto è stato trattato in maniera coinvolgente. Ci saranno route più interessanti di altre, ciò è legato ai gusti, ma una volta arrivati alla fine non ci si può non ritenere soddisfatti dell'acquisto fatto.
- Nella Homepage verrete sempre accolti dalla voce di uno dei protagonisti.
- L'aggiunta delle Triangle Route. Sorvolo sul comportamento di Fuka che per me è stato gestito un po' male, anzì, è stato gestito malissimo, ma l'idea in sé era buona, era una cosa nuova.

Questi sono i punti a mio modestissimo parere.
Io ho approfittato dei saldi estivi, e ne son felice: il gioco mi è piaciuto molto, ma trenta euro son tanti, e la cosa del doppiaggio parziale ammetto che mi è rimasta un po' sullo stomaco ^^”.
A parte ciò credo che sia un buon gioco con una bella storia e un'interessante rivisitazione dei personaggi di alcune delle storie della nostra infanzia.
Caramia l'ho amato prima ancora di comprare il gioco, essendomi vista anche la miniserie anime (son 12 episodi della durata di soli 4 minuti, in versione deformed dove il protagonista è Scarlet), hanno scelto un doppiatore fantastico e la sua dolce personalità mi ha conquistata.
Axel è un po' freddo all'inizio, ma quando si scioglie è un pasticcino ^^.
Caesar, che è una sorta di antagonista, nella sua route si rivelerà essere poi un ottimo personaggio, preparatevi anche per l'epilogo (la sua route è una delle mie preferite in assoluto).
Soh... per lui armatevi di kleenex, e tanti!
Scarlet ha una route molto carina, che ci sta, anche se avrei preferito un po' più di romance XD.
Pashet si è rivelata una buona amica, mentre Robin Hood mi ha lasciata un po' – un po' tanto – contrariata. Hamelin non ha lo stesso spazio degli altri personaggi (a livello di route personale, per il resto compare praticamente in quasi tutte le altre storie), mi è piaciuto, anche se entrambi i suoi finali rientrano nella categoria del Bittersweet (il che non è necessariamente un male, ma avrei preferito in un vero Happy ending).
Manboy, Dorian Gray e Alfani hanno tre personalità interessanti, e non posso dire che la loro route (sì, questi tre hanno un'unica route) mi abbia lasciata insoddisfatta, anche se certe scelte di Fuka mi hanno fatto dire “Ma che, davvero?!”, o anche un “No, ma sei scema o mangi sassi?”. Alcuni risvolti erano anche parecchio inquietanti ad un certo punto, ma ho letto e visto di tutto, quindi ce ne vuole per scandalizzarmi.
Ho lasciato per ultimo Kyrie nel mio elenco per un motivo ben preciso: ha una personalità un po' particolare, che se da un lato coi suoi “Baka Lion” e altri insulti, rivolti al povero Caramia, mi ha fatta sorridere, dall'altra mi portava a provare pena per i poveretti che dovevano averci a che fare. La sua route mi è piaciuta soprattutto nel finale (la CG è un qualcosa di super tenero, con Caramia sullo sfondo in versione deformed), anche se certi suoi comportamenti non mi piacevano molto (tende a scherzare un po' troppo e a insultare neanche troppo velatamente la gente che gli sta attorno).
Arrivata all'epilogo e alla grand ending ho completamente rivisto il suo personaggio, se già prima mi piaceva, adesso ha superato sia Caesar che Caramia. Per me è il miglior personaggio del gioco, e uno dei migliori dei vari Otome che mi son passati fra le mani. 

Ozmafia me lo aspettavo un pochino diverso dato il titolo, ma già dando un occhio alle illustrazioni, e leggendo qualcosina a riguardo, avevo intuito che non sarebbe stato così crudo (anche se non mancano i momenti che mozzano il fiato). È un ottimo gioco e mi ha intrattenuta parecchio, mi ha divertita, indispettita, intenerita ed emozionata.
Alcuni passaggi forse sono un po' frettolosi, la scena col personaggio di riferimento e la storia principale a volte non è poi amalgamata così bene, ma, per quanto mi riguarda, a fronte di tutto il resto, si finisce col passare oltre godendosi comunque la storia.
Grazie ai saldi l'ho pagato solo 20 euro, e mi sento di consigliare l'acquisto soprattutto in frangenti come questi. Merita di essere giocato, ma ritengo che il suo prezzo di partenza sia un pochino alto.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089835557', 'num_games_owned': 237, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1593803330}
review:
I had this game on my wishlist forever. It looked so well produced, it looked so promising. However... I ended up very disappointed and even a bit insulted... if you are a more mature otome, who likes deep, immersive VNs with intriguing story... this prob is not for you. Am I getting too jaded/too old for this? I dunno, maybe, but hear me out here. 

To start off, the soundtrack was just so cheesy. They actually went and played Amazing Grace during a sad scene!!! The intro alone is already super cheese/boyband-y. 

Another annoying thing were the cuts between scenes, that were almost like commercial break cuts in anime, but occured wayyyy more often. Every single time you cut between scenes, you'd be greeted to the same still image, with a little jingle playing, that is unskippable, and lasts for a good ~5 seconds. It's not so bad, until there's quick scenes between you & your boy that last maybe like 3-4 minutes, and they just keep cutting that in and bringing you to you & your group again, it gets so tedious and tbh it's also super cheesy.  

So the first scene was promising, it seemed tense and eventful, but after that, everything goes down to a boring halt. You have amnesia, where did you come from? Does anyone care? Nope. Do you care? Nope. Just live your carefree life and have fun, you amnesiac darling you.  

Gameplay wise, it was so boring. The game feels like a slice of life anime almost, where each day is a different event that does not play into an over-arching story, theme, or mission. A beauty contest one day, shopping in town another day, a random attack that resolves itself fine since all the mafiosos are on silly amiable terms anyway, etc, but nothing that connects the events together or gives them meaning. 

The art style is lovely, airy, and delicate, but I guess that made it difficult for me to get immersed. I couldn't really figure out a character I liked anyway, they all seemed very odd and unrealistic.

I played Dr. Crow as my first route, since he seemed the less cringey to me. I kind of enjoyed it once it finally started to pick up a tiny bit and go down his story route, but it had a pretty unsatisfactory ending and was a big let-down of a route anyway. He admits that he doesn't love you, and there's no romantic scenes with him, unless you count the time he drugs you and sleeps with you out of nowhere before using you to help with his own twisted relationship issues. I replayed picking opposite choices but all it did was give me the same ending (there's only like 6 CGs in total, I got 5 so I'm sure I didn't miss anything too drastic), but you could see some of his thoughts the second go around (each time, ofc, is after and before another stupid cut and jingle commercial break). Interesting, but nothing that I couldn't have imagined already, considering he made his interests and thoughts pretty clear. 

I might play again to do the Wolf guy since he's kinda cute and also seems to know who you are. Maybe it'd give me some intriguing story and maybe something more interesting, but I think grinding through this game again would only confirm that I actually hate myself a bit, so maybe not.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190881828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3306, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1595, 'last_played': 1593837284}
review:
This game is just so...weird. The best way I think to describe it would be as a dark fantasy, with romantic and comedy elements. 

This game is not for everyone. The routes all start off rather tame, but then quickly shift to WTF. Several endings have dubcon and noncon (implied and described), and can be rather graphic in their descriptions of violence and sex. 

If you are interested in knowing more about the specific characters and routes, then continue reading below as I go into more detail without giving too many spoilers. If you want a surprise, well, just start playing and good luck! (I really recommend a guide though, there are just too many endings)

[h1]Overall Impression[/h1]

To start with, the heroine is SO DUMB.[spoiler]This is eventually explained.[/spoiler] At first, this greatly annoyed me. But after playing for awhile I've come to the conclusion that this is intentional for comedic effect. 

Despite the fact she's dumber than a box of rocks, she never lets it get her down or deter her. She's well aware of just how stupid she is - and she seems to embrace this. [spoiler]In fact, it's why Kyrie even falls in love with her.[/spoiler] She doesn't mope and whine and sit around acting confused and lost - instead she actively tries to learn and do what she can, even if that just causes more trouble. Her simple and earnest nature is often the punchline for jokes, but at the same time makes you love her. 

After accepting the fact that the heroine is so unbelievably stupid, and understanding the sort of humor present, I was able to enjoy the game for what it is. Don't take it too seriously (at least not in the first half). [spoiler]It's worth it for the Grand Ending![/spoiler]

[h1] Game play[/h1]

The story itself is broken up into small, short scenes that give you a chance to interact with the different characters in the game. Each "week" of in game time, you select a new character to visit. As a result, the game gives off a very "slice of life" type vibe and can feel rather disjointed at times. It doesn't have a good flow, so this may be very aggravating for some people.

Each route needs to be played through twice (route, not ending) because new scenes open up on the second play through that reveal some crucial information about what was going on behind the scenes.

All of the routes follow the same pattern, with Caramia/Kyrie/Axel having a love triangle element to their story in the middle-

 1) Common/shared route. Character specific scenes depending on the route you are trying for. This portion of the story is rather lighthearted. Innuendo abounds. It's fun and there isn't really anything too serious or important occurring (though you do learn a lot about the characters and setting through multiple replays). Yes, there is some violence, but nothing like what happens in part 3. Your choices here determine the route you will take.

2) (Caramia/Axel/Kyrie only) Awkward love triangle phase. Your chosen partner has some sort of personal crisis that leads to them questioning whether or not they are good enough for MC. Honestly, this was my least favorite part of the entire game. SO.MUCH.WHINING. [spoiler]Caramia wasn't so bad - but I HATED Kyrie during this part and wanted to smack some sense into Axel.[/spoiler] Your choices determine if you continue on the original partner's route or "transfer" to the other character in the love triangle. 

3) The Ending part. We finally get to see some more intimacy (usually) between MC and the chosen partner. This is also where the story finally progresses and where things often take a very abrupt, very dark turn. You go from joking about the MC's breast size to watching the love interest choke on his own blood so fast you get whiplash. It often gets graphically violent. [spoiler]Thankfully the love interests are blessed(?) with immortality and crazy healing abilities, so no one dies. Though they do go a little crazy at times.[/spoiler] Your choices determine if you get the happy ending, or the "bittersweet" ending. 

[h1]The Guys[/h1]

Oh boy. 

[b]Caramia[/b] - the leader of the Oz group. He's charming and sweet, and innocent almost at times. In his endings we get to see a different side of him which is umm...sorta adorable but possibly extremely annoying to some people. 

[b]Axel[/b] - the awkward, shy, quiet guy. So much adorable blushing. [spoiler]And honestly, he's very clingy which you may or may not enjoy.[/spoiler]

[b]Kyrie[/b] - the sadist. Kyrie was probably my favorite character. (I will admit I did like him much better as a love triangle partner on one of the other character's routes.) He never failed to make me laugh. During the love triangle part of his own route though, I really wanted to kill the man. HE IS AWFUL. [spoiler]In his endings, he is very open with his affection towards the MC, which I love.[/spoiler]

[b]Scarlet[/b] - sweet young love. Scarlet is a little blunt and unsociable at times. There isn't a lot of romance in his route, but it's still very sweet and enjoyable. [spoiler]There's an element of "star crossed lovers" to his story.[/spoiler] 

[b]Hamelin[/b] - this man just needs a hug. Seriously. His route is entirely too short though, and my only complaint is that it isn't longer. If he had a longer route he could have easily become my favorite (sorry, Kyrie). After playing Scarlet's route you should have a pretty good idea of what his personality is like. [spoiler]He reminds me of Levi from Psychedelica of the Ashen Hawk.[/spoiler] 

[b]Pashet[/b] - this is sadly not a GL route. Instead it's a platonic friendship/girl power route. I like Pashet's character a good deal, but her route itself left a lot to be desired. It was longer than Hamelin's but his seemed to have much more substance to it. 

[b]The Brothel[/b] - the infamous Brothel Route. With how much people complain about this route, I was expecting a lot more sex than I was given. But, following a similar pattern to the other routes, once the ending started it took a very sharp turn into dark and twisted. There is a lot more sex at the end, and it's described rather graphically.

There are 2 endings for this route, but unlike other routes both are rather bittersweet and dark. The "good" end was one I enjoyed reading and was very happy with. It was well written and I like how the MC developed given her situation. The "bad" end had a much different feel to it, and was even darker- there is a lot of implied noncon and dubcon. 

[i]Very little to the overall plot is actually revealed in The Brothel route, so if you are at all uncomfortable with the concept, feel free to skip it entirely and enjoy the rest of the game.[/i]

[b]Doctor Robin Hood[/b] - sexy doctor man. [spoiler]Probably a yandere.[/spoiler] His endings felt so rushed and caught me off guard. There is dubcon present, so be warned. Like the other routes, it takes a sudden turn into dark and twisted territory.

[b]Caesar[/b] - adorable tsundere wolf boy. I didn't think it possible, but he's even stupider than the MC. But he's so freaking cute! There are some big plot holes that aren't answered in his route, but it's still enjoyable.

[b]Soh[/b] - sweet, mysterious character. His route will make very little sense at first, so be sure to play it last. 

[b]Epilogue/Grand Ending[/b] -  Most (all?) of your questions will be answered, and plot holes filled here. [spoiler]After completing one ending from each route, click on the book the girl is holding on the main screen. This will start the Epilogue. Once the Epilogue is finished AND you've completed ALL endings, click the book again and read the Grand Ending.[/spoiler]

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]

If you can accept the game for what it is, I would recommend it to you. It's dark, with lots of innuendo and off color humor. (thanks Kyrie!) 

If you're looking for a serious, romantic game with healthy relationships and a capable, intelligent MC, this probably isn't for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198333361247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 181, 'last_played': 1605071864}
review:
Doesn't feel like a traditional otome game as the storylines are all disconnected. In one scene the characters are gearing up for a fight. In the next scene, you're waking up again and everything is covered in a flashback. This happens throughout the game so everything just feels incredibly disjointed.

It feels like you're reading chapters written by different teams and they just slapped all the events together in a rough timeline.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276198497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3109, 'last_played': 1592786456}
review:
I sank 52 hours into this game getting all the CGs and watching every additional scene there was. This game was absolutely worth it. Each love interest has a unique personality with unique thoughts. Every character slowly makes you love them in some way. Or at least they did for me. I've played a few Otome games, and usually there is always one character that it just a chore to do the route. and I just get it done to get it done. I didn't have that problem with this game. I was invested in each of the characters. I wanted to know why they did the things they did. And the humor..guys the humor was so on point especially with the Oz boys. I chuckled, snorted, spit water, and down right laughed out loud with this game. If you are like me and you are looking through reviews to see if a game is worth the purchased boy howdy is this one worth it. 

now a slight caveat to my praise above. I am about to list somethings that may make some people hesitate on buying. I personally don't think these things take away from the game or make it worse. They are just the other side of the coin.

The first thing I want to mention is my praise above does NOT include the brothel story line. That line really messed with my brain. There is no specific "target" in this story and in all honestly I was a bit uncomfortable the whole time, and I"m not one to be squemish about sex and paid services like that. It was not something I expected when I started the game (although with Dorian Grey as one of the characters I probably should have). But it was there so I completed it. There are a few other story lines that touch on some very dark subjects, but this one was real harsh.

The other thing I want to point out is that when going through some of these routes you will be confused. There are some things that happen that are just not explained and don't make sense when you get the ending. It's not until you've done someone else's route or gotten to the super final route that things start to make sense. For me this didn't bother me. I actually enjoy that "ah-ha!" moment when you are realize that a character was acting a certain way for this reason that you find out later through other means. I enjoyed that it didn't hold my hand and give me a novel on why each character was acting a certain way. you had to put the effort in to find out. But some people don't like that so I think it's worth mentioning.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130093017', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1892, 'last_played': 1613340529}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126399090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 2913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2913, 'last_played': 1588764184}
review:
Looking back now, yeah, this was pretty entertaining with these characters and moments. But is it completely worth it? I don't know. I keep having breaks in between, I started this game since DECEMBER. 
I only managed to complete everything despite how painful it was, where I basically gave up where I still were missing endings (specifically the love triangle in the oz group- A COMPLETE HEADACHE) and used a guide!??!! 

There were times where I completely accepted cheesy and cliched scenes where I just adored to bits! Then other times I just thought it doesn't go well with me, I was just Tired of it. 

Also I feel like no one mentions how... awful... absolutely painful the loading screen IS!!! I am haunted by the melody. No. Really. You would go through so many, and make the story go slow after the first read of the main/common story before the routes! That is why it felt so difficult to me, because it's best to 100% this otome to read the epilogue they give afterwards- however it requires so much patience and skipping, that also feels like because of the constant skip read-text takes me out of the moment, read new scene with whoever's route, then skip, new scene, skip. It's hard to take it in nicely since you have to run over this long common route, sigh.

Also I hate the ending, whatever, cowards. Pashet's route disappointed me. A certain fella's route also felt very brief to me. Brothel route, "Thanks. I hate it". Also I'm going out and say Caesar is an a**hole so I had this constant undercurrent feelings of severe distaste despite sweet moments that happens like any other. 

I don't know, I feel like I only truly appreciated 2 of the guys that felt right and absolutely cute with the protag. I feel like I think too much about ages with "sweet" protags a lot, so I guess that doesn't surprise me why I feel like that when looking at the bigger picture. Hm. Also why is her name Fuka??? Shouldn't she get something... european at least? Idk felt weird to me. But I don't know, maybe that's just me.

tldr: This game certainly had me going up and down that's for sure, and yes, both in a bad way and good. Beware of the loading screen. And I complain a lot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083113832', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3285, 'last_played': 1589903635}
review: Ozmafia is a wonderful game, I recommend it to all who are fans of the genre. It has some weaknesses and faults but once you get to the end you will forget about all the little things that might have annoyed you (looking at you loading screens and fade to black screens) . It might seem a bit boring to start and the routes can get quite repetitive because of the uncommonly long common route, but trust me, the end is worth it all. I will end my review here to wipe off my tears and try to get over the after-game blues, I hope you will pick this game up and enjoy it as much as I did. I would like for Poni-Pachet SY to bring more localized games on steam, it was trully a wonderful experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198445137709', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2267, 'last_played': 1598428199}
review:
To be honest, I had a hard time deciding whether to give a thumbs up or not.

While it's not totally bad, I think the game's cons heavily outweigh the pros. The game's premise seemed interesting, and the characters/visual style is very colorful, as it draws influences from various literary sources. Sadly, once the game begins, it loses steam very fast. Instead of spending time developing the plot, we instead are treated to a bunch of conversations with the characters that come off as pretty boring. And when the game actually attempts to focus on its plot, the writing comes off as pretty clumsy.  As a reader, I felt very disconnected from the story and I hardly cared for the most part. 

Anyway, it is by no means very bad, and the Epilogue was actually an interesting read. But overall, I don't think it was worth the price and I highly advise to buy it on discount (tbh, I don't think it's enough even on discount).

Personal favorites were Scarlet, Hamelin [/spoiler] (their routes weren't very good though) and Caesar (only good route in the game IMO).

author: {'steamid': '76561198209523149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4705, 'last_played': 1689883840}

author: {'steamid': '76561198312832025', 'num_games_owned': 213, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3612, 'last_played': 1628869738}
review:
Why is there no route for Hansel? ;-;
I bought this game years ago, but I haven't written a review for it until now. So, Ozmafia is an otome game where you play as an amnesiac young woman with all the characters being based on fairytales. We have characters from books written by famous authors like Lyman Frank Baum, the Grimm brothers, Oscar Wilde and more.

[b]Pros[/b]
- Gorgeous art. The colours, the character designs and CGs are all beautiful. 
- The voice acting.
- The BG music.
- Plenty of save slots.
- Love triangles. Several otome games do have routes where another guy has feelings for the heroine, but few have the option to completely switch lover in the middle of the route. If you're playing Axel's route and end up in a love triangle with Caramia, you can switch to have Caramia as your love interest instead. I think it's an interesting feature, but I also think they could've been written better. Because if you do decide to switch love interest, the game makes it seem like you and the first guy never even dated.
- Lovable characters. We have the adorable sniper Scarlet (Little Red Riding Hood) and the reliable leader Caramia (Cowardly Lion). By far my favorite routes. Axel's (Tin Man) route is cute too. He's the typical "robot learning how to love" kind of character with an unhealthy love for sweets. And then there's Pashet (Puss In Boots). Although I don't swing that way, I didn't mind playing her route at all. She's without a doubt the best girl in Ozmafia. And, again, why is there no route for Hansel? He's the second best character in the game! He's the positive, half-insane brother of Gretel and may or may not enjoy blowing people up with dynamite. What's there not to love? If they ever make a DLC with a route for him, I'll gladly buy it. The last character I like that I want to mention is the hilarious bad boy - Caesar (The Big Bad Wolf). Him showing up to kidnap and/or kill you is basically a running gag.
- You get to participate in a beauty pageant with your opponent being a duck. No, I'm not kidding. Her name is Juliette.
- Personally, I'd say the dialogues are fun to read. I rarely skip conversations even though I've already seen them 10 times [strike]unless it's with Kyrie[/strike].

[b]Neutral[/b]
- The fact that you need to play all routes and get every ending in order to unlock the grand finale. While I think it's good to have the players keep playing the game, I don't like that the game forces you to play the disgusting Brothel route.
- Soh and his route. The route is pretty cute. However, while the good ending does make sense, it was still pretty underwhelming. I can't think fondly of him either considering that he's the one who [spoiler]made Hamelin kill Robin Hood's wife[/spoiler]. I couldn't case less why he did it. It doesn't justify the damage he caused.
- Hamelin's route. I like Hamelin, but he definitely has the least memorable route despite being the don of the Grimm famiglia and [spoiler]a criminal[/spoiler]. How are you even supposed to figure out how to get on Hamelin's route without looking at a walkthrough? Just from the player's curiousity about [spoiler]how the Oz trio would react to getting rejected[/spoiler]?
- Robin Hood. Almost everyone knows about the legendary thief who steals from the rich to give to the poor, yet there's [i]nothing[/i] connecting this character to the "real" Robin Hood other than his name. Still, he has the most beautifully tragic route and I can't help but feel sorry for him after [spoiler]the death of his wife[/spoiler]. An important thing to mention for those who are planning on playing his route is that you might feel uncomfortable playing it because of a certain scene. Just saying.
- Only Caramia, Axel and Kyrie can be in a love triangle. I kinda wish there were more of them. There was definitely an opportunity to write love triangles featuring Caesar x you x Soh, Scarlet x you x Hansel/Hansel x you x Gretel, Pashet x you x Bercy and Robin Hood x you x Hamelin. But that's not really a big of a deal. It's fine the way it is too.

[b]Cons[/b]
- The protagonist (You can rename her). Oh boy. First of all, how could you possibly mistake Scarlet for a girl? And during his route, the MC becomes quite frustrating. Instead of explaining to Scarlet that [spoiler]she had to officially join the Oz famiglia in order to save him, so the two of them wouldn't be able to be together anymore[/spoiler], she [spoiler]completely ignored him without explaining anything[/spoiler]. The poor guy thought he had done something wrong and ended up having to [spoiler]beg her to talk to him[/spoiler]. She had no excuse to be doing this to him either. After all, [spoiler]the rules forbid her from being with Scarlet, but they don't forbid her from ever talking to him again[/spoiler]. And then there's Kyrie's route. MC has no problem with being harassed by Kyrie. One of these "jokes" is when he tells her that he likes "large" women. What does she do? She starts eating like a pig until she feels ill in order to get fat just so she can be physically appealing to him. Where is your [i]dignity[/i], woman? The fact that she's allowing Kyrie to treat her poorly because she "loves him" is absurd. And don't even get me started on how she acts in the Brothel route. The level of stupidity that she shows during that route is so high that she [i]deserved[/i] the Brothel route's normal/bad ending. But that route is a separate point, which I'll be getting to soon.
- Kyrie and his route. Did you really expect me to like the MC being a doormat for Kyrie? Am I supposed to find it amusing? Am I supposed to feel sympathy for her? It doesn't matter what the answer is because it doesn't change my despise for his route. I've never even liked Kyrie as a character - for obvious reasons. I'll give him one thing though. The sincere sadness he felt when [spoiler]everyone except him forgot her[/spoiler] and seeing him desperately try to [spoiler]make Caramia and Axel remember her[/spoiler] was heartbreaking. And to be frank, Kyrie is the only character whose normal/bad ending I prefered over the good ending.
- The Brothel route. This route made me feel so uncomfortable. I didn't even want to play it in the first place, but - as I mentioned earlier - you [i]have[/i] to play it if you want to reach the game's final chapter. It's the only route where both endings are bad, in my opinion. The only reasonable character at the brothel is Manboy, although Alfani isn't that bad either.  But even so, a kinda likable character and a reasonable character aren't enough to save this route. It's unsettling, disturbing, toxic and should not exist. I still can't believe that this garbage got a route but Hansel and Gretel didn't. And speaking of the brothel, of course I have to mention the scum of the game - Dorian Gray. A holy man of the church? HA! He's a [spoiler]murderer[/spoiler], and [spoiler]executes the women who become pregnant at his brothel[/spoiler]. Then there's him declaring [spoiler]the MC as dead so others won't come looking for her[/spoiler] and - if you refuse to give in to him - will literally [spoiler]keep her as a prisoner until she becomes a brainwashed, living doll[/spoiler]. Wouldn't it have been better (and healthier) if Manboy and/or Alfani [i]rebelled against Dorian[/i] because they want to protect you from him and from the brothel itself? Good ending: they win and the brothel cease to exist. Bad ending: Dorian wins. Why couldn't we get that instead?

[b]Final words[/b]
Despite the cons (which I feel strongly about), they are easily outmatched by the pros. I absolutely love Ozmafia and it's one of my favorite otome games. I definitely recommend it, though I recommend it for people aged 15+ since there are themes that most certainly aren't child friendly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198268712887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1608689039}
review:
I think that personally, Ozmafia is a mixed bag of a game. The characters are very interesting, and the mafioso twist to fairy-tale characters is a really unique idea!
Unlike other otome that I've played before, Ozmafia doesn't show the mc's bonds with the suitors; so the routes are a surprise. 
Because of this, I ended up on a character's route that wasn't even in the main story- which was an emotional rollercoaster. I grew to like his character so much that I lost interest in playing the other routes for 4 months!! XD

So far, it's been an alright game. Parts of the story tend to drag, but there are interesting scenes and an aura of mystery surrounding the world of Ozmafia.

I think this game is best to buy when it's discounted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198246902090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4398, 'last_played': 1676403247}
review:
I don't usually write reviews but I hope this one helps people who are thinking of getting the game. (I hope my review makes sense as well)

OZMAFIA!! isn’t a straightforward otome game. It requires you to play through (almost) every ending if you want to get hints about the story of the town. To explain, you might think there are tons of plot holes or that some scenes end in cliffhangers when you finish one ending of a route but those plot holes are filled when you try to get the other ending of the same route. That’s because another scene (often where Fuka/MC isn’t present) is added in when you play through the route again to get the other ending so you get an explanation of what happened. I personally found it fun (it's like solving a mystery) but this might not be your cup of tea. 

In my opinion, the game isn’t much focused on romance but it’s more focused on the story and the characters. I know that otome games are supposed to focus on the development of the relationship between the MC and the capturable characters but don’t expect much from this one. So if you want an entirely romance-focused otome, I don’t recommend that you play this one. If you want a plot-focused otome or if you enjoy making your own theories out of lore as you play, then you can give this game a try. That doesn't mean that the characters aren't likeable btw. I enjoyed seeing them interact with each other.

It’s a given that not everyone will like this game but I enjoyed playing it from start to finish. The characters are based on fictional characters so refreshing my mind about the literature they were based on was fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198260893790', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2799, 'last_played': 1588394419}
review:
~Suitors~
I'm going to try to keep this review with as few spoilers as I can. I have not finished all the routes, but I will say the ones I have completed are all unique. In fact, something I saw in this otome that I haven't seen in many others is the idea of changing your romantic partner half way through. What I mean is, even after you've "chosen" your preferred mate, other potential suitors can still confess there love for you and even pursue you. So your never really stuck with one person. This is not true on all routes, but I thought it was worth noting. One of the reasons I highly recommend getting this game is because of how different they all are. There's even a potential female suitor even though I have not played that route yet. This game has so many options! You will never get frustrated because you saw a really cute side character and they weren't available. I wish some of their routes were more beefed out, but they did amazing with what they had.

~The Main Character~
Ozamafia follows the typical otome stereotype of amnesia. The girl is quite dumb and doesn't understand many of the things that are going on. In my opinion, I would perfer a mc that is a little more head strong or at least has her own opinion about things. Depending on the route the mc is dumber. On the doctor route it was quite frustrating for me, but what can you do? I understand that she has amnesia and is not very aware of how the world works at the beginning, but I just wished she were a little more savy. Despite my complaints the mc isn't completely unbarable. She does have her good points, and she is really pretty if that helps.

~Time and Playthroughs~
I have 46 hours currently documented on this game and I've done about five (succesful) routes. The game is very easy to navigate and they have a skip option that works really well. I'm only noting this because in some otome games the skip option goes really slowly or it pauses every 5 seconds (Uhg). The settings page is also really easy to understand and navigate. Once again noting because some otome games don't have this. As for playthroughs for me, I just saved all the screens where you choose a character and it makes it easier to go back just in case you mess up, because you will. 

~Optics~
This. Game. Is. Beautiful. You can hate the oc, you can hate the suitors, but you cannot hate the amazing views in this game. I can't say there is one ugly suitor or less desirable suitor. The backgrounds are also really nice some aren't "gorgeous" but they 

~Do I recommend?~
YES YES YES. This game is more than worth the full price, and you should definetly buy it if you can afford it. Im still getting through my playthroughs and I will update this if anything changes. But if your into otome games then you NEED to play Ozamafia! I promise you will not regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060336961', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1150, 'last_played': 1586130086}
review:
Disclaimer: I played OZMAFIA!! for the first time in 2017 and just came back to it, because what else am I supposed to do during a literal plague? My review takes both experiences into account and is coming out before the Nintendo Switch port of the game.

I would recommend OZMAFIA!! to others interested in dating sims, otome games, or visual novels. The cast is memorable--unique, even, compared to other games in the genre. Their voices are a treat to listen to throughout the game. The world is fleshed out and fascinating. It's clear from the first run-through of this game that a lot of love was put into the project by the writers. The way the narrative is constructed is clever, teasing the reader with information that makes them stop to think, and inspires them to keep playing. It's an enjoyable otome that I [i]want[/i] to 100%. I've put some hours into it, so I obviously enjoy it.

Fuka is my least favorite visual novel MC ever. There are odd translations and typos that other users have already recorded. There are an annoying amount of transition screens. When sprites are zoomed in, it's easy to see the "flaws" in the art, and the case could be made that the art hasn't aged well (though I'm a huge fan of the art style). A touch-up on the things reviews and discussions have mentioned over the years would be great.

I would [b]not[/b] recommend OZMAFIA!! as Baby's First Visual Novel, at least if Baby wants a straightforward visual  novel experience. Compared to other otomes of the same type, OZMAFIA!! is challenging for two main reasons:

- The story expands as you play it; the player can go back to the same scene after passing that scene or playing another route and new information will appear. Some scenes don't appear in the first run at all. Even knowing this, it still surprised me to see how it impacted my view of characters and their relationships. (This has been most significant with my opinion of Kyrie as I replay in 2020, as I've gone from actively disliking him to considering him one of my favorites.)
- Completionism is rewarded and, in a way, encouraged despite the game not having achievements. You won't ever have a full picture of the story unless you read the Epilogue and Grand Finale, which can only be unlocked by achieving 99% completion. Aside from the CG gallery there isn't an efficient way to keep track of your completion, meaning that if the player is going for the gold they're going to do a non-zero amount of suffering to get there. 

Both of these could easily be addressed in the Switch port (and in the Steam version) with the minor addition of a tracker of sorts--one that tracks "hidden" interactions the player has seen and one that tracks the endings they've achieved. Not all VNs do this, but in one as complex as OZMAFIA!! I think it would be a worthwhile addition. 

Neither of these are to say that someone can't enjoy OZMAFIA!! unless they 100% it--it's totally reasonable to only play through the routes that you want There's still an entirely different story under the main premise of the game, and in this way, OZMAFIA!! is reminiscent of Dandelion and Nameless. That's something I, personally, am into, but not every player is, and that's okay. OZMAFIA!! can still be enjoyed for what it is on the surface. It's a good time with pretty art and music that doesn't annoy your ears.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065951654', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3444, 'last_played': 1647629353}
review:
The art is amazing, the characters even more so. If you're looking for an interesting and wild ride with good writing and an interesting story, then this is your game.

It's complex - there's a lot of endings, and unlocking all brings in an even better story line. I wasn't expecting OZMAFIA to be the emotional ride that it was, but Kyrie's story-line alone is worth the cost of the game, and the other stories aren't bad at all, so you're certain to get your money's worth. (And your little dog's too!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198180471411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1408, 'last_played': 1583656613}
review:
Даже не знаю с чего начать. Наверное многие заметили, особенно великолепные дамы, что герои безумно похожи на героев Дьявольских возлюбленных? Ну, это не просто так.
Рисовка очень приятная для глаз, не перегружена цветом и в то же время яркая. Вы не увидите тут каких-то наидичайших кровавых сцен убийств ( не смотря на то, что действия разворачиваются между мафиозными семьями). Заранее предупреждаю и тут же спойлер:
[spoiler]  "Сюжета особо не ждите, вы получите малую его крупицу в случаи прохождения всех рутов, там будет возможность нажать на книгу и увидеть дом сцену "пролог".[/spoiler]
 Ну и немного пройдемся по героям: Парней, а значит и рутов\концовок тут туча тучная, если сидеть и читать, плюс смотреть доп сцены которые открываются при повторном прохождении, уйдет довольно много времени!  Главная героиня тут [strike] тупой и жизнерадостный овощ который не отдает себе отчет в какой ситуации находится. Блевать тянет.[/strike]  типикал милая\добрая\ничегонепонимаюя гг-шка. Ничего нового. 
Музыкальное сопровождение ( не считая опенинга и эндинга) при загрузках играют божественные мелодии, а во время прохождения мелодии всегда в тему. Такие пусть и стандартные, но все же слух радуют. 
По парням проходиться не буду, т.к.  смысла нет, но каждый найдет себе по вкусу, наверное, хотя тоже не факт. 
Советую потому что время можно провести вполне себе неплохо, даже посмеяться в некоторых сюжетных линиях.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308457838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1640, 'last_played': 1582931513}
review:
Whole game 6/10.

It's a good game. I enjoyed playing it. It did feel very... professional? Like, yeah i love the quality but it missed the mark on passion. Ooey-gooey romance stuff, that's what we're here for. The romance was sparse even for the obvious main love interests. Don't even get me started on the others... [spoiler] Soh and Scarlet [/spoiler] were my best boys. I actually loved these boys but they didn't get any happy endings! And all the endings were very abrupt. I played a LOT of otome (ahem) so I'm used the the ending and epilogues being nice and drawn out as a reward for dealing with the usually awful heroine's antics. I looked away from the screen during an ending once and I was back on the title screen. I didn't even expect it to end there-- it felt like they didn't finish their thoughts. Romance 4/10!!!

The storyline.... well, I can dig it, I guess. A good amount of plot points made me roll my eyes. I expected something pretty deep, what with the foundation of the story being an amnesiac girl dropping into a world where people fight and kill over nothing. It was very shallow, and there wasn't any violence. I played Alice in the Country of Hearts otome(good luck finding that anywhere these days...) and they did it right. Basically the same plot: violent world, nice girl. Except you know, there was violence. There were stakes. You felt like characters would kill one another and the world made them insane and violent. Here, they give the emptiest of empty threats. There's no actual mafioso conflict!?!?! I really wanted to see hot guys fight over me, so major let down there... But it could have been worse. Let's give it 6/10 for worldbuilding+plot.

Characters.... Some were very forgettable, but maybe that's just taste. What I remember was HATING the heroine at many many points. I get the the boys are supposed to have less of a moral standing, but damn the heroine [spoiler]slept with another man right after an argument with the current love interest. And the man she slept with is his best friend like damn why???[/spoiler] You will find some lovable love interests in here, but you won't be happy finishing their route hahaha. And the side characters? Who? If i squinted my eyes, all i saw was Cliche Background Character 1, 2, and 3. They had "personality" i GUESS. Their personalities could be summed up with single word at ALL times. No deviation, no nothing. Some of the main cast could be summed up with TWO words, i digress, so... Characters 6-7/10. Nothing special.

I think the developers didn't have any passion for the product. I didn't feel like they had a story they wanted to tell or felt love for the characters we were supposed to love. If you don't love the love interests, then neither will your audience. All in all, it was a decent addition to the otome genre, but maybe next time I'll look for something with a tad more romance...

author: {'steamid': '76561198214391935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 627, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 677, 'last_played': 1582823362}
review:
[quote]
OZMAFIA!!（OZ黑手党!!）是由Poni-Pachet SY制作的一款乙女向视觉小说，大致讲述了一个失忆少女fuka（芙卡）在被人追杀的情况下彷徨不安，独自在陌生的城市不断徘徊，在危急时刻被支配当地城市的黑手党奥兹家族所救下，并且受到了他们的庇护，而这一切在她背后所发生的却又是家族之间的斗争旋窝。

[quote]
[h1]游戏的考据&科普：[/h1]
OZMAFIA!!（オズマフィア）实际上是由Dramatic Create和Poni-Pachet共同制作的乙女向视觉小说，早在2013年就以光碟的形式登录PC端，后于2015年2月登录PSV平台，此次在2016年登录Steam平台的版本应该是PSV的移植版本。后续衍生出同名漫画，并在2016年7月改编播出同名泡面番，由于番剧弱化了黑手党属性转而校园风，虽然能够比较简洁明了的了解个人的属性和关系，但实际对游戏并没有帮助，可以算是一个平行世界企划。

Mafia一词实际与黑手党并无任何关联，是中国国内意译的约定俗成，在历史考据中源自“Morto Alla Francia, Italia Anela”（意大利文的“消灭法国是意大利的渴求”）的缩写，实际是历史战争遗留的产物，后用于通指一些黑社会犯罪团体，并不单独指意大利裔的犯罪分子，但是非常有趣的是意大利拿波里的犯罪组织一般不称为“Mafia” 而是“Camorra”，应该算是本土的一些风土人情，另外在阿拉伯语中“Mafia”一次指的是避难、逃难，根据实际的历史进展，“Mafia”原本指的是为了防范入侵者而自发组成的民兵自警团，后续演化成了一些犯罪组织，也是我们经常在一些作品里能够看到收到当地民众爱戴的原因。
[/quote]

[quote]
[h1]游戏的体验&分析：[/h1]
首先要提到的是，鉴于本作最早是在2013年左右发售的，到现在为止时间跨度较大，因此在部分细节表现上可能会和现在一部分玩家的喜好冲突，我姑且把这部分称谓游戏受到了时间上的机能限制，并且在部分战斗画面的表现形式上受影响较大。

本作大致上讲述了一个失忆少女收到黑手党保护的剧情，由于乙女游戏的惯例玩家是可以自己起名的，不过本作还特地的迎合剧情搞了个失忆的设定还是比较有趣的，整体的内容就是一边和黑手党之间度过的日常，偶尔推进一些主线，其中会时不时出现一些火拼剧情，大体上能够说是温馨愉快的。

从画面上来看，本作并没有选择浓墨色彩的风格，整体上偏向柔和亮丽的色彩，让这个画面充满了一种淡水彩风格，确实能够更好的体现出一种温馨细腻的日常风格。从人设上来看女主芙卡是一个积极向上的女孩子，非常善良温柔，性格非常软糯讨人喜欢；caramia是奥兹家族的BOSS，虽然说是Boss但是和女主说话一直都是温柔的笑着，符合勇敢狮子的设定；kyrie是奥兹家族的顾问，城府比较深，一肚子坏水，如果是和芙卡单独相处时挖苦较多，不过和奥兹家族一起时显得非常靠谱；axel是个死傲娇，并且每次受伤的都是他，说实话奥兹家族的三位在一起的时候真的非常温馨，相互补足这点非常棒，不过也让我感觉女主完全无法插入他们的铁壁之中。pashet是一位一本正经的女骑士也是长靴家族的BOSS，虽然表面威严但是其实少女心爆绷，也是我去见次数最多的一位，性格上与女主芙卡真的非常切合，一方面要强的她却也意识到了自己身为女性所存在的不足之处，并且在不断的努力，确实是一只严格而又温柔的猫。而剩下的两个家族安徒生和格林其实出场戏份不多，但是成员人设都还比较有趣，就不细谈了。音乐方面整体上是偏向童话风的温馨旋律，能够较好与画面搭配渲染出温馨的日常。

本作整体上是按照好感度加成来算路线的，每天都有一段固定的主线，主线推进完后会进入自主选择见面的模式，选择与人见面后会基本上在小剧情里会出现一个加成选项，我选择了与pashet见面，随着对她越来越多的了解，也发现了她对自己的苦恼，而女主芙卡却是一个聆听的好对象，她虽然严于律己表面严肃，但也还是有软弱的一面，也有少女心的一面，越到后期越会发现她的那份笑容和害羞是多么宝贵，而她又是多么一个逞强的人。结果我越到最后越想了解她反而进入了pashet的支线，在个人结局里pashet开了一家甜品店。实际上本作的结局非常之多，如果是选择了奥兹家族三人组的路线就会进入三角剧情，随着好感度高低会出现恋人和情敌的要素，据说在这个三角路线里还分成了纯爱线和NTR线，让我觉得略微有点奇妙，不过我实在不愿意破坏三人之间的调和于是选择了别的个人路线，还是让奥兹家族的三个男人一台戏吧。
[/quote]

[quote]
[h1]最终总结：[/h1]
OZMAFIA!!（OZ黑手党!!）作为一款乙女向视觉小说来看，虽然在时间的跨度上较大，不过在诸多细节方面仍然能够较好的表现出自己独道的内容，即使选材是有点争议的黑手党题材，略带童话色彩的画风和音乐也能够渲染出一种温馨细腻的日常风格，并且在人物的塑造上能够较好的把控性格，回避了乙女游戏一贯存在的性格过于偏激的问题。本作推荐给喜欢温馨细腻风格乙女游戏的玩家。
[/quote]
[/quote]
[quote]
加入[url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ADZZW#]爱の榨汁屋[/url]&关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34815366/]爱の鉴赏家[/url]，用爱品鉴世间作品，用心流淌真情实感。
[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198412526567', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1581323006}
review:
虽然我点了推荐，但是游戏体验相当差。

没有中文需要打补丁，但是epilogue和the grand end以及Caesar end没有汉化需要啃英文。因为是黑手党设定里面用词很多非常生僻，都是意大利式英文，但是有些地方翻译的还可以，令人会心一笑。（WE NEED CHINESE!）

画面满分，童话感很足，人物表情刻画的很传神。只有75%配音差评，女主没有配音差评。演出效果负分，神（精病）一样的转场，情节断片化，这一秒人物还在剑拔弩张，下一秒黑屏了，然后大家都和和美美在一起？？？中间发生了什么，观众一脸懵逼。需要打二周目才出现第三人称视角的补充，强行拉长无意义的游戏时间，体验极差。大部分战斗剧情儿戏化，都是你来我往回合制，但是··· ···乙女游戏嘛，就不要求太多了。我第一遍因为没有专心刷一个人的好感而进入了哈梅尔线，但是这个人的线非常不适合第一遍走，要配合医生线和小红帽线才能体会到，反正进入NE的我简直是火冒三丈，因为我什！么！都！不！知！道！糟糕的叙事让我想当场放弃。我完全不知道发生了什么，哈梅尔之前做了啥？为什么会突然黑化？女主为什么突然喜欢上了他还为了他当了修女，这哪跟哪啊？（摔鼠标）

我最最不喜欢的还不是断片式表演，而是神奇的女主。失忆的女主我见多识广了，最著名的失忆症，黑蝶，等等，为了给玩家一个更好的代入感。但是抱歉，OZMAFIA!!里的女主Fuka完全没有给我代入感，因为这个角色太令人难以忍受了，愚蠢（这是我的雷点，我可以接受懦弱的，自私的，圣母的主角，但是我唯独不能接受愚蠢），并且愚蠢到近乎白痴的程度的，不仅如此，还非常没有眼力见，傻乎乎地做出一些伤害别人的事，在某些场景又会变得非常绿茶婊。于是我要强行扮演一个既没有智商也没有情商，完全靠别人的善意生活的女主？简直强行喂屎。

可攻略角色都非常可爱，这也是我打了推荐的原因。Oz家族的三个人真是太好了！我永远喜欢狮子先生！小红帽虽然不戳我但是他的线写的蛮好（[spoiler] Scarlet这个名字也太出戏了 ，ps,格林家族的双胞胎也有萌点，结合起原著感觉非常微妙，笑[/spoiler]），帕榭小姐非常帅气，百合赛高！大灰狼的线虽然不戳我但是他在epilogue里强行刷了一波好感。其他人就有点微妙了，各有各的雷点（sou的线要配合真相线才能体会到雷点在哪）。娼馆线的女主非常无脑，但是假如你熟悉王尔德的故事就会发现深深的虐点，[spoiler] 为了他人把自己的一切都奉献出去徒留了一具空壳的快乐王子和追求自由却被束缚在人渣手里的燕子，太惨了，道连格雷纯属人渣 [/spoiler]。医生线的女主非常婊，[spoiler] 但是罗宾汉有妻子这一点我觉得符合原著的，虽然这个故事里的妻子和玛丽安完全不一样[/spoiler] 。至于强行NRT的操作确实非常迷，逻辑也非常奇怪，NRT之后的初始对象也大度的不像话，但是意外的，只有走NRT才能获得高甜剧情？？？

与之前的脑残剧情相对的真相线才是全部游戏的精华，但是需要解锁所有人物的线之后才能进就非常令人烦躁。真相线虽然也有强行降智的成分，但是好歹也勉强自圆其说了。以下剧透[spoiler] 熟悉绿野仙踪故事的我熟练地给女主起了Dorothy的名字，结果！Kyrie说，你确定你真的失忆了吗？我建议你换一个名字，因为这个名字对我有特殊意义。得，我能猜到结局了。在grand end里，Dorothy真的非常可爱，我立马喜欢上了她，和Fuka完全不一样，我甚至可以理解奇利耶为什么会暗暗想，为什么回来的是你不是她了，因为Dorothy这个小姑娘比Fuka要成熟好多啊，哭，并且配音也可可爱爱。并且结合起op和部分医生线，真男主奇利耶真是得到了剧本娘的完全偏心，烘托的整个人物都立起来了，并且好戳人泪点。但是回过头一想他的线路就令人如鲠在喉了，太难受了。[/spoiler] 

人设喜爱程度：Caramia>Axel>Pashet>Manboy>Scarlet>其他（不含Kyrie)(这位真男主我对他感情非常复杂）
线路喜爱程度：epilogue>>Scarlet NE>Sou GE>Pashet NE>Brothel GE>Others

author: {'steamid': '76561198863573792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1527, 'last_played': 1580926027}
review:
其实有一说一真的挺不错的，配音人物性格（不包括NTR线）画风都很戳人。但是换乘劈腿才能上床并且剧情比纯爱的甜度还要高些这种事情真的不敢恭维。。如果不是真爱估计跑一趟换乘就讨厌一个人（）。当时第一次跑Axel的换乘对象的Caramia真的被气到了，怎么说，，不怕得罪人的说一句真的，挺招人讨厌的。但是在自己线里还可以，挺可爱的。

带上我女友滤镜我感觉Axel真的可以，反差也很可爱恋爱的时候也尽职尽责（？，吃醋的时候委屈的哭腔真的让我心疼飞了。（开始吹了

总之忽略一些让人不适的机制和女主一部分比较内个的性格，Oz值得玩。

我永远喜欢Axel！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198342805324', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1214, 'last_played': 1578441264}
review:
I’m glad I bought this on sale. After reading comments about the MC I wasn’t really concerned because I dealt with MC’s like her so that wasn’t a big deal. The story sounded good and I was excited to start reading it but…

I was very disappointed….

Story wise it was not good. I only have done one route and it was hard to read. You know the general gist of what’s going on but the rest is dialogue. The MC is so stupid that you can’t even connect with her and by the time I was just getting to know the guy he was like ‘I love you.’ No build up of the relationship just little events that happened here and there and by the time the credits came up I was like “What the hell just happened?” 

Things weren’t explained and some things happened way to fast. No descriptions on emotions or events (festivals) that went on. It was just like this is the event, a couple people from town with dialogue and done. You don’t feel involved in any way. Not with the person you choose, not the story and it’s just bland.

The only thing that is good about this is the music and art. I like the guys but I wish I knew more about them.

I’ll try to read more but it will be a slow process. I would recommend Hakuoki: Kyoto Winds and Hakuoki: Edo Blossoms if you want a good story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051194674', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 3370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2556, 'last_played': 1654468492}

author: {'steamid': '76561198098975934', 'num_games_owned': 6056, 'num_reviews': 273, 'playtime_forever': 245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 245, 'last_played': 1578220387}
review:
[spoiler]写在前面
这应该是我为数不多接触的乙女向游戏，有印象中的接触过的乙女向游戏就是大名鼎鼎的追梦游戏Blood Code。一开始感觉毕竟作为一个男生玩这种乙女向游戏应该会很膈应，结果玩起来居然感觉异常的良好（雾）。 [/spoiler]

前言

OZMAFIA!!是Poni-Pachet SY公司制作，由さとい担任原画的乙女向恋爱游戏。游戏于2013年发行，于2016年在steam上发售。Steam版游戏由ManagaGamer代理发行。

游戏的画风很细腻，而且音乐也很出色，基本上就是一大群帅哥围着主角一个人转，人物的细节画的还是挺不错的，而且人物的塑造方面不会给人那种人物像纸一样立不起来的感觉，人物形象有立体感。虽然并不是100%语音，女主的语音基本上全程没有，但是cv的配音基本上全程都在线，整体给人的感觉还是很不错的。

游戏简介

游戏的名字OZMAFIA，OZ是游戏中的黑手党家族的名字。游戏的主角，失去记忆的少女Fuka，孤身一人身在陌生的城市，结果遭到了不明身份的人的追杀。在这时候伸出援手的便是游戏名字中的OZ家族。说实话，这一开始的剧情，就给人一种浓浓的网络小说气息，但是千万别被游戏开头的简单剧情给迷惑了，这游戏有足足20+的结局，而且虽然这游戏吧可攻略男主的脸在我看来都差不多，但是不同的线路有不同的分支剧情和结局，其中有几条线的剧情甚至还有劈腿和百合。[spoiler]（这真的是乙女向游戏该有的东西么2333） [/spoiler]

游戏中的绝大多数出场角色基本上都是出自童话故事，如OZ家族的三巨头设定便是出自《绿野仙踪》，还有于《格林童话》、《穿鞋子的猫》、《罗宾汉》、《卖火柴的小女孩》等很多童话故事有关或者出自其中的人物。游戏中有三角路线，三角路线中主要由奥兹家族的caramia、kyrie、axel组成，其他人的路线都是个别路线。三角路线中第二个亲密度高的角色将成为情敌，然后会展开不同的剧情。

剧情

在剧情方面，由于我只玩了几条线路，并没有把全部的可攻略线路都解锁，我玩出来的几条线，有几条都是比较偏纯爱的恋爱线，听说解锁True ending需要每个可攻略角色都至少达成一个结局，Ground Ending需要达成全部的26个结局才能解锁。

女主的白纸设定其实有利有弊，虽然能够更好的让玩家把自己代入进去，但是现实中应该很少人会像主角这样的天然呆吧233。在攻略人物的期间，如果你在死心塌地的攻略某一个角色的时候一个不小心选错了选项，这就进入到了这游戏最有特色的劈腿环节了，会自动劈腿到另一个可攻略人物上。[spoiler]（其实看来挺不可思议的233333） [/spoiler]

游戏的好感度系统也较清晰易懂，好感度上升有很明显的提示，如果像走纯爱路线只需要跟着游戏的提示走就可以了。

总结

   这游戏是一个挺不错的乙女向游戏，画风吸引人，而且音乐制作也很不错，很契合场景。而且在立绘方面，一眼看过去全都是帅哥。就以上这几点就已经完美符合受众人群，虽然在人物语音方面做的还是不尽人意，没有做到100%的语音，但是cv配音水品在线，与场景契合度高。在剧情方面，游戏的可选择路线多，不同的路线也有不同的分支，而且多周目还有不同的内容，一些线路的剧情内容十分丰富，但有一些的内容实在是有些干瘪，毕竟可攻略人物太多，要做到一视同仁实在是有点困难。

   游戏的总评的话，满分10分，我觉得最少可以达到7分至8分，除了几个小的扣分项，其他方面还是很不错的。推荐人群的话，肯定是乙女玩家了，我觉得大部分的乙女玩家应该都能喜欢这个游戏。

[code]欢迎参观我的： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33217084]真实评测[/url]
喜欢这篇评论，也麻烦点个赞，让更多人能够看到。[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198124641464', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1577067865}
review:
TL;DR: If you don't care about the writing/story being bad so long as the characters look good, this is for you. Otherwise, I wouldn't recommend it.

THIS GAME HAS ENRAGED ME. I waited quite patiently for this to go on sale, because it's rather expensive in my currency. But upon finally getting it, I started to drag myself to play it... which felt wrong. It says 6 hours, but a couple of them I just forgot it running while doing something else. I went in blindly and managed to finish Caesar's route, which wasn't bad - it was rather cute. BUT!! It was not exactly satisfactory.

PROS:
-Beautiful art style and enjoyable character design. Although a bit too bright at times, the style really fits the fairytale setting.
-Nice voice acting.
-Many endings and characters to pursuit
-Good translation job - didn't feel awkward while reading even though I didn't enjoy the writing.

CONS:
-The first disappointment was regarding the port itself - that made playing fullscreen a no go, because it becomes too pixelated. I think it was important to get a proper fullscreen to make the beautiful art enjoyable.
-Do I need to talk about those annoying fake loading screens? Is there anyone who enjoyed that?
-THE WRITING: whenever something seemed to be going somewhere, it got axed. Chopped. Cut out of the screen. This made the writing feel rushed and shallow... and boring at the same time; 
-Story: it seemed promising, but the bad writing made it a waste;
-FUKA (or whatever name you give her): she's your typical cute, happy go lucky, dumb shoujo manga heroine whose whole personality is based on not having a personality. 

I could go on, but that would make it seem even more like I'm picking on the game. Perhaps I just went in with the wrong mentality, thinking it would be a more serious game, when it doesn't seem to be it. For the time being, I don't think I'll be playing it again anytime soon...

author: {'steamid': '76561198964324677', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2509, 'last_played': 1661660776}
review:
OZMAFIA!! is one of the better otome games that I've played. Even though the MC is your typical otome protagonist, the other characters, all the main guys, were unique. The route for each guy was interesting, and the character development was really good. The only downside is to get all the endings, you have to play some of the routes multiple times. So, if you're the kind of player that wants to get every image in the game and see the full ending, you'll need to replay this game multiple times. After a while, it's annoying playing the same routes over and over, so prepare for that. 

As mentioned, each guy is unique and brings something new to the game with each route. Also, this game isn't short like some otome games, so I do feel you get your money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135198923', 'num_games_owned': 2677, 'num_reviews': 360, 'playtime_forever': 7437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7437, 'last_played': 1576593677}
review:
[h1]前言[/h1] 

从本作的名字就大概能知道游戏的内容和童话世界相关，可攻略的三角线与个别路线角色也大多与童话相关：
①OZ三巨头设定明显出自《绿野仙踪》
②格林家族（人物原设出自格林童话，作者为格林兄弟或经由格林兄弟进行收集改编收录）
   Hameln（花衣魔笛手）
   Scarlet（小红帽）
   不可攻略角色：Gretel和Hansel（糖果屋）
③长靴家族Pashet（Puss）（穿靴子的猫）（百合线）
④娼馆线（取自奥斯卡·王尔德的著作）Dorian·Gray（道连·格雷的画像），Alfani（快乐王子中的王子），Manboy（快乐王子中的燕子）
⑤医生线（Sherwood舍伍德森林，即罗宾汉居住处）Robin Hood（罗宾汉）
⑥可攻略角色Caesar和So（Wolfgang或沃尔夫冈）出处未知
其他不可攻略角色比如海蒂家的Heidi（海蒂），安徒生家族Ande（卖火柴的小女孩），Aelling（丑小鸭），Melisus（拇指姑娘）取自的作品基本都是广为人知耳熟能详的故事。

而且本作曾经出过总长度12集的泡面番，有兴趣的话可以快乐的吸一吸。
（似乎也出过舞台剧，但是资源好像并不是那么好找。）

[h1]剧情与攻略建议与正经吐槽[/h1] 

基本剧情就是失忆的女主不知道因为点什么突然被不知道哪个大帅哥追杀，然后大帅哥一拥而上把女主给救了，然后女主就在那住下来推推剧情[strike]劈劈腿[/strike]，每周全勤选择路线，最后抱得帅哥归（Pashet是百合线，除外），然后推着推着最后就了解到或是胃疼或是裹着一口玻璃碴子的糖的真相了。
但具体甜度因人而异，对于我个人来讲，哪怕是娼馆线都很有意思，更不用提那对于我来说简直是闻所未闻见所未见的乘换劈腿系统了，简直是太有趣了。（汤川学脸：実に面白い。）

因为游戏是全年龄向的所以其实就算是HE也十分清水（虽然成功乘换或者娼馆线可能会有点超出清水范围的鬼畜内容），而且二周目攻略同一角色会追加新剧情，所以在攻略之前建议提前规划好攻略顺序以及攻略方向。
（True End需要所有可攻略角色都至少达成一个结局，Ground End需要达成所有26个结局，进入方法为标题画面女主角Fuka手中的书。注：True End略虐）

设定方面采用了一张白纸失忆女主设定（虽然有点天然[strike]呆[/strike]黑元素），还独特的加入了主动劈腿系统，如果一方好感度没有某一方好感度高，自动劈腿，继续吃糖，而且劈腿线比正常路线爆点还要多甜度还要高，但若是专心想要攻略某个角色然后一不小心选错了点什么突然劈腿可能就会觉着这设定鬼畜极了，虽然对于我来说觉着其实还好，可能是因为我个人对有毒的东西免疫已久。
再一个就是[spoiler]剧本可能会强行喂屎，而且还是喂得猝不及防戛然而止那种，具体怎么喂的可以推一下医生线或者Hameln线自行懵逼。[/spoiler] 
好感度获取方面其实比较容易得到提示（如果想走纯爱线就选有提示音的选项就行了，走劈腿纯爱线[spoiler]（……）[/spoiler]的话初期选择没有提示音的选项，进入路线后选择有提示音的选项即可。）

[h1]总结[/h1] 

其实本作在当年确实算得上是乙女游戏良作了（虽然跳过票），音乐和画风细腻，立绘不管怎么看都是大帅哥，一颦一笑牵动人心，堪称一绝，哪怕是放在现在也毫不逊色。虽然并不是全语音，但两个真相线里女主有语音，且CV配合场景演出水准始终在线，这一点也导致了曾经有人吐槽剧情时候说颜和声音不要可以送人23333
故事线很多，结局也很多，CG也很多，一些路线写的十分丰满，能让人快乐到原地转圈，另一些路线又写的过于简单有些草率有些牵强，所以很难去直接定义剧本到底写的是好还是不好，这点就仁者见仁吧。

如果硬是让我说个推荐人群的话，我觉得应该是“善于接受新事物的有耐心的能把游戏当作崭新体验的乙女玩家”吧。

[code]欢迎参观我的： [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7421824]双鱼星✪ω✪皇家飛机场[/url]
如果你喜欢这篇评论，也麻烦点个赞，让更多人能够看到。[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198187102897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3746, 'last_played': 1575967157}
review:
It was a long journey, yes...but after full completion in 62 hours, OZMAFIA!! remains one of my favorite otoges on PC.

I won't say it's because of the plot though. Though the plot is pretty good, it's full of holes to the point where it gets annoying. What drew me in is the magical atmosphere. Ozmafia takes place in a fantastical town where a cast of quirky characters based off Western fairy tales roam, with most of them being mafia members who reside in different famiglias. In the main group, there's our typical bishounens--the outgoing and friendly "prince" type (Caramia), the quiet and sincere tsundere (Axel), and my favorite, the intelligent, sadistic af troll Kyrie. Oh, Kyrie. I love you, but I hate you, but I love you...Moving on. These men are in charge of the Oz famiglia, and they take the heroine under their wing as she struggles to regain her lost memories. The other characters besides the big three are also great, and I enjoyed seeing them interact amongst themselves as well as with the main group.

Now as for the heroine herself, who I'm sure has become infamous among the otoge community. MC is just...a total moron. I'm pretty sure being innocent and naive does not excuse an MC to do the dumbest things to the point where she practically needs adult supervision despite being a grown-*ss adult herself. Still, overall she's not a terrible heroine. She still has positivity and sunshine going about for her, which isn't bad at all, and it's endearing to see how the guys change because of her influence.

I like how Ozmafia doesn't shy away from drama and tragedy in its plot. Although sometimes it can be a bit much--the brothel route almost made me barf from how unabashedly explicit it was, and there was a very detailed description of a violent act at one part--which can be off-putting to the whole atmosphere. However, this shows that Ozmafia isn't simply just a romance game, but also has a strong theme of war and underlying politics. Thus, you'll get a pretty epic otoge.

The music is nice, with a few tracks that pleasantly surprised me (one of them is Caesar's theme) and the OP and ED both. However, the best part of the game hands-down for me is the absolutely gorgeous art. I'm a sucker for soft, romantic artstyles so Ozmafia's was right up my alley (and the artist also did the art for Diabolik Lovers!). As for the routes, there are plenty to suit your individual tastes, but I do feel that the game suffered from a case of "quantity over quality". A few of those routes could have been left out in my opinion.

Still, I feel that Ozmafia was worth the number of hours that I sank into it. The setting was lovely, the characters were great, and it transported me away to a magical world with a healthy dose of action and heart-fluttering romance. I definitely recommend it for anyone who wants a little enchantment in their lives. <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198015337272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3113, 'last_played': 1575846125}

author: {'steamid': '76561198879201842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1581557804}
review:
Solo terminé una ruta y creo que va a pasar tiempo antes de empezar otra.

El arte es hermoso y me gustaron las (pocas) escenas con voces. Más allá de eso, el juego era simplemente un día tras día en donde nunca pasaba nada. Cuando parecía que iba a haber algún evento interesante la escena terminaba y te llevaban al día siguiente. La protagonista siempre está feliz o disculpándose, no tiene ni un poco de sentido común y jamás pude ponerme en su lugar porque era simplemente estresante lo vacía en personalidad que era, aún para los estándares de los otomes. El romance -repito, solo hice una ruta hasta ahora- me pareció forzado y salido de la nada, y el final ni hablar-- me dio la sensación de que el juego ni había empezado cuando salieron los títulos. La última escena después de estos era igual de vacía.

author: {'steamid': '76561198860397279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 369, 'last_played': 1592534849}
review:
I love the interactions between the three main male leads. The female lead is a little to innocent for my taste. I know she's lost her memory but she's very naive and way too nice. 
The artwork is nicely rendered with no spelling or grammatical errors so far. 
The pacing is a little faster than what I'm used to when playing this type of game on my phone. This could be due to the fact that you can read the story straight through instead of a limited scenes per day. But that's definitely a plus.
Looking forward to reading all the endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329103786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 701, 'last_played': 1624728132}
review: The art style and feel of the game is lovely overall. The plots of the different story lines are very well thought out and the characters make you fall in love with them quickly. Love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095200246', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1887, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1887, 'last_played': 1573407643}
review:
Eine sehr schöne Visual Novel mit vielerlei Optionen und diversen Enden von tragisch zu absolut romantisch und allem dazwischen. Der Aufhänger am "Zauberer von OZ" mit der Mischung von Mafia-Elementen ist zu Beginn zwar etwas ungewohnt, aber gelungen. Man erkennt auch sofort Vogelscheuche, Löwe und Blechmann, bloß mit Toto habe ich mich bis zum Schluss geirrt. Und man fragt sich anfänglich, wie es Figuren wie "Heidi" und "Robin Hood" in die Geschichte geschafft haben. Aber keine Angst, (fast) jegliche Frage wird aufgeklärt und alles ergibt zum Schluss im Rahmen der vorgeschriebenen Welt Sinn.

Nur 2-3 der Enden (von gut über 20) sind für mich nicht wirklich nachvollziehbar und Unsinn, was in Anbetracht der Anzahl und im Vergleich zu manch anderen Visual Novels wirklich wenig ist.

Die (rein japanische) Synchronisation ist sehr gelungen und es ist sehr viel vertont, wenn auch nicht alles.

Dieses Spiel gehört zu den besseren Visual Novels und ein Blick lohnt sich auf jeden Fall, wenn man auf dieses Genre steht.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094971423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2523, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2252, 'last_played': 1671552271}
review: Gorgeous artwork, interesting characters and many many many choices to multiple endings make up an entertaining game. The setting is compelling although the actual plot is somewhat lacking. The heroine is very much your typical vn protaganist - a blank slate with little to no personality for you to project yourself onto. Despite this its an enjoyable time and if you like visual novels this is one I recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148527544', 'num_games_owned': 2807, 'num_reviews': 451, 'playtime_forever': 454, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 454, 'last_played': 1571158678}
review:
[quote]用黑色译作背景，用文章谱写铭记 
欢迎光临我们的网站 [url=https://www.blacklist.ink/]黑名鉴赏[/url] 
点击关注我们发现更多好游戏 [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/9619592-Blacklist_//]黑名组[/url] 点击加入我们 [url=https://steamcommunity.com/groups/Blacklistgroup_/]黑名单[/url][/quote]

[h1]前言[/h1]

本作是Poni-Pachet SY公司制作由著名的黄油大厂MangaGamer发行的一款乙女恋爱游戏。本作最早发行是2013年，而且已经有了衍生动画，虽然是泡面番，不过因为是学园欢乐向也可以体验到游戏中不会有的另一种风格，而且游戏作品是乙女向，但番不是，如果对乙女接受不了的可以去体验体验番剧哦，虽然是腐向的...

[h1]剧情[/h1]

简单说一下剧情吧，就是说女主失忆，在这个什么都陌生的小镇上，开局就被一个狼人（大帅哥）追杀，说着“你是我的猎物”这种话，女主就拼命的跑，然后邂逅了狮子（大帅哥）稻草人（大帅哥）反正都是大帅哥把女主给救了下来，之后被他们收留（绑架）的女主慢慢的了解到了这个小镇并不太平和家族纷争之类的事，并且在接下来通过了解各种大帅哥，和他们加深感情，推进剧情，慢慢的得知最后的“真相”。

说到剧本本作的线路很多，并且还有好感度的设定，文字量也是海量，想要完整体验还是最好按着攻略来，但要说剧本好不好，我只能说如果你想体验轻松甜蜜的恋爱之旅那最好还是三思一下，有很多的情节可能会令你适得其反，你可能会看到一个本来很清纯的女主人公突然转变了画风，一堆严肃认真设定的各有气质的大帅哥们互相过家家的打架（玩游戏），我也说不清楚这款游戏究竟适合什么样的女玩家，毕竟我是个男的，硬要说的话如果你喜欢ntr，喜欢装纯，把男性代入女性，把女性代入男性，没有多么高要求，那么你可能会喜欢这部作品？相比于光鲜亮丽的美术，本作的剧本实在是没有达到我心目中的要求，但毕竟是童话风格，就是应该儿戏一些，对吧？[strike]对个屁，剧本有毒[/strike]

[h1]画面&音乐[/h1]

本作最大的亮点其实就是画风和音乐这一块了，由さとい担任原画，就是风闻小镇那位画师，独特又柔和舒适的画风带来的视觉体验极佳，除此之外由Article One演唱的《I love you more》也是令人印象深刻，占了篇幅75%左右的cv配音其实也深得我心，相对于有毒的剧本来说本作在画面和音乐方面的水准绝对是超额了，但唯独就是“真相”之前的那些线路和情节会令你困惑不堪，莫得办法。这些加起来如果说你问原价购买值不值我肯定会说值，毕竟国区挺便宜的，但我得提醒一下，游戏全程英文，如果你想啃那么需要有足够的英语水平，其实我也找不到汉化补丁，我也没辙了。

[h1]总结[/h1]

本作拥有数量足够且质量很高的cg，并且画面风格也非常的适合各种口味的人群，另外音乐方面和配音方面的演出水准也非常的高，并且各色人物对应的线路也很多，玩家的选择可以影响剧本的走向。但本作的剧情上确实有诸多不足，特别的挑剔玩家，如果说你能接受得了上述的种种问题，那么我还是推荐你来体验的。

author: {'steamid': '76561198111029487', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1406, 'last_played': 1569439200}
review:
I hate this one. I hate how it seems to have everything in it to be actually good, but isn't. I am torn. I like the characters, I like the fact that there are tons of characters to romance, I like the routes (though some of them are just painful - looking at you, Doc), and while I wouldn't say that the overall plot is all that interesting, it's not so bad as to make me drop the game completely. There is, however, one glaring issue with this VN - and it's its main character. 

I am no stranger to otomes with bland MCs with no free will of their own - it's something that often cannot be avoided in this particular genre. I'm not a fan, but it's usually okay. Unfortunately, in OZMAFIA!! we get that same bland MC with no free will of her own - but this time, she has one (1) defining characteristic: she's endearingly stupid. Yes. That is her feature. Stupid, ignorant, naive and incredibly sweet. Nice mix, wouldn't you say? So nice, in fact, that instead of a more or less mature female protagonist we end up with an oversized child as our main character. Do you see?

In this game, you're basically playing as a child. 

Cute? Hell no. Wrong on so many levels.

And this is precisely why I can't deal with this game.
I will finish it, but it brings me no joy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045044687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1441, 'last_played': 1569262604}
review:
The main character is seriously unlikable, no personality of her own and she just kinda just bumbles along with no real thoughts of her own (so to speak).
The romance options feel forced, all the guys are boring in their own right. The only route that I actually enjoyed was the "best friend" endings.

author: {'steamid': '76561198452071885', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 321, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 258, 'last_played': 1567950778}
review:
[quote] [h1] [b]简介：[/b] [/h1] 曾几何时，一个女孩，和她的宠物狗与三个同伴开始了一个旅程，去见一个可以满足他们愿望的伟大巫师。 但如果这个女孩不相信“没有像家一样的地方”呢？ 通过十几条路线和20多个结局探索童话般的世界！[/quote]
[quote] [h1] [b]体验：[/b] [/h1]OZMAFIA是一款由Poni-Pachet SY开发，MangaGamer发行的一款女性向恋爱ADV。
[quote] 前排提示：本体是2013年发售的日语版，2016年英化后上架steam，不支持中文。暂时没有steam版试用的补丁，但是有游戏本体的补丁，解压后全部放进根目录，然后用新的执行文件就行。缺点就是steam上无法记录运行时间。

pan。 Baidu。com/s/1N-AIPCJ2IttdXUhCG-9_7Q 提取码：ux7x
 [/quote]
2016年7月6日，一部叫做OZMAFIA的泡面番在BILIBILI上独家上映了，讲的是男主人公Scarlet转学到了奥兹学园，被卷入了某件麻烦事。在他面前出现并帮助他的是，Caramia、Kyrie、Axel这三人。学园风加上可爱的萌系画风吸引了很多人的关注，虽然短的连泡面都煮不熟，但的确是一部值得一看的泡面番。

其实这部泡面番并不是全原创，三位主角都是来自同名的女性向视觉小说，只是背景世界观和故事完全变了。原来的女主fuka也被新男主Scarlett替代了。虽然每集很短,但都表现出了性格特点。亦是因为世界观全部重构，这部泡面番是一部无论是新人还是游戏玩家都能看得下去的优质动画。

接下来讲一下游戏本体，游戏讲述的是失去记忆的无名少女，在陌生的城市里彷徨不安。她突然被人追杀，帮助她的是支配这个城市的黑手党家族奥兹家族。勇敢的狮子，狡猾的稻草人，不懂人情世故的铁皮樵夫，被这样的他们保护会展开一段什么样的故事呢？

阅剑知其主，游戏名OZMAFIA，OZ意为奥兹家族，而mafia意为黑手党，可以说是有点官配的意思。

从介绍中就可以知道，本作隐射了弗兰克·鲍姆著的童话绿野仙踪，但仔细想想，却又并不违和。稻草人——一心想要得到能够思索的脑子。铁皮人——一味想要一颗活跃的心的伐木工。狮子——拼命想要获得勇气的胆小鬼。和本作中三位主角有异曲同工之妙。

其实本作中含有的童话并不只有绿野仙踪一部，还有诸如小红帽，罗宾逊等童话梗，看似简单，但其实世界观非常大。

游戏的线路文本量挺大的，但没有较好的节奏感，使得部分流程免不了有些无聊。个人不太喜欢的是在不同线路中女主的性格会有变化。游戏总体故事先苦后甜，结尾质量不错。

最为亮眼的其实是本作的画风，曾经画过风闻小镇的さとい老师的原画质量非常的高，有一种赛璐璐的感觉，立绘和CG也是同样的优秀。但是可惜的是本作虽然有CV但是配乐不全。
 [/quote][quote] [h1] [b]附加：[/b] [/h1]
喜欢本作的玩家可以尝试一下PSV版的移植作品OZMAFIA!!-vivace。PSV版比起PC原版来说进步了很多，最为直观的便是全CV，UI也是为了适应psv而重构了，甚至连背触都用上了。PSV版还增加了许多可攻略角色，基本上所有角色都可攻略，但是因为文本量巨大，节奏感不佳的问题被扩大了。

[/quote]
[quote] [h1] [b]总结：[/b] [/h1] OZMAFIA是一款由Poni-Pachet SY开发，MangaGamer发行的一款女性向恋爱ADV。赛璐璐风的原画非常出色，立绘和CG也是同样的优秀。游戏新奇的融入了许多童话故事的角色并把他们融入在一个世界观内。本作文本量很大，但没有较好的节奏感，使得部分流程免不了有些无聊，且没有全CV。喜欢女性向ADV的小伙伴可以尝试一下。 [/quote]

欢迎关注[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33741419/]黄油大师鉴赏家[/url]，查看趣味性评测
各种类型应有尽有。加入我们，搜寻更多精品游戏吧！[/quote]

author: {'steamid': '76561198263130906', 'num_games_owned': 1429, 'num_reviews': 1191, 'playtime_forever': 548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 542, 'last_played': 1567520718}
review:
一名失忆的少女出现在了一个家族斗争严重的城镇，少女将会遇到怎样的邂逅，又将倾心于哪位男士？乙女向AVG游戏《OZMAFIA!!》讲述的便是这样一个故事。游戏画面精良，画风接近水彩手绘，观感极佳，佐以专业且诱人的配音，卖相相当出色。但与其精致的外表相对的却是略为微妙的剧情，各路线基本都有各种神操作看不懂的片段，令人一言难尽。

[h1]耳目一新的音画[/h1]

音画作为一款AVG的主要外包装，作为吸引玩家的第一要点，其质量直接关系着玩家想不想去玩、游玩时体验如何，而这款游戏在其外表上无疑做得相当漂亮。画风上虽然仍算是日式萌系画风，但其风格却和常见的日系作品相去甚远。画面上色细腻，过渡自然，整体饱和度偏低，有种水彩或是彩铅的感觉，看上去极为舒适柔和。具体到角色，发梢和表情的绘制特别值得称赞，尤其是不同角色之间富含感情的表情。和立绘相比，CG的质量还要更胜一筹，CG中淡化了线条感，使得人物和环境的结合更加自然，观感也更舒适。且不论质量，9名男性角色都有四张起步的CG，在数量方面也是诚意满满。
游戏的BGM和画面相同，数量质量皆有保证，在众多场合都有切合时宜的背景音乐烘托气氛。加上那首动听的主题曲"I love you more"，着实是种享受。（好感UP的选项会有特殊音效也是一个很人性的小细节）

[h1]一言难尽的剧情[/h1]

游戏的画面和剧情简直就是两个极端，画面有多舒服，剧情就有多难受。游戏流程中，玩家需要不时选择该时间想要见面的男性，并在对话中选择选项，增加好感度，推进剧情。游戏角色众多，线路繁杂，各个线路的男性会给玩家带来不同的体验，但有一点绝对是相同的，膈应的体验。游戏中的各条线路中，大量充斥着儿戏一般的家族斗争、NTR、撩骚有家室的男人、莫名其妙的XXX等等内容，带来的体验极差。走这条线走的好好儿的，哎，线路突然就转到那个人身上去了，整个感觉就好像在刷自己的职业本，莫名其妙掉了其他职业的装备一样。一条线NTR也就算了，更虎的是几条线都有这种狗屎发展，哦豁！女主到底是个清纯女生还是个心机bitch，我作为玩家已经搞不懂了。纵观各条线路，各有各的shi，对于三观正常，寻求甜美爱情故事的玩家，这款游戏的剧情宛如毒药。

[h1]总结[/h1]

优点和缺点都相当明显的一款作品，外表精良，内在诡异，仿佛一块精致的糕点，里面塞的馅料却是黑暗料理。对于想要放松地感受一段温馨美好地感情的玩家，这款作品并不是一个很好的选择。

以上测评仅供参考，只代表个人意见
