author: {'steamid': '76561198383257163', 'num_games_owned': 42, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3285, 'last_played': 1537709465}
review:
VERY SATISFYING! The art is so soft and pleasing to look at! The story is great too! I love the reference to fairy tales, not just wizard of oz, but also hansel and gretel, ugly duckling, red riding hood, puss in boots, heidi, hamelin's flute, etc. 

Best of all is the GRAND ENDING! It solves the mystery and actually (kind of) end it, not make more mystery~

author: {'steamid': '76561198145922147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 14388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14387, 'last_played': 1571541582}
review:
Really enjoyed game up until the bug happened. The art work is great. 


I play alot of Otome games and the amount of time I HAD to spend on this game only to get disappointed is astounding. Found out there's a bug- specifically for AXEL IMAGE 5. That you can't always get. So I just went ahead and played the rest of the characters hoping that It'd show up if I Played through again.  WRONNNGGG. 
This game has NTR- which I just discovered was a thing. 
I did genuinely enjoy most of the characters- but there was uh- some cases of clear sexual assault that other people have reviewed up before.
I am honestly but upset right now that I AM STUCK at 95% because even though I went through AXELS route at least 20 separate  times now. Trying to get that last image to get bumped up to 98 for the grand ending, it's not going to happen because of a bug. 
So I am very upset that I can't finish this game, considering the amount of time and money I spent on this. Other people have also apparently had issues with this but it's not been taken care of yet apparently. I pretty much have given up on this game. When It gets an update I may try again, but until I can 100% get the grand ending it's not worth it. So I wasted money on a game that took me forever to even get through. 

I know I've gotten all the ending, just not trigging the final CG for bitter sweet because it has the dialog. 

There should be an option to get the grand ending just based on how much of the route you finished not the CGS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198815538730', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3497, 'last_played': 1581318246}
review:
놀라운 플레이 타임...지금도 캐릭터 한 2명인가 남았는데 큰일났네요 그래도 다행인건 공통 루트가 길어서(엄청 깁니다 진짜임 근데 심지어 루트 바뀌면 중간에 새 스토리 나옴) 두번째 플레이할 때는 스킵하면 나름...빠르다..?그리구 가장 무서운 것은 바로 한번 플레이한 루트를 다시 플레이할 때 원래는 없었던 스토리가 나온다는 것이죠! 이게 뭔 말이냐면 스토리 진행하다 보면 왜 여기서 이렇게 스킵이 되지 이런 생각이 드는 부자연스러운 부분이 있어요. 이런 부분은 그 뒷이야기가 처음 플레이할 때는 안 나오고 두번째 플레이할 때 나오는데요.. 이런 부분이 공통루트의 캐릭터 선택지마다 거의 다 있는데다가 개별 루트별로 또 있어서... 똑같은 루트를 두번 해야 할 수도 있다...이겁니다. 저같은 루트 수집 완벽주의자는 지뢰에요..그리고 충격과 공포의 그 엔딩은...저는 이미 알고 가서 나름 괜찮았지만 암튼 엔딩이 불만족스러울 수 있으시다는 점 알고 사시는게...정신건강에 좋아요! 영어는 그렇게 어렵진 않았구요. 아 그리고 부분 보이스인 건 아시겠지만 플레이하다보면 보이스가 짜요...네..짭니다. 더 듣고 싶은데 읎어요^^개별 루트 들어가면 좀 많아지는데 공통..네엡 그렇습니다
그리고 이 모든걸 중화시켜주는 개쩌는 작화만이 그저 빛이였다...앞으로 있을지 모르겠지만 이 게임 플레이하실 분들 파이팅!

author: {'steamid': '76561198853215681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3490, 'last_played': 1564658854}
review: Love it. The game is amazing and well-made. The characters are all very nice and they have interesting backgrounds. The plot and the story can be a little confusing at the start, but if you are patient till the end, the things revealed will surprise you completely!! The epilogue and grand finale broke my heart!!! I definitely recommend it to real otome games fans! You can't miss such a brilliant game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049079829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4344, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3949, 'last_played': 1565252577}
review:
What do I do with the overflowing feelings Ozmafia gave me? Felt like I truly lived in a town with everyone in this story - I laughed at the usual banter in this new home; smiled for the kindness everyone showed me; felt troubled at times because of them; felt deeply worried for the troubles they faced; and finally, cried hysterically at the end of it all. It's true when they say some parts are flawed. It was definitely awkward at times! But deep down, I will always remember this world as a home filled with warmth and happiness. I wish I could keep reliving this game feeling as blessed by it as I am now. 

Not all routes are perfect, but they all further shape characters and their story. The story further fleshes out when you replay for other endings and finally the epilogue and grand finale. 

OZMAFIA!! is like a magical puzzle. Each character is like a blurry puzzle piece. Each puzzle piece you place down, it clears up ever so slightly. Then, when you place the final puzzle piece, it bursts with unexpected colors. It truly shines at the end of it all, but it takes a bit of patience and effort. To me, it was definitely worth it.

Please support this game and try it! And if you do try it, please consider taking your time to go through each ending to unlock the grand finale. 

Have a memorable journey!
------------------------------------------------------------
Forewarning: There is lots of slice of life, NTR, 2 instances of drug use, 1 route of sexual enslavement in this game.

Looking forward to the prequel, OZMAFIA!!0 -RefleXion-. 
Thank you for the lovely experience you gave me, Poni-Pachet SY and MangaGamer!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053835513', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 864, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 864, 'last_played': 1560709425}
review:
I've been playing this game for one year, on and off, and I still can't read it all. On my second playthrough I found myseld smashing that skip button and dreading to get through the common route sequences. I hated the common route, despite the interesting premise, I hated most of the "fluffy" interactions between Fuka and the Famiglia Oz. The common route just seems to lack any focus and does whatever it pleases at the moment; you are just getting through some weekly routines and then interacting with the guy of your choice during the weekend, and this repeats itself until Week 10 or so and then something happens. I found it hard to take the drama seriously though because the tone of the game seems all over the place. It is a strange game. 
For that reason, my first route (Caramia's) took so long to complete. Then I did Scarlet's. I enjoyed his character much more than any of the Oz guys and the romance was very cute, but the problem was that the romance was at the stage of a strange unconfessed crush until the very end, unlike with Caramia who had a solid relationship with Fuka. Then I started doing Brothel and got bored and stopped playing, even though I try to be a completionist with visual novels and read all the content available, actually read it and relive the story through different routes. In most cases this leads to some kind of a true route, and this game has some a grand finale that explains everything. I really wanted to get to that point, but the unfocused common route skipping got so boring that I am probably not coming back to it any soon.
It has its pros: the music, the voice acting, and the art style, but otherwise I just can't get into it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358819566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 1594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1482, 'last_played': 1585420057}

author: {'steamid': '76561198140699908', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2363, 'last_played': 1567264743}
review:
I adore this game. Visually it's a delight. Story wise it reads just like a shojo! There are SO MANY romance options. And while its a fairly long game it doesn't drag on like some otome games. Plus it really does have replay value in the fact that the stories are just so much fun, and that once you have finished a route the game rewards replay by adding in new text to that route! 

Usually with visual novels I am hesitant to pay upwards of AUD$30. However with Ozmafia I'm currently about 40 hours in and still have yet to complete all the possible routes. I mean Id still suggest waiting for a sale, but if you are impatient and have enough money to pay full price its probably still worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198865434147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2183, 'last_played': 1563075509}
review:
第一篇测评给我在steam上第一个全通关全cg的游戏（可惜没有奖杯啊什么的）
真相线真的值得一看！虐的我眼泪都要掉下来了！虽然要每个角色至少通一个结局才能在开始界面点女主的那个书
看完真相线再点一次那个书可以看GE，缓解一下被虐的心情

和其它人看法一样，优缺点都非常明显
画风非常美，立绘和cg都非常好看
剧情的话没看真相线给三分（满分五分），看了TE，GE之后四分！
真相线真的值得一看，毕竟这个游戏也不算很便宜，看完不白买啊！
糖度非常少，满是玻璃渣的暗黑童话，我只在Caesar线和Caramia线感受到一些糖。。。Axel貌似还行但不是我的菜所以几乎全程快进，没怎么看他的剧情，还有劈腿线也有一些糖，但也没有很多qaq，如果为了磕糖玩这个就算了
词汇的话大二狗觉得大学水平就够用，没什么特别难的词，实在不行可以下一个词典，而且这个英文版据说翻得不错

缺点也很突出，一直转场叮叮咚咚的真的很烦
有些剧情这个线二周目才可以看，意味着最好这个线先跑NE再跑HE，要不然可能觉得对方好感度来的莫名其妙的
对于一条线不跑二遍的姐妹来说可能不太友好
还有个人原因不太喜欢劈腿系统，对我来说这个也算雷点吧，劈腿完必啪怎么回事！明明前面还是全年龄劈完腿就R15了
而且主系统也没什么特别的，想攻略谁一直选他就可以了，选到正确的选项会有提示的声音

以下有一点点剧透

从因为狮子的立绘种草这个游戏到现在已经好几年了，当时以为是那种甜甜的披着童话皮的黑手党家族恋爱故事，现在才觉得当时的自己是多么的天真
不过作为表官配，Caramia真的太可爱了！拔枪的时候那个角度看蜜汁像宋仲基，而且个人线HE是全篇唯一一个结婚结局！最后cg笑起来那么好看！！！跑完他的线都不想跑别人的线了，不忍心看他难过啊，失去笑容
里官配好像是Caesar，当时刚跑完娼馆线心情无比复杂，跑他的线瞬间被治愈了，应该是全篇最甜的线了，傲娇，口嫌体正直，为了女主跑去端盘子简直可爱到不行
然后是真官配Kyrie，刚玩的时候不是特别喜欢他，感觉女主追着他跑，他并不是特别喜欢女主，不过看完TE，最长情背负最多的也是他，果然太聪明背负的烦恼也多啊
还有剩下的三巨头Axel，喜欢吃糖这一点还是挺可爱的！面上看着很正经但内心一点都不正经！！
剩下的都没什么糖，Pashet的HE还行！搞姬使我快乐！Scar的两个结局对我来说都不算HE。其他人更是俩结局都像喂玻璃渣，娼馆线的描写确定不是R18？顺便学了很多词哈哈哈，除了没有cg和声音以外光看描写一点都不像全年龄。

Hameln真的太惨了！！！多萝西真的太惨了！！！

总体还行，虽然玩到后期都没耐心了，但看完真相觉得，没中途放弃真的太好了！

Horrible

Déjà, de manière générale, la moitié du temps, les persos sont pas doublés, on ne sait pas pourquoi.
Y'a quasiment pas de cute scène (les belles scènes en plein écran).

Ensuite, les romances elles même :
Certaines sont tout juste moyennes, comme celle d'Axel et d'autres sont nulles comme celle de Caesar, faut vraiment être maso la et la PIRE c'est celle de Robin Hood ! Serieux !!!!! 
Elle est tellement glauque ! Une horreur !
Fuyez

review: Great game. I like the different storylines and the charming design of characters and so one. Sometimes I was a little bit confused by the main character (she's not the brightest light on the sky), but the epilogue explained it very well. Still, I'm a little bit frustrated by the grand ending. It feels unfinished for me and a bit of all-of-a-sudden - also not very happy ending though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198122696677', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3442, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3442, 'last_played': 1562076585}
review:
So after finally completing all routes and CG's I can say this game was quite worth my time.
The music is nice, fitting and doesn't overpower or get annoying.
The art is good, the voice acting is high quality and overall it's a nice experience.

I mainly got annoyed by the main character but I feel like this is the same character type most of these games use so it gets a pass on that. I've played these type of games enough to be used to it (But it is a nice surprise when it doesn't follow the same format)
The translation was done well for the most part. There were some mistakes I noticed but nothing a regular player would see right away or get bothered by (Foolish fool made me laugh pretty hard)

One of the things that bothered me was the lack of explanation of who the amnesiac character was. This question keeps hanging in every single route and it started bothering me for a while until I got to the Epilogue and grand final endings. Of course it's quite obvious who the MC is or seems to be but some extra stuff in the 20+ routes there are would be cool. Ceasar declaring the MC as his prey is still a questionmark for me however. Don't think they handled that well. 

Also I recommend playing Soh as your last route cause those endings left me extremely confused without the grand ending. [spoiler] Also I liked Soh until the grand ending. I don't like him all that much anymore. [/spoiler] I'm kinda sad you barely get any interactions with Hansel and Gretel they were two of my favorite characters and I would have liked to see them more. Even in Scarlets route they were quite lacking to me.

If you love fairytale references this game is a lot of fun. The game is high quality and has replayability by adding a lot of extra scenes after completing a route. Caramia gotta be my favorite route he's precious. I also loved Scarlet, it was the first route I played and he's just so sweet. Kyrie I disliked at the start with how he treats the MC but after going through his route he's okayish. There really is something for everyone here and I would recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198368874986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1565237782}
review:
Just when I thought I couldn't fit any more husbandos in my heart, I came across this game.

I was first drawn to this game because of the art-style resembling Diabolik Lovers (which I'm a huge fan of), but after playing a full route, I can say the story is nothing like that of Diabolik Lovers, but it is still great and so are the characters.
I am making this review after only completing one full story and getting one ending, so there is way more to the story and characters than what I can say.
I experienced Scarlet's "happy"? / "normal"? end, and oh boy. I enjoyed it. But, I was also incredibly disappointed. Not much romance happening. No kisses or cuddles or nothing. It felt more like a cute crush story than anything else.
But! This could be a problem with only Scarlet's story. Maybe it would be strange to have such a relationship with a guy that looks so young haha
But reading up on some other reviews, there does seem to be more romance with other characters.
There were parts in the story that were just confusing. There were also some anti-climatic scenes that were clearly supposed to be a big deal and intense, that would just... suddenly end... and the next day, everyone acts like nothing even happened. (Again, I am speaking for Scarlet's route, the others might be better!)

The voice-acting is good, but not great. When there are intense scenes, everyone just seems really chilled most of the time. Not sure what that's all about. (Let's just pretend it's a mafia thing!) It is also not fully voice-acted. So, there are scenes and dialogue where there is no voice-acting at all. But, thankfully, most of the story seems to have what we want!

Pros:
- Amazing art
- Mafioso Husbandos 
- Cute music
- Interesting story
- Decent voice-acting
- Backgrounds and emoticons
- Scarlet (because he is best boy)

Cons:
- Not fully voice-acted
- Can be anti-climatic
- MC is really stupid
- Annoying 'loading screen' that happens like 100 times in one route
- No achievements
- You can't take screenshots in this game without researching how to and following a long step-by-step guide. It's very frustrating.
- [spoiler] Almost everyone has this unnecessary need to bully Scarlet (╥_╥) [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198393895951', 'num_games_owned': 1507, 'num_reviews': 1228, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1561350034}
review:
[h1] 游戏介绍	[/h1]
《OZMAFIA!!》是一款由Poni-Pachet SY制作，MangaGamer发行的以童话为题材，乙女类型恋爱向多结局AVG游戏。女主人公Fuka醒来之后发现自己在一个陌生的地方，甚至不知自己的基础属性，突然眼前出现的男人想要杀她，但是幸运的是，她被三人组所救下，并且被带到其的羽翼之下给予庇护，因为她深不知背后是激烈的家族斗争。游戏也就从此进行展开，女主Fuka能找到属于自己的道路吗？

[h1] 游戏的画风	[/h1]
游戏的画风充满着欧美的艺术风格，尤其在人物的立绘有着相当明显的凸显，男士们大多绅士偏偏，女士们大多温文尔雅，而且还能感受到画师那高超的绘画技艺，因为对每一个人物的细节的把控都很细腻，特别是面部的绘制，将每一个人物的表情都展示的充满魅力，其中我最喜欢眼睛的感觉，因为我觉得可以从眼睛中看出一个人的特性，颜色的运用也是炉火纯青，将每一个场景都绘制的如梦似幻，将童话的特点显著突出。

[h1] 游戏的音乐	[/h1]
游戏的背景音乐的绘制也是充满魔力，除了渲染了游戏剧情的气氛之外，还很好的带动着游戏的节奏，玩家也可以更好的融入游戏的氛围之中，特别是当你选择要拜访的男主角之后的剧情，这时的音乐将会有一种童话般的感染力，而且更可以促进女主人公和男主人之间的感情，所以喜欢谁就请多多拜访他吧！

[h1]游戏的剧情 	[/h1]
游戏的结局数量相当的多，所以想进入自己喜欢的线路是需要一定的选择才可以进入的，而且一旦选择不利，就会进入BE了，所以进行游戏的时候需要经常进行存档，以防选择出现失误。然后我就说一说其中的狮子线，刚开始看的时候感觉狮子是一个阳光并且有点的二的人，但是随着剧情的进行，你会感觉其实并不是酱紫，他和Fuka在一起感觉更像父女的关系，而且能在流星节表白之前能够明显感受到其对Fuka的好感，然后就是很多日常的事件的互动，感觉很是温馨，一起同甘共苦，比如晚上一起下酒馆（我只能说Fuka妹子的酒量是真的不行，一点点就直接醉了= =），还哄骗AXEL帮助他们一起消灭咖喱的摊子（真的聪明），特别是酒醉后的Fuka显得特别的可爱，十分粘着狮子，不让他走，这样的妹子有谁不爱呢？最后还有婚礼现场哟，可以感受到Fuka是十分幸福的。游戏对于剧本的描写很是细致，对于人物性格的塑造也是很不错，让我们可以更好的了解游戏中的不同人物的秉性，这样也将会有更好的游戏体验。

[h1] 游戏的优点	[/h1]
+细腻高质量充满欧美风的画风
+多结局的游戏走向
+应景的背景音乐
+人物性格的完美塑造

[h1] 游戏总评	[/h1]
总的来说，这款游戏可以说是一部不错的乙女类作品，如果你是乙女类作品的爱好者，来体验一下这款游戏，相信会有不错的体验。
评分：8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198136373957', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 378, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 254, 'last_played': 1564668899}
review: I'm leaving a positive review because I liked it and had really fun playing this game but I wouldn't recommend the game for everyone. If you don't want to read a bad ending that contains sexual enslavement, sexual assault and emotional abuse, this game is not for you. If you're casual otome gamer and just want short stories this game is also not for you. I'm probably used to reading dark themed novels that most of the bad endings didn't bother me at all, so if you don't like any of what's mentioned above don't play this game. Anyways what makes this game stand out from the rest of the otome games that I've played is that there was a love triangle feature in some of the routes. [spoiler]That mood when you think you're set to get your chosen hubby's bad ending or good ending, drama happens and another beautiful man steals you away so you can get his ending[/spoiler] Also the art was gorgeous, if you played for the art I would also recommend Diabolik Lovers and Re:Birthday Song. The con for me was there was no Hansel Route and I didn't like playing as a dumb and naive girl.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041280853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2719, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2719, 'last_played': 1558834300}
review:
I can not in good conscience recommend OZMAFIA!! to other players. While the game had a few positive aspects, its serious flaws greatly outweigh them for a gameplay experience that was at best tedious and at worst so upsetting that it took me completely out of the narrative. For the sake of those who would appreciate warnings about these topics I will warn you that the following in-game routes contain emotional abuse, sexual assault, and/or sexual enslavement of the main character: [spoiler]Kyrie, Robin Hood, and Manboy/Brothel[/spoiler]. If you would like to read the rest of my opinions on the game, here are some of the things I noticed while playing through it:

[h1]Pros[/h1]
The game has a few things it did well. The artwork is beautiful with a watercolor style that lends itself well to the fairy tale concept. The voice acting was varied and emotive without being disruptive to gameplay and the music was well matched to the scenes.  New scenes from the love interest's point of view become available upon replay. Lastly, the game's concept of Fairy Tale characters becoming mafias was an interesting premise.

[h1]Cons[/h1]
This game had some serious problems in its writing, character development, replay value, and most of all content choices. 

[b]Main Character[/b]
As other reviewers stated, the main character is not just naive or "innocent" but incredibly stupid in a way that goes beyond what amnesia explains. She makes poor choices, lacks depth in personality, is very pliant to whatever the other characters want, and overall has very little to make her stand out as a character. She is incredibly helpless and does not develop throughout the story into anything else. Overall, this was frustrating to sit through.

[b]Writing and Pacing[/b]
This game is long and poorly paced. The first time playing through is enjoyable, but becomes incredibly tedious to sit through to get all the endings for the epilogue and grand finale, even with the skip feature. The writing often left me struggling to see how a relationship could grow between "Fuka" and the chosen route's character.  Kyrie's, Caesars, Hamelin's and the Brothel routes were especially bad about making a story that showed how the characters could fall in love. I was most disappointed that the only female character route was [spoiler]purely platonic[/spoiler], as Pashet is arguably one of the most well rounded characters in the game. The epilogue was predictable but not satisfying. The grand finale was extremely short with little payoff for the amount of time you have to spend unlocking it.

[b]Replay Value[/b]
While this game has a lot of endings, the length of the story makes replaying it very boring. The addition of extra scenes is helpful in the first replay, but only makes additional replays even longer to get through. The Ozmafia "loading screen" between every single scene also adds to this. In addition, the epilogue and grand finale endings do not give a pay off to justify the amount of time needed to get all the different endings.

[b]Content[/b]
Some of the routes in OZMAFIA!! were enjoyable. The characters spend time together, fall in love, overcome difficulties, and get a good, bad, or bittersweet ending. Unfortunately, many of the routes include comments from the men about their desire for the main character and how she should be careful around them when they're alone. This is not romantic or endearing. It's just creepy. However, the most serious problems come up in Kyrie's, Caesar's, Robin Hood's, and the Brothel routes. Both Kyrie and Caesar's routes feature characters with "bad personalities" that are emotionally abusive or downright threatening to the main character. They are fully aware of their cruelty and show they have no intentions of changing, instead blaming the main character for choosing them.

Finally, I come to the most serious problem in this game. In both Robin Hood and the Brothel routes, the main character is drugged and then physically/sexually assaulted. In the brothel route the main character is then enslaved. These scenes totally ruined the rest of the route, especially as there was little to no reaction on the main character's part about what happened to her or any sort of consequence for the characters who assaulted her. Most upsetting of all is that there is no warning anywhere about these scenes either on the game's store page or in-game before you get to those scenes. This is completely unacceptable, as it does not leave the player with a choice to opt out if they do not wish to see that kind of content, implied or otherwise.

[h1]Conclusion[/h1]
OZMAFIA!! is a game that had the potential for an interesting premise. Unfortunately, it's poor writing, slow pacing, lack of character development, and use of abuse/sexual assault in its routes make this game unenjoyable to play. I highly recommend players get their romance fix elsewhere.

[b]TLDR:[/b] Pretty game, but serious flaws in writing, pacing, and replayability. Contains routes with emotional abuse, sexual assault, and enslavement. Would not recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416173708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3372, 'last_played': 1558277922}
review:
本来心里有千言万语想说，通完TE和GE[spoiler] 并哭成sb [/spoiler]之后发现前面的一切都是浮云，挥一挥衣袖看动画泡面番去了。[spoiler] 某位小朋友可真是下了一盘大棋 [/spoiler]

本来买这个游戏是冲着さとい老师去的，买之前没有仔细看语言选项，字幕只有英语，还混杂些许其他语种单词，但为了收集全CG和看全剧情依然硬着头皮把每条线都通了个二周目，感觉自己英语水平都提高了好多呢（误

下面是吹爆环节：虽然游戏本身不是全语音，但是文字量真的非常大，而且每条线的二周目都会有（全语音的）追加剧情，我光clear三巨头全CG和二周目就用了三十多个小时[spoiler] （对我来说差不多是半部薄樱鬼的时间了） [/spoiler]加上さとい老师的绝美插画，很明显是物超所值啊！角色也各有各的可爱之处，二周目刷下来我几乎要成为[spoiler] 除某丧病大叔以外的 [/spoiler]全员厨了

三角关系设定之前我也觉得挺膈应的，为了收集CG我第一个走的劈腿线是Axel劈Caramia，那负罪感简直如滔滔江水绵延不绝……后来多劈几次内心就毫无波动了[spoiler] 以及我怎么觉得劈腿线比纯爱线甜？是我的错觉吗 [/spoiler]
Brothel线确实挺R（毁）1（三）5（观）的，BE（？）后半部分的每一个过场都让我内心狂喊怎么还没结束啊。[spoiler] 但是HE（？）里给Dorian起名这个环节我好喜欢啊www[/spoiler] [spoiler] 顺带一提为了发泄我的一腔怒火我给他起名叫Shabby [/spoiler]
医生线的话见仁见智吧，我觉得问题不大。
综上所述剧情方面争议还是很多的，如果不是我这种心平气和老年人心态可能很难接受，所以一般玩家还是谨慎购买谨慎游玩吧。

值得一提的是，这个游戏的英文本地化做得非常棒，自然到完全可以原谅偶尔出现的翻译错误。 [spoiler] 当然如果Hameln的Fraulein首字母能大写就更好了。[/spoiler] 如果语言水平跟得上，或者想借机学英语的话，一定要玩英文版体验一下！真的墙裂推荐！！

[spoiler] 以及这游戏官配果然是Kyrie吧，我永远爱他[/spoiler]

=================分割线=====================
吐槽一下动画版是让小红帽拿了女主剧本打bl擦边球，观感十分不好，不知道为什么要搞这种骚操作

author: {'steamid': '76561198274924280', 'num_games_owned': 114, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4261, 'last_played': 1582082149}
review:
I really enjoyed this game, my only complain would be that some routes end rather quickly, breaking the tension very easily

Aside from that each route is different from each one and the characters have unique personalities that differ from each one

review: I recommend this game as a whole, however, there are some problems. While playing this game i had suddenly been kicked out of it. I figured I had done something so I started it up again and went to my recent saves, or I tried to that is.  I have not been able to access my saves, OR save any part of my game since then. Whenever I attempt to load or save there is a box of some sort that pops up, a bug it seems. If anyone can help me then please tell me. This has not happened with any other game I have played so I am pretty upset that I payed for this game and only got to get through a fraction of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265111495', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1609428066}
review:
I'll upvote this game, but my feelings are mixed and I'll explain:

So, I've finished half the routes (and my friend finished the other half, as we play it at the same time and we discuss and share screenshots). I've read the epilogue and Grand Finale online. We played without a guide.

So the good things: Great art! I absolutely love it. The characters are really nice (except Dorian and Alfani, f them). The story and plot twists of it makes it really interesting to read (at least once, not enough to do it as many times as needed to complete the game 100%).

So onto the bad stuff...: 
1.While the story and plot twists are interesting... each individual route felt rather... unimpressive? Unimpactful? I don't know how to explain it. But basically it feels like you play for such a short time, nothing -actually- really happens throughout each individual route and it feels short. Seeings extra scenes here and there makes it a little better, but even those are sort of... irrelevant, to me at least. They give extra depth to the characters, but that's about it.
2. The choices a lot of times just made no sense to me, I'll be honest. Ofc, it's my personal opinion, but Caramia and Robin Hood's route choices just... didn't make any sense. A lot of times I felt like I was led down a path that according to the discussions beforehand, it made no sense to be end up there? I think that choices and following dialogue is probably made sort of ambiguous as to whether it's good or bad as to not make it easy to Save-Load to end up where you want to, but even so... I don't know. I discussed this with my friend, cause I was really upset when I got Robin Hood's bad ending, and yeah, we were very perplexed.
4. Make Pashet and actually romantic route! I was SO disappointed to find out it's all about how good friends they are, NO! Either that, or at least make it so you can actually push her and Axel together (cause that was adorable AF). Again, good and bad endings were a mega disappointment.
3. Very personal opinion, but the Brothel route just -felt bad-. There's no good or bad ending, it just a whole load of feeling bad and dirty and disgusted with yourself. I think the game should allow players to skip this route entirely for the Epilogue and Grand Finale cause I think it's unfair to people who pay for this game, to make them feel this way, come on...

author: {'steamid': '76561198196408413', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 921, 'last_played': 1619774977}

It's a very enjoyable game with a side of some very tragic routes! It gives you many choices which is always a plus! Everything affects the game in a way. And I love how you get to know the story more and more with multiple endings in the character you chose!

I would 100% recommend this game to anyone. It's a masterpiece!

author: {'steamid': '76561198804478876', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2185, 'last_played': 1609924760}
review:
I never finished the game because I was traumatized with one of the routes. I mean it is good, I loved the rest of the routes dearly, but after not having any possible happy ending on one of them (I'm a s*cker for happy endings) I just can't proceed - seeing him in every other route is simply painful. You might overcome it, I just can't. But it happens, there are characters with no happily ever after. I just didn't expect it would be this character.
10/10 if you want to flood your room with tears. 
On the side note - voice acting and cute sides of each character are very pleasant, Caesar won my heart over and over. Brothel route is a breathe of fresh air in my otome experience :) And Axel will ruin your teeth and make you fat, you'll see.
There is a problem with graphics in fullscreen mode, but you can end up playing in windowed, just maximized, then there is no blurry nightmare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198850988242', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 503, 'last_played': 1616074807}
review:
I was only 53 minutes into the game but the number of plotholes made it seem like miraculous task to enjoy it. The art is gorgeous and I never noticed the sounds enough but at least it wasn't grating on my ears. Howevver, I have to leave a negative review since there isn't a neutral option. I am here to simply vent my frustrations. If the reader feels frustrated as I do after reading my review, then at least the reader can make a much more informed decision in purchasing the game. And regret it later anyway, since I actually have already read reviews about Ozmafias MCs naivete, but still chose to purchase this since I didn't believe that she could actually make me this.....angry, and there aren't many other Otome games out there of note. 

(Edit: part 2 of review is a positive review, spoilers still somewhat apply to it)


Spoilers below-vulgarity included:(Caps are to demonstrate strong feelings of disbelief, do not mind me)


Firstly, she was being chased by an assassin but upon bumping into some strangers, instead of simply apologising and rushing off for her life like normal people, she somewhat started a conversation with them and only panicked when the assassin finally caught up. Like, wtf? It might have been a device used to introduce other characters in the game to the player but really, can't they do it more realistically? Like, say, the characters were being suspicious of her for running around like a madman and  grabbed onto her for interrogation since they didn't recognise her or something, while she realistically tried to escape out of fear for the assassin or begged them for help. INSTEAD OF STARTING A CONVERSATION THAT HAS THE "oh, what pleasant weather we have today, let's go frolic in an open field." VIBE.

And the action of remodelling an entire shed for her use as her living space seems to...lack common sense? Like hello, IT'S A FUCKING HUGE MANSION, THE PLAYER WAS EVEN GIVEN A KEY TO A BATHROOM IN THE MANSION FOR HERSELF, CAN'T SHE GET A ROOM WITH A KEY TOO? I know that this is very minor in retrospect to the plot but it is a small annoyance that disrupts immersion. How is living in a shed on the grounds of a mansion filled with men a more comfortable situation than living directly in the mansion with the men??? The rooms can be locked, and as trained mafia soldatis or whatsoever, won't it be easier to break open a shed than a room in a mansion where the leader himself lives? 

But the incident that truly triggered this review is the conclusion she came up with after Axel got kidnapped. Like, another wtf. Axel was trying to protect her from a group of men who wanted to kill her. He told her to run because, well, she can't fight shit at all. While the other characters were pretty callous of Axel and seemed to not care of his life or death, the logical conclusion(well, at least for me, if I were the player character herself) would be hounding the other characters for his rescue, asking around for information to know more about his kidnappers while trying to bargain with powerful people who might be interested in whatever I can offer to rescue him. Going on a hunger strike or something, while getting trained in the art of self-defence. INSTEAD OF RESCUING HIM MYSELF. Like, the dude sacrificed himself to protect me, why on earth would I go all the way there alone and helpless, without knowledge or skill in combat, to practically their base of operations? Not only are there more people to fight against,the character didn't even think her rescue plan through. What if he was bound in chains, or hidden away in some secret lair? What if he was comatose, how was she supposed to safely and quickly get him away? She isn't even that familiar with the area, what if she gets lost instead?

edited review, review part 2:

Well, I played more and the player character annoyed me a hella lotta less since I finally discovered why she was so willing to go stumbling blindly into enemy territory without preparation (Naive, but at least not delusional enough to consider herself a Mary Sue) 

It irked me a litle that some characters talk about previously being non-human and the player character doesn't even question how he was even non-human in the first place, and how she just accepts it as the way of the world without even wondering why. Hell, I am sure even 5 year olds will ask why, but well considering the fact that this is an entirely different world with weird rules and myths I guess I can't exactly compare this world and reality.

I probably played long enough to have exhausted my mind, because I strangely didn't get any other neurotic thoughts that stem from the usual over-thinking that I do. Or it is simply possible that there weren't any more plotholes in the first route I played. But anyhow, I found the game to be quite the challenge since it has new concepts. I am not sure how I feel about bffs stealing their bro's girl (Imma girl too but bros over hoes ya know) as part of the plot, and was very shocked that I somehow suddenly transferred to another person's route without intending to do so in the first place. 

This game is quite a challenge in itself, and for that alone I will be changing my negative review into a positive one. It blindsided me halfway, and the ending I wanted wasn't so easy to get. I am not sure if the same plot applies to different routes, but I'll call it a day with one route. 

I can't see anyone binging on this without earning a massive hungover-esque headache, but at least it means that I shall be entertained for some time to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334956220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2351, 'last_played': 1548314852}
review:
I almost felt like I could recommend OZMAFIA!!, but on second thought, I think its issues outweigh the things it does right. As others have said, the art is quite pretty, the voice acting and music are (mostly) good, and the translation is excellent -- production value-wise, this is a high-tier otoge. But, man, is it ever weird.

The plot, which puts fairy tale and literary characters into a mafia setting, barely makes sense even after seeing the true ending, which itself is abrupt and unsatisfying. Just getting that ending in the first place is an exercise in tedium, because it means going through both endings of every single route, and that means doing the Oz Famiglia routes over and over for what feels like an eternity. The skip button helps, but even with it on the whole way while using a guide, you're still looking at 15-20 minutes of sitting there waiting for it to get to the parts you haven't seen. There is a [i]lot[/i] of content in this game, and that's a good thing in some respects, but much of it doesn't feel worth the effort it takes to actually see it.

As far as the quality of that content goes, there are some interesting routes and likeable characters for sure, but also a surprising level of potentially uncomfortable subject matter. One of the routes, for instance, includes alarmingly graphic depictions of sexual abuse regardless of what choices are made, and there is another that seems to imply[spoiler]the protagonist was drugged by a love interest, who proceeded to have sex with her while unconscious[/spoiler]. A few of the love interests are manipulative bordering on emotionally abusive, and in at least one case, it is nearly impossible to anticipate this kind of content going into it. Something that I found particularly grating was a recurring character whose entire purpose is to be a walking fat joke, so if that's a non-starter for you, well, there you go. And that's not even getting into the "transfer" mechanic, which many find distasteful for obvious reasons. I expected worse -- usually the scenario involves the original love interest doing something that could reasonably be considered a deal breaker, and sometimes they even flat out tell you to move on -- but it wasn't something I particularly enjoyed doing, either, and mostly felt like a weird gimmick. A lot of the "edgier" content feels gimmicky like that, in the sense that it appears to be more for shock value than something that had careful thought put into it.

In general, I feel conflicted about this game. I realize there is a small pool of choices in the English-language otome market that tick all the quality boxes OZMAFIA!! does in terms of art, translation, voice acting, and sheer volume of content, but I just found myself baffled or annoyed with the plot and characters more than I found myself enjoying them. One of the few characters I did really like ended up having a totally platonic route, too, which I admit really put a damper on my enthusiasm. I think a certain kind of reader might appreciate this game in spite of its quirkier features and flaws, but when it really comes down to it, I just didn't enjoy it very much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092056834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2318, 'last_played': 1546778520}
review:
"OZMAFIA!!" plays around Fuka*, a girl that wakes up with no memories whatsoever in an unknown town, ruled by the mafia. Just as she arises, she is immediately chased by a mysterious man. Upon fleeing into the heart of town, she runs into the Oz famiglia, who take her in as a guest. As she spends her time with the mafia, she discovers the cycle of life: Friendship, loyalty, love, life, death. 

You may recognize the art from other games such as Diabolik Lovers or Re:Birthday Song. The character design, CGs and backgrounds are astonishingly beautiful. Poni-Pachet has indeed chosen a marvelous artist. Aside from that, the voice acting is a welcome extra. Famous voice actors such as Shingaki Tarusuke or Okitsu Kazuyuki were hired for the main characters. There could have been no one better suited for these roles, they perform with their heart and soul. Here, the creators have made an excellent choice as well. Even if the game is only 70% voiced, which threw me off at first, I do not find fault with that decision. It would have been nice if the game was fully voiced, but voice actors are expensive, especially the more well known ones.

Before starting the thorough review, I recommend playing the game UNTIL THE END. Here's why:
At first, the story seems pretty inconsistenst. Logical gaps everywhere you see. For a mafia setting, the game seemed pretty light, colorful and bubbly. Since I had such high hopes for this game, I was truly disappointed by the outcome. But the more routes and endings you play, the more you understand. By playing the routes in order, you get a better understanding of the story, kind of a red string that follows the tale. It also goes darker, deeper. Very unique. And: NO R-A-P-E!! At the very end of the game, you get to see the epilogue, and with that, everything makes sense. If you had questions, they will be solved after viewing the epilogue. So please give the game a chance if you don't like the story at first. Keep playing!!

The perfomance of the games was kind of meh. The cutscenes appear every 10 minutes and it drove me crazy while playing! There is also no real love-meter where you get to see the progress of the romance. 
OZMAFIA!! is kind of repetitive in the beginning as you have to play the first three characters about 3-4 times. To our advantage, there is a skip function. Really, it saves you a lot of time!!
The play time is fairly long, it took me about 40 hours to complete the entire game. 

The characters are generally well written and go deep, especially when you play all the routes, the characteristics add up and you get to see another side of them. Every character is kind of loveable. Some are also pretty unique, others I feel sorry for. I like that there is character development, which usually lacks in a lot of otoges. Overall, I am pretty satisfied with the cast. 
I recommend playing the routes twice (the three main characters have to be played 3-4 times anyway) as you unlock the thoughts of the characters during the current chapters. I only discovered this mechanic when my game crashed and I had to play an entire route again. 

The plot is diverse, from happy and bubbly moments to dark, dramatic situations. Whereas I do have to admit that I did not like the dramatic situations that much because they did not come across as that severe. My favorites were probably the very comedic and humorous scenes [spoiler](e.g. when Caramia shows the heroine how to use a gun and Axel enters the room upon hearing her saying she had "never imagined his (Caramia's) to be that long and big")[/spoiler]. There are even references to fairytales such poisoned apples or putting someone into an oven. Loved those little details!

All in all, I genuinely recommend OZMAFIA!!. I had to shed tears at the epilogue, but also from laughing too much. I smiled because of beautiful and touching moments. I got goosebumps from suspense. One of the greatest, localized otome games on the market so far. Loved the experience and I would play it again!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085223969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2598, 'last_played': 1668135337}
review: I really loved this visual novel, the story concept was fasicnating and I loved the artwork. The characters are so different, it's nice to have varying types of characters that keep well with their personality. I really wish more visual novels had this much work put behind it, I'm a sucker for colors and artwork so it drew me in almost immediately. I didn't really use the VA I had it on mute half the time I just prefer reading it myself. But the music was spot on what little of the voice work wasn't bad but the overall ending options and hidden CGs were freaking awesome. I finally finished this game to %100 after 43 hours of painstakingly trying to find every last ending I had missed xD. 10/10 from me <3 my favorite otome yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308596701', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2318, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1598564374}
review:
Start off with giving this game 3/5 now its 7/5. Yes. You read that right.
No spoiler, you can read it.
-----------------------------------------------------
Pros:
-New cutscene every time you play (read below)
-Not full of 'skip'
-So many route to play
-Unique route such as /Dorian route/ahem/ havent seen this in Otome.
-The story add up after every route you play (you will go OHHHHHHHH. OH WAT. OH YES OH NO OH TEARS)
-ikemen everywhere + Pashet

Cons:
-Friendzone by Pashet LOL
-You wont realize how amazing this game at first.
-Take lots of time for light player. 
-So many holes in the story if you don't play other route.
-Simple gameplay, quiet typical. (But I guess it suit Ozmafia since it focus heavily on story)
------------
I'm a hardcore Otome player, 
I played this game once and stop. I feel that this game is simple and so many holes in the story. Boy I was wrong.
Thank god I decided to give another go to Ozmafia or at least finish 50% of the route. First off all, I never knew that other route effect the the completion of the story so much (epilouge route) and that there's so much new cut scene once you play other route or re-play the route. Its never boring, you wont keep skipping cause of the new cut scene once you finish your previous route!! Once I realize all this, I was so freaking drowning. I love the story, the filler, everything holycow. It's addictive. 
Currently at 80% completion, and trying to unlock them all for the Grand route.

Sorry for bad English!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198214951147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 754, 'last_played': 1546361006}
review:
Art direction and design: 8/10
Voice acting: 8/10
Character development: 2/10
Plot: 2/10

This game is a hot mess. After finishing Caramia, Axel, and Ceasar's routes, I can say that the game's biggest flaw would be its bad execution: the pacing was off, the characterization unstable, and the writing left little to be admired. I did research about the rest of the routes, as well as the Epilogue and the Grand Ending, and I can honestly say that had the execution been better, I would have continued playing. As things stands, however, there's very little incentive for me to go on. At the end of the day, it's the story's responsibility to keep the reader to ask for more. I shouldn't be making excuses for such poor writing and direction.

Verdict: Not Recommended*

*Unless you don't think too much about the plot and character development, and just stay for the bishies. That's fine, too, but alas, I'm not really that kind of reader.

author: {'steamid': '76561198329778793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1546115684}
review: Awful resolution. I can't believe none of the other reviewers mentioned this, but it's simply unplayable. Paired with the bright, soft focus of the art itself, you'll get a blurry vision and a headache in no time. Refunding it right now. Also, compared to other otome games I've played, this is a lot less polished and lazily made. I suspected something was wrong as soon as I saw the download file, since it's no more than 1.5 GB. There are no mouth or eye animations, which really brings down the overall quality, and I've heard not all dialogue is spoken. Considering the cost of the game, there's really no excuse. Do not buy even if it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120709878', 'num_games_owned': 230, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2446, 'last_played': 1679650665}
review: Honestly the game itself is repetitive when doing routes. Sure, some scenarios are different, but overall, you will always find yourself doing the same thing over and over everytime you start a new route. As negative as that sounds, the game itself is actually really good! The story, the characters, the music, and of course, the art. All of these probably made me enjoy the game a lot, and made me forget how repetivie it was. And if you are one to go for all CG in this game, I recommend using guides, since it requires a lot of saving here and there, and the fact that there are "love triangles". If the price seems too much and not worth it, then definetly get it during steam sales, you really won't regret it.

review: Decidí probar el juego despues de ver el anime y debo de reconocer que ha sido mejor de lo esperado, 100% recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561198235976976', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2065, 'last_played': 1584907336}
review: this game is just amazing and well written i absolutely adore it everything ou could do right for an otome they did, the music is lovely the art is really cute and soft the characters even background ones all have noticeable personality and i love learning about them through conversations even if they arent a route. so the game is just great but that aside i do have some issues with it, these arent major but more like "would have been nice" things, so 1 i find the 3 main routes over lap too much that even if you play anyone you still end up having to go through all the same situations have the same conversations and the same problem so really you end up reading the same thing 9 times getting all the endings and it becomes lengthy  boring. second would be i wish that some charterers would have gotten more CGs like soh, robin hood,caesar and the brothel, because there stories arent at all shorter or anything but they only have around 4 each compared to the main CGs that have around 8-9 and final thing is i really wish this game would have had achievements because theres so much endings  that it would be nice to have a solid proof to show off after how hard some of the endings where to get besides that this game really is nice and well worth the money

author: {'steamid': '76561198161617692', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1541211220}
review:
Hey, so logged about 12 hours on this thing so far and I am uttery addicted. Well drawn characters, excellent voice acting and amusing storyline this game gets you hooked and excited on the get go.
A must have for all otome fans! The OST is amazing, too. 
I have only good things to say about this game! You won't be wasting your money on a replayable game like this!
Only thing I wish they included was the option to have a yuri with Pashet but other than that, hats off! 
Off I go to play more~

author: {'steamid': '76561198062296741', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 127, 'playtime_forever': 1221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1509996559}
review:
There are two things I will always remember this game for and those are it's catchy song and the horrible.. seriously horrible MC character. 
As a fan of Otome Games I learned to put up with a lot of stupid, airheaded and brainfarting MCs for the sake of romance happening, but this one is just... painful to get used to and in the end I never truely did. 
This game is amazing, the characters and story are equally as amazing and I seriously want to wholeheartedly recommend this game if it wasn't for the MC ruining basically everything. 
It's definitely worth playing, even if it's a ruined masterpiece, though. 
Even if some things seriously don't make any sense and are a bit all over the place and the MC is braindead... I'd still recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198255960381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1516886573}
review: I do like a certain route on Ozmafia because of the voice actors, but I can't really bear to finish any other route that I do not interested out of frustrations. On the third character I gave up playing. The chapters/scenes were really short, and on each scene change, the mark of changing scenes make a huge fuss in itself showing the animation of the shadows of characters that slow down the skipping button more than its worth. There were too many scenes which repeated in many routes and I skipped after the second try. The game left me in frustrations every single time I played more than feeling satisfied with the story, so I dropped it on the third character.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201665328', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1834, 'last_played': 1543011583}
review:
In the beginning, I began to wonder why everyone praised Ozmafia!!. The characters were cute, the art was gorgeous, but things seemed thin. Shallow. It felt like I was playing one of those cheap mobile otomes with underdeveloped characters and a bad plot. I was expecting a game that should've been darker, grittier. I wondered why the mafia famiglie seemed to get along, even with the Sunday Compromise. Not exactly smart to befriend someone 1 day of the week, who is trying to kill you and take your land 6 days of the week... I was tempted to write a bad review back then, but I wanted to complete the game before I made a concrete judgement. The more I played though, the better it got. The game isn't without it's cons, but the pros certainly outweigh them.

Starting with the cons, the loading screens were my biggest gripe. They're cute and a neat way to show story progression and what kind of choices you're making, but the number of them is excessive, and listening to the jingle and watching the like 10 second animation gets really annoying really fast.
It was a bit of a shame that some of the characters didn't get all the endings that the Oz boys do, but I do see how that many endings would've been excessive. Especially with 10 characters.
Pashet's route was cute, but I feel like a friendship route is a cheap way out of actually writing a girlxgirl route. I would really appreciate an actual girlxgirl route with a romantic ending from Poni-Patchet in the future.
A lot of scenes don't really have a conclusion. They just end abruptly and jump to the next scene, where there, you may or may not get a brief line or two about the conclusion of said previous scene. This was really annoying, and it felt like the writers were a bit lazy or were unsure how to finish a scene.
The MC is the biggest moron out there. There's being naive and having amnesia, but then there's being an outright airhead. I don't know what any of the guys see in her. She made me want to quit the game in the beginning at times because she was just so....stupid. [spoiler]Like yeah, lets just go visit the guy that's trying to kill you! Let's walk into a conflict unarmed! Keep going to the brothel when everyone says don't do it! Go to the slums after being told not to! Need to be rescued from everything! [/spoiler]
Ande was so damn annoying I would've happily skipped every scene with her. I know that's her purpose, but it still pissed me off.

And with the pros, the game is well written. It can be frustrating at first and seem thin, but the story unravels itself the more characters you play, and the epilogue and grand finale really do a good job at tying things up. The game was translated and localized well, things were relateable, funny, and made sense. Very few spelling/gramatical errors. 
Characters like Caramia, Axel, and Ceaser really stole my heart. Soh's route made me cry. Scarlet didn't creep me out like most token shota boys in otomes do. Kyrie is still a complete jerk but he has his moments. Poni-Pachet really created a loveable cast that will be memorable after playing the game. 
I felt like Brothel was handled well by using [spoiler]Manboy as the sort of antithesis.[/spoiler] It's not wrong to put more dark content in a game, but it has to be done right. I felt like it was done in a way that didn't romanticize the cruel reality of the situation. [spoiler]Manboy makes sure you know that what's going on is wrong.[/spoiler] This is a really good thing, there's nothing more upsetting than a game that romanticizes abuse and tragic situations like that. [spoiler]Plus the naming Dorian in one of the endings was such sweet revenge.[/spoiler]
Satoi's art is beautiful as always, and there are plenty of CG's. Character designs were good, relatively original (Axel looks a LOT like Ruki from Diabolik Lovers sorry not sorry), and there wasn't a drop in quality between main characters and side characters.
Partial voice acting was good, though I did feel like it was a bit odd at times where and when they decided to suddenly switch to a voiced line, or how the MC is only voiced in the epilogue/grand finale.

My route reccomendation: Caramia>Kyrie>Axel>Scarlet>Brothel>Pashet>Robin Hood>[spoiler]Hamelin[/spoiler]>Ceaser>Soh
Really, The Oz boys can be played whenever. It might be more enjoyable to spread them out through your playthrough, seeing as how their routes will be a bit longer and feature multiple endings. However, Brothel should be played as early as you can, but don't play it first. It will give you the very wrong impression of the game and it's ideal to start with an Oz boy. Just play it when you want a change of pace. Play Robin Hood before [spoiler]Hamelin[/spoiler] due to spoilers, and Ceaser and Soh should be played last. Absolutely play Soh last.

Overall, the game was a really good and enjoyable play. It had a decent amount of content. The price is a bit high, but if you get it on sale, it's not bad at all. Anyone who loves otomes should give this one a go. Definetly worth your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198297434922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 651, 'last_played': 1538603934}
review: The only thing I really like about this game is the art. The rest is just, like, okay. The MC is a total doormat, 85% of her lines are just her repeating what people say to her. The plot is disjointed and doesn't make sense at times, lots of scenes end upbruptly, and most of the endings are less than satisfying. That being said, my favorite route is the brothel because at least you can end up with some god damn autonomy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116957377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 247, 'last_played': 1537638989}
review:
I just started playing this but I have no idea what I'm doing. Like one of the comment here, many of the scenes were like mini scenes sewn together. I don't know if my choices really up the affection rate or not. This is the first time I don't know what I'm playing after hours with it, among all my otome games (and I played quite a lot of it). 

One thing I absolutely cannot brain is you can go attack someone today, and greet them warmly the next day.
Or the fact that it's normal to tell someone face-to-face 'I'm going to kill you next week' then walk away like nothing happened. Effin wth?

Those aside, I really like the arts and also the voices. But that's about it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142835757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4472, 'last_played': 1600479753}
review:
I haven't long gotten into Otome games (this is about my eight), but, oh boy, do I love this! 

[b]The Good[/b]

It has Japanese voice acting (covering about 70% of the game) that is superbly done and really takes many scenes to a whole other level; from heart warming, to funny, to heart breaking, to slightly steamy, to dark and disturbing, above and beyond what the writing alone would have done for me. Regardless of weather you understand the language itself, the tone and delivery makes all the difference in my book. I loved the writing and the translations are superb and flowed wonderfully, not rough or choppy or clumsy at all. 

The place where it is set is intriguing, and the characters... oh the characters! One of them, Kyrie, has made my all time favourites list of characters from any media. I found him to be so well developed with such fantastic depth (party thanks to his VA, too) that just got better the more I played, as in every rout I found something more to dig my claws into with him, even if only one scene, just another hint of the layers to him. The others are all wonderful in their own way too; detailed, each with their own distinct personalities, each adding wonderfully to the world they are in. Love them or hate them, this is quite a cast! You could take these characters, drop them in a void, and they would make a story all by themselves, just by being who they are, which says how good they are.

The story... the story is a little odd but I enjoyed it. You have your different routes, and then you have the true ending, which is revealed through the epilogue and grand finale. From what I can gather, non of the routes other then the true ending is canon, yet at the same time it is written in such a way that it is feasible that [i]any[/i] or even all of the routes COULD be [i]partly[/i] canon, which is nice. For the player, each rout is an exploration of the situation the MC is in, and the characters in it, who they are, the part they have in the world and the state things are in now, bits and pieces of the over all story, which gives a us a pretty cool overview of the story/setting/situation by the end. 

The MC... well, its not often one can all naive stupidity a superpower, but this gal pretty much manages it. Its like watching a puppy blunder around and bump into things; cute, though not what you would expect of an adult, even a young adult. Yet, while she did bother me at times, she somehow sort of grew on me, which is a wonder. Oh, I still want to kick her, regularly, but still, I have been somewhat suckered into the cute so I guess this is a good thing. Anyway, there are in game reasons for her being like this, utter lack of prior memories and being lucky enough to fall (literally) in to the arms of a group willing and capable of looking after her tiny-puppy-like self and thus prolonging her naivety being two big ones.

The sound and music does it's job. Nothing grated on me over much and most of it just faded into the background of the scene, as it should, to set the tone. A few tracks I did particularly enjoy, either for being tied to a favourite character or just because I thought it was very cool in and of itself (one in particular in the epilogue I let sit on my computer for a while, I liked it so much). Some sound affects were meh, but not enough to distract from the rest. The scene change card and jingle did mildly irritate for a time, but I reached the point of blanking that out too.

I loved the art in this, both Sprites and CGs, I thought were gorgeous. The sprites per character were good too, giving many expressions that added to the scene and helped bring it all to life. Brilliant!

[b] The Meh[/b]

There is a feature to this game I have not come across elsewhere that some might consider a blessing, some a curse; the second play through of any rout - including the conflicts with the Oz boys and their transfers that can follow it (two different things) - will reveal additional mini scenes (usually away from the MC) such as banter between characters or character introspection. These add soooo much more depth to the story and the characters, and some of the Oz CGs can only be gained this way. If you want to just get all the info now this is a curse (I lean this way myself), but if you are planning to take your time with replays this will be a blessing, adding more to the game next time you want to savour it. To a degree this also serves a story function, withholding information until you have already experienced the story in the first play through, which I can appreciate in and of itself, but still...

Fade to black... This VN relies on fade to black so, so much. For just about everything; action scenes, sexual scenes, some dramatic scenes, more regular scenes... I can see the artistic direction and it does maintain the pacing, but at the price of feeling choppy at times. There were numerous instances when I wish they would have let things play out more - I would NOT have complained at this already long VN being even longer, I would have loved that! Still, I did get used to it, so it didn't ruin things for me - I still adore this VN.

[b]The Bad... potentially[/b]

[b]HOWEVER![/b] All that said, as much as I love this game, this wont be for everyone, for two big reasons; the brothel rout (Manboy rout), and to a much lesser degree, the Robin Hood rout. There are serious consent issues (and more, in the brothel rout) here which, in fiction, some might enjoy playing with but others will not. In order to unlock the epilogue and grand finale you have to complete both endings of all routes (including the transfer route endings for the Oz boys), including these two. [i][b]You can however just click though everything quickly and use a guide to know what dialogue options to pick to unlock them. You can also change the skip function to skip all, not just what you have already read, to make this go even faster - just remember to change it back after.[/b][/i] Most endings of each rout (there are two for each) can be called either 1) good or  2) bitter-sweet, depending on your choices, but there are exceptions and these two routes fall into that; RH's rout endings I would call 1) bitter-sweet and 2) kinda messed up, while the brothel rout endings I would call 1) [i]very[/i] twisted and 2) horrifying, and given it is a brothel that gives some indication as to the problems people might have here.  Personally, I'd say if you think this would be an issue, but are intrigued by the rest of the game, I would just fast click/skip through them to get them out of the way.

My personal reactions to these two routes was... Well, I found the Robin Hood rout a little uncomfortable, but, as a work of fiction I was ok to explore it in a morbid sort of way and did sympathise with RH to a point, despite my disagreements with him. The brothel rout was an odd one for me. Again there was a morbid fascination - like watching a train wreck - that one can exercise with fiction. However the most I got out of it was fanfiction fodder with the two endings and imagining what the fallout could be like. I did click through some parts rather quickly as things got too uncomfortable for me, but, this is did not tarnish my appreciation for the rest of the game, some parts of which I have already replayed, I enjoyed them that much. 

[b]Final Thoughts[/b]

This VN falls into "good book" territory for me, the kind of thing I can see myself picking up and playing the different routes for on and off over and over in the future, which for me, is about as good as these things get. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198852001997', 'num_games_owned': 30, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1552, 'last_played': 1541312108}
review:
OMG I JUST FINISH IT TODAY AT 10:06Pm AND OMG I can't express enough the FEELS AT THE FINAL ENDING, OMG SO MANY DARNS FEELINGS AND QUESTIONS ABOUT THIS WORLD. This game is so fucking long with so many routes, but this game is worth it at the end. At first, I thought the story was dull, but LATER, I CHANGED MY MIND ABOUT THIS GAMe. THIS IS VERY ADULTY STORYLINE.
 SERIOUS, NOT UNDER appropriate FOR 13 or under. The reading text is pretty dark( explaining how people detail killing each other), BUT  there is  COMEDY as well. 
I love the twisted version of Wizard of Oz. Money is worth it,luckily, I brought it on sale during it's time. I would say there is MORE probably context in PS Vita in Japan because I saw this https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=T8Yc9ssPytQ.
 If you can't handle the dark context, This is light-hearted version only on phone app called, "ren'ai shugi Road to Emerald".  I like that too, I play that long time ago.  OVERALL, 
I LOVE U CAN SKIP OPENINGS AND ENDINGS SONGS, THANK YOU!!!
YES IT's gonna get repetitive a LOT, prepare yourself.
VOICE ACTIONG TOP NOTCH!!!!!
MUSIC IN BACKGROUND IS GREAT!!! AND ALSO, VERY IMPORTANT TO LISTEN EACH SCENE's MSUIC SWITCH OVER BECAUSE IT's TELL YOU MORE dialogues between characters. 
CHARACTERS ARE GREAT!!! (some I hate, but that's okay I still love this them anyway)
sorry, I was way too exciting for writing this, forgive me like I literally finish game for past three weeks. LOL.

author: {'steamid': '76561198832450915', 'num_games_owned': 101, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3173, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1111, 'last_played': 1537356055}
review:
Pros: All of the characters are so precious (but my fav is Kyrie). So many different endings and there's a lot of extra scenes/interactions if you replay a route. The Oz boys will rival against each other for Fuka lol. I started with Caramia and ended up with Kyrie on my first gameplay :P I just thought that was intriguing.

Cons: The Grand Finale was kinda confusing and I feel was a bit less 'epic' than I thought it would be. When they zoom into some of the artworks or faces, you can kinda see the sloppy line work. NO STEAM OVERLAY. Couldn't upload any hilarious screenshots to steam ): No steam achievements lol. Still worth buying though!

author: {'steamid': '76561198271237496', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1744, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1569, 'last_played': 1564039782}
review:
Ho comprato questo gioco in un periodo in cui ero in fissa con gli otome, e a essere sincera me ne sono pentita. Ho giocato abbastanza e in sostanza mi mancano soltanto le route di Caramia e parte di quelle di Kyrie per completare il gioco, ma dalla seconda partita in poi ho cominciato a usare il comando skip un assurdo numero di volte e per me completare il tutto stava diventando sempre più simile a un lavoro che a un gioco - cosa che, in teoria, non dovrebbe succedere con nessun gioco e nessuna visual novel.

Ripeto rapidamente i punti che altri hanno elencato prima di me con cui mi trovo d'accordo:
- Il doppiaggio è ottimo, nulla da dire neanche per i disegni che sono perlopiù fatti molto bene, per non parlare degli sfondi.
- L'ambientazione avrebbe anche del potenziale, ma la storia è così scialba e inutilmente carica di misteri irrisolti da essere più frustrante che divertente.
- La protagonista è sicuramente la più ingenua, ottusa, frustrante e genuinamente fastidiosa che io abbia mai incontrato in un otome o in uno shoujo. E ne ho viste tante, di protagoniste di questo tipo. Ci sono personaggi passivi e piagnucolosi che tutti hanno odiato e che io ho adorato, ma in questo caso non sono riuscita a farmela piacere neanche io.
- C'è una sorta di schermata di caricamento, o una schermata di transizione, che è accompagnata da un jingle e serve a separare vari momenti della storia. Durante il primissimo gameplay non era fastidiosa, ma ogni volta che ho rigiocato l'ho odiata profondamente. Non c'è modo di disattivarla, ed è abbastanza invasiva da smorzare l'immersione nella storia.

Tutti i personaggi, nessuno escluso, sono stereotipi da manga shoujo. Se trovate il tipo di stereotipo che piace a voi, bene; in caso contrario possono essere tutti potenzialmente fastidiosissimi, in particolare i personaggi secondari. Si intuiscono i loro ragionamenti (anche quelli più contorti) già dopo aver letto poche loro battute di dialogo, tanto che per me è stato impossibile non annoiarmi per la maggior parte di essi - salvo quei personaggi che apprezzo di più perché, per l'appunto, mi piacciono i loro stereotipi.

La storia, molto semplicemente, è del tutto inappropriata per l'ambientazione: trattandosi di organizzazioni criminali ("mafia", come hanno purtroppo deciso di chiamarle) mi aspettavo qualcosa di più dark, con una trama ben carica, avvenimenti interessanti, intrighi particolari e così via. Quello che ho ottenuto è una protagonista che, ritrovandosi senza memoria, invece di interessarsi a scoprire di più sul proprio conto, preferisce piuttosto trascorrere il tempo mangiando dolcetti, facendo passeggiate notturne in zone ad alto tasso di criminalità e appiccicarsi al love interest di turno come una cozza allo scoglio. Concorsi di bellezza, bambini impegnati a vendere fiammiferi, assassini che passano tranquillamente interi pomeriggi domenicali a chiacchierare amabilmente con le proprie vittime... più che una città afflitta dal problema della mafia, sembrano gang di bambini che ogni tanto bisticciano. Non sono mai riuscita a prendere sul serio neanche uno dei risvolti più potenzialmente pericolosi, nemmeno quando c'erano in gioco spade, pistole o bombe. Allo stesso tempo, quando nel gioco avvengono cose come molestie o addirittura stupri (perché sì, ci sono anche questi), sono avvenimenti trattati come questioni di poco conto. Gli altri personaggi approfittano dell'ingenuità della protagonista più di una volta, ma ogni volta che questo succede nessuno ha reazioni particolari. La leggerezza con cui vengono affrontati molti dei temi della storia è forse una delle cose più frustranti.

La storia in generale sembra un ammasso di varie scenette legate l'una all'altra. Lo scorrere del tempo è molto confuso, buona parte degli eventi principali avviene fuori dalla scena e spesso anche situazioni serie come dichiarazioni o finali sono raccontati in maniera sbrigativa. Ci sono tantissime route ma sono tutte superficiali - anche quelle di Axel e Kyrie, che in teoria sono due dei tre personaggi giocabili principali, le ho trovate piuttosto scarne. Avrei preferito meno personaggi e una storia come si deve.

Ultimo ma non ultimo, le route hanno per lo più una storia comune, da cui poi si diramano le varie possibilità a seconda delle scelte fatte. Questo significa che c'è letteralmente META' della storia che va rigiocata ancora e ancora, ogni volta che si vuole ottenere un finale diverso. Se era già scialba durante la prima partita, quando ho rigiocato per ottenere altri finali è diventata un vero e proprio inferno.

Ammetto che se dovesse essere il primo otome che si prova in generale potrebbe essere divertente; in caso contrario consiglio caldamente di cercare un altro gioco da provare. I disegni saranno anche belli, ma non vale la pena di perdere tempo qui quando ci sono altri otome più economici (anche molto più economici, o addirittura giochi gratuiti) con storie più interessanti e personaggi meno fastidiosi.

EDIT: Ho reinstallato il gioco giusto per completare la collezione di CG (non ci sono riuscita, me ne manca una) e vedere il gran finale, insieme anche alla risoluzione di tutti i misteri che durante le varie partite non vengono svelati neanche parzialmente. Purtroppo il gioco non vale la pena di essere giocato neanche per questo: sono rimasta abbastanza delusa.

review: Scarlet是世界的宝藏！！！！！！看见他就想亲亲抱抱举高高然后扔到床上_(:з」∠)_

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2410, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1524019536}
review:
So... this is an otome set in a world where Oz is but one of a number of mafia familias... It is an interesting concept, and the characters are well-formed. The plot is fun, too. Unfortunately, the protagonist suffers from a high dose of "otome-protagonist-syndrome". As in, along with her memory, her common sense seems to have been lost.

Still a decent read.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034832585', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 850, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1683617875}
review: I've been wanting to play this since it came out in Japanese. I was super excited when it got announced for an English release.  The story is cute and fast paced, allowing you to quickly replay a certain character's route if needed.  The CGs are cute and the art style is very soft and appealing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036064617', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2793, 'last_played': 1670741164}
review:
Aww how adorable, a otome game set in Oz!

Oh wait everyone is in the mafia and you have no memory of anything? Also the ones you think are most adorable end up having some horrible secret? Well crud

Pros: 
Funny scenes
Axel
Most of the others but Axel is the best
The art
The secret ending is so much of a tearjerker and mindscrew all at the same time
People calling out stupid mistakes
Lots of choices, you will likely find someone you like 

Cons
You have the IQ of a rock at times. Really even toddlers learn not to keep touching something that burns then yet you never do
Two of the routes left a bad taste in my mouth, but that is a personal thing and some people might enjoy them.
You never really find out anything about the history of the city which I kind of wanted
The girl route is friendship and not a romance

author: {'steamid': '76561198096989917', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1665, 'last_played': 1639258385}
review:
Okay, okay. I quite liked the stories and stuff, but... I seriously didn't expect Scarlet would have my favorite ending of them all. Just the bad ending... Oh - my - GOSH. Seriously. It's heart wrenching. I seriously cried sooo freakin' much... You need to play that route. I already liked the good ending and I'm usually not into these small cuties, y'kno. But Caeser and the route of his companion are my favs if it comes to both of their endings. Seriously.. What did this game do to my heart.. Just thinking about it destroys me from the inside. 

Usually I'd say it's way too pricey, but at least they sometimes have a sale. Really, don't spend that much money on that game, about 20 bucks are enough.
