author: {'steamid': '76561198133707771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 441, 'last_played': 1532273194}
review:
Unavoidably, all routes are romances (apart from one). Each character pursuit have at least two and sometimes four more endings (due two love triangles) - some of them alike. Arriving at these can be a hassle though if a/The guide is not followed as there are many choices, sometimes similar and sometimes with not apparent effect.

The epilogue, available after covering at least one ending on each character and the grand epilogue, after basically covering all endings, are really a must to wrap up the whole picture. They also bring nice vibe into the whole thing.  

To help the Replay there is a Skip button which is convenient, regretabbly it does not stop when there is not covered scene, but skips it instead. Thus the nice feature of this Novel, mixing new scenes (usually right away after the MC choice) after covering a route can be missed. Worth to note that somehow this Skip button somehow can wear off when running for long time and spitting a script error it crashes the game.

Saying that this VN has some nice ideas like the graphics library for some special moments (which is even voiced, though not subtitled), soundtrack openings/closings, scene transition clips (which can give you a hint about your current situation ... and can be boring after 100th time). Most speeches are voiced (apart from the main character and her, in the epilogues). Japanasse over, I believe well translated, english text is a big plus. Then the music blends nice and is variable enough.... As for the visuals: the art is somehow unique. Characters are detailed, background not much distraction and with time, this mix can be appreciated more and more - well done. Though some of the [i]special[/i] screens from the gallery can be a bit [i]odd[/i]... Another small detail appreciated was that the game remembers on which save/load page is the last one (they are 20!).

Few other quirks: running this VN for undefined time makes it loose all sounds. Restarting helps. Also the Quick load/Quick save buttons functions does not work across restarts (only in session time). 

In general, apart from some minor issues on all categories and the imposed romances and after rolling over the whole life inside - good game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198290546807', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3062, 'last_played': 1523593261}
review: I played this game a while back and never reviewed it so I decided to do that now. To start off with, this game has so many freaking routes. More routes than any other otome game I've ever played and I've played a lot. I love that there's so many routes but all of them are really short except for the Oz family routes. Each Oz boy has four endings each, and it's extremely tedious trying to get all of them. (I had to look at a guide to save myself a lot of time) I do like being able to switch routes halfway through one but honestly after a while it started to feel like work because just getting through all the Oz endings took most of the hours I played this game. One of the routes [spoiler] Brothel [/spoiler] can also be really triggering to some people and has actually made some people quit playing the game altogether so if you feel like you can't handle it you might want to avoid it. Overall I really did enjoy playing all the routes and I liked how different each one was. The mc was almost hilariously dense but it definitely didn't ruin anything for me. My only real complaint is that Pashet's route isn't a lesbian route and I was really hoping that it was. I would recommend this to otome game fans that love having a variety of routes to play, pretty art and some reaaally dark storylines. If you decide to play this game I recommend playing in this order to avoid as many spoilers as possible: Caramia, Kyrie and Axel first. Then Pashet, Brothel and Scarlet. Play Robin Hood before Hamelin and save Caesar and Soh for last.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358406166', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 948, 'last_played': 1521984225}
review:
我乙女游戏经历不多。。但是这个游戏真的是雷到我了。

早知道我就应该多读读评测，底下评论首页那么大的一个不推荐我居然没看到。。点击推荐是因为我没有完全推完，所以观点肯定有不正确的，看着乐乐就好了。

重要的事情再说一次：

以下全都是个人观点，我还没有把游戏玩完。。所以可能观点不全，全都是为了好玩，能看着乐乐就好。我就是发泄一下我自己的情绪。。。但是我觉得我可能需要一点时间才能克服我这几天被这游戏喂的恶意了。。

下面有对各种线的严重剧透，请慎重。虽然没有任何细节，但是会说一些线的结局。

游戏的介绍就是：

某天一名失去记忆的少女出现在这个城镇

但是这个城镇內有着众多黑手党在争夺地盘

而少女的心  会倾向于谁呢?



简介很帅气对吧！！黑手党的设定我也很喜欢，然而我期待的“争夺地盘”在哪里？？我期待的“黑手党智斗”在哪里？？

​在哪里？？？

我唯一看到的就是：

A：哈哈哈我去你的地盘扔个雷

B：哈哈哈我去你的，打爆你

A：哈哈哈别这样，我给你钱

B：哈哈哈我们是文明人，钱给我，我要全花了去买糖

​A：哈哈哈女主脑子有问题，我去把我丢的钱都骗回来，我不要现金，我要火柴哈哈哈

B：哈哈哈女主真可爱哈哈哈

好，我认了，我的要求可能有点高，乙女游戏感情戏好就行了，其他的不用在意 ：）

玩完五条线的我：哈哈哈我去你的哈哈哈


第一条线玩到了隐藏角色（这里就不说名字了），我真的都不知道我是怎么玩到他的？？不过比起其他人，我很喜欢他的角色，可惜线真的很短。。。我是说真的很短，大概十五分钟就完了。。结局有两个，一个是be一个是半个be？be的那个我打出来了但是没看，因为会剧透接下来玩的角色，所以我就跳过了。。半个be的结局是：隐藏角色进了监狱，主角为了和他在一起成为了监狱看守人。

说实话第一条线给我感觉还蛮好的，虽然感觉并不是那么惊艳，但是也还好啊！

于是我就心情高涨的开了女主在的黑手党的老大的线。

然后

我就看着女主开始了她的NTR之路。

说实话，我个人不是很喜欢NTR​，但是如果NTR被处理得好一点我还能接受，但是这个女主的秒切换我真的是理解不了？？？

我看了一眼NTR，大概就是：

女主：我想明白了，我不想要他，我想要你。

NTR对象：不是你的错，是我引诱的你，你不需要自责，来上床。

女主：啊！我好爱你啊！之前那个谁我已经忘了他了！

然后最奇怪的是，NTR居然还能拿到好结局？？？嗯？？？？

好，我们不说剧情，我们说一下这个游戏的cg机制：如果你想要拿到所有的cg，你必须要走NTR线。

​

嗯？？？嗯？？？


哦，还有，如果你想要拿床照​床戏cg的话你也必须要走NTR线。

Ozmafia制作组：我们的口号是什么！NTR才有未来和奖励！

没错，据我目前来看，正常的纯爱线是没有床戏情节或者任何脖子以下接触的，我已经能感受到官方的恶意了，这不是逼着有收集强迫症的玩家去NTR吗？？

抱怨完毕，继续回到黑手党老大的线，老大的设定是OZ里面没有勇气的狮子，进入线确定关系都蛮可爱的，然后进入真正的线后，系统自动给你设置在这个黑手党三人组里你平常对话戳到他好感的一个人，然后就开始NTR。

能够NTR的原因是：

黑手党老二（NTR对象）：老大，你为什么喜欢女主？

黑手党老大：我喜欢她身上的气味，因为她让我想起了那个女人。

女主：黑手党老大你什么意思！？

黑手党老大：你居然敢偷听！？哼！

（几天后）

黑手党老大：我不告诉你那个气味让我想起了谁，我也不告诉你那个人和我是什么关系，但是你一定要相信我，我真的很爱你！



看完这段剧情的我快要崩溃了看完这段剧情的我快要崩溃了

​嗯，没事，没准有隐情，我要保持原则不能NTR。

接下来就是这条线的第一个高潮：

女主想给老大一个惊喜，半夜出门在老大背后要捂住他的眼睛，老大正在追捕一个犯人，以为女主是犯人，一枪爆胸。老大失去了自己获得的勇气，又变成了一只胆小鬼狮子。

老大：都是我的错，都是我的错，我怎么这么弱！

女主：不是你的错！是我犯蠢！

老大：不听不听我不听，就是我的错！你不能离开我，你离开了我我的生活就一片黑暗！

女主：好好好我不离开你！

然后就是女主被绑架，老大去救，被打，老大被下属救，女主哭，老大叫女主别哭，然后就完了，狮子没有拿回勇气，女主成了他的保姆（NE）。

？？？？？？？？？？？？？？？？？

嗯？？？？？？？？？？？？？？？？

我到底看了什么？？？？？？？？？？

隐情在哪里？？？？你大概每三条线就说你爱女主，你到底解释一下啊？？？？

我觉得HE可能会有更多的信息，于是我load了进入到老大线的存档，开始一遍一遍的试，一遍一遍的进入NE。

大概第四次的时候我的内心是拒绝的，于是我去找了攻略。

按照攻略弄了三次全都是NE之后，我才发现如果我要HE，我要从头开始重新玩，每个选项都要按照这位老大的萌点来选。

老大你好，老大再见老大你好，老大再见。

最可怕的是，这个游戏有着史上最长的loading screen，黑屏半天后给我放个小音乐，图标一亮，继续游戏。（我玩老大的线从头到尾大概出现了30多次）

这还玩个屁。我拒绝。我选择投降。

然后我开了第三条线，老二的线。

对，就是第一个的NTR对象，毒舌喜欢看别人痛苦的表情的老二。

日常刷他好感的时候，我觉得还蛮可爱的。

NE就是老二把代表稻草人脑子的项链给了女主，说让她务必好好保管，女主在逃命的时候弄丢了，稻草人没了脑子变得不是那么的聪明。女主自责，去找了，发现项链被敌人拿走了，敌人说你跟我走我就把项链还给你，女主说好呀好呀，然后把手伸过去给他们绑，然后敌人就把项链踩碎了。老二过来救她，弱的要命，直接被砍了几十下，但是还是救活了，失去了脑子的老二不虐待女主了，不喜欢看别人痛苦的表情了，但是就是容易失忆，但是不会忘记女主的事情，the end。

可能是老大的线给我的冲击太大了，我觉得觉得这个NE还不错，毕竟没了脑子的老二对女主真的是好太多了。

然后我去打了HE。

老二给女主的项链是假的，因为他不信女主，他一直都在演戏。可惜女主不知道啊，女主还是自责去找了，老二这次突然被buff，变得超强，一巴掌打爆敌人，当着女主的面杀人，然后说这个戒指才是我的脑子，给你戴上，老二继续玩弄女主，男二愿打女主愿挨，两人恩恩爱爱，the end。

男二你到底是信女主还是不信女主？男二你到底是信女主还是不信女主？



剧情？？？？你怎么了？？？？还能抢救一下吗？？？？原来老二不信女主的吗？？？？那NE到底是怎么回事？？？？恩恩爱爱怎么回事？？？？女主你还好吗？？？？

这下完了，NTR我是不想碰了，黑手党里面的线我肯定是不玩了。玩完这两条线后我觉得自己已经崩坏了，于是我去选了一个更崩坏的线：

妓院线。

嗯，你没看错，喜闻乐见的妓院线，而且还有三个攻略目标：老板，头牌，和清洁工前台。

我看妓院这个名字的时候已经能够预想到这条线很重口了，但是我没想到这个线能够这么可怕。

妓院线里我唯一有好感的就是管扫除和清理花园的男性。

他也有着这个世界最清奇不做作的名字：ManBoy。

为了方便，我就叫他男宝了。

这个线的前面铺垫剧情就是：

女主：男宝，你工作的地方到底是干什么的啊？

男宝：呃。。。妓院。。额不是。。是沙龙。

头牌：女主你喜欢S还是喜欢M

女主：我喜欢S

头牌：女主你快来把我搞得一团乱！

老板：这里是妓院哦！我好喜欢你啊女主！我要把你变成我的！

男宝：女主你别再来这里了！会有很不好的事情发生！

女主：嘿嘿嘿头牌比起男宝我更喜欢你！

头牌＋老板：嘿嘿嘿我们要把女主迷晕后强奸她！

（一夜过后）

游戏：正常进行剧情！女主对被强奸没有任何反应！嗯！很合理！

女主：我又来玩了！

头牌：来！这是一些玩具，用在我身上！你不知道怎么用吧？我教你！

老板：来，男宝，我把女主迷晕了我们来玩3p吧嘿嘿嘿

男宝：不行！我不能这么对女主！

老板：那你看着我强奸女主吧！！哈哈哈哈！



游戏制作组还很贴心的多次介绍那些“玩具”怎么用，都可以放到说明书里或者广告语了。

头牌：你一开始放进去会震动的很厉害，可能会有点疼，但是后面会特别特别的爽。

爽你个大鬼头。

其实我玩到这里的时候已经恶心的不行了，直接按照攻略跳着看看结局：

结局一：女主多次嫖男人花费太高，老二把她卖了。然后女主被玩坏了，成为了这里的头牌。老板只把女主给有权力的男人享用。

结局二：女主整个人扭曲了，推翻了老板，成为了妓院的新老板，天天欢快的4p。

​其实这条线全程我都是整个人带着WTF的心情度过的，女主对自己被迷晕后强奸毫无反应，日常固定剧情还是日常，被多次提醒之后还是作死，男宝想要带着她逃出去她还拒绝。

女主：只想张开大腿。

唯一一次真正让我感到特别难受还是因为男宝说的一句话：

“我已经不认识你了，我之前深爱着，如同太阳一样明亮的女性已经不见了，但是我还是控制不住我自己，我要帮你成为这里新的掌控者，我不能看着她的身体如此的被折磨。”



官方我去你的。

你觉得这里是这个游戏的底线？？？

NONONO。

第五条线我去攻略了医生，因为我很喜欢他在其他线里面出现的角色设定。

我本以为医生这个角色能够安抚我受伤的内心，然而。。。

这位医生居然是有老婆的。

有老婆的。

老婆。

但是按照他说话的方式，我的第一反应就是老婆死了，医生十分难过伤心，女主来温暖他的内心。

个屁。

这条线我有两个雷点：

第一：女主在知道医生结婚的情况下还是多次去找医生，还满大街的跑乱问别人知不知道关于医生老婆的情况。我从来没见过这么白莲花的女性。而且女主还在得知医生老婆还活着的情况下跑去告白。在医生老婆对她特别好的情况下，多次祝福她和医生的恋情的情况下，女主居然在葬礼上和医生谈情说爱。

第二：女主又双叒叕被强奸了。没错，虽然女主喜欢医生，但是并没有任何想要深层次身体交往的心思，然而医生把女主迷晕了，强奸了她，利用她累得半死半昏不醒死去活来的时候去了女主所在的黑手党的地方偷了枪然后去杀人。

这条线下来我最心疼的还是医生老婆，被关在水晶玻璃里想死不能死，半死不活，一会有意识一会没意识，放弃自己爱的人，祝福抢自己老公的小女孩和自己老公开开心心生活后，还是死的那么惨，老公直接在葬礼上和女主谈情说爱。

我只想说一句：老婆我好心疼你啊啊啊啊啊啊啊！

这条线我去看了一下别人评测的结局，很明显外国人和我一样三观爆裂，恶心的不行。

最后总结，这个游戏肯定是有很多人喜欢的，我看国内评价还不错，不过我个人是接受不了，剧情写的太差，打斗戏太过儿戏，剧情根本没有任何起伏，也不是全语音。

不过有想玩的人就去玩吧，只要能接受多次的强奸戏和女主毫无反应笑嘻嘻的立绘就好。​​​​

author: {'steamid': '76561198832539087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7066, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2099, 'last_played': 1569711992}
review:
This is probably my second favorite otome game ever and I would definitely recommend it to VN/otome lovers out there. 

The artwork as a whole is very very well done and beautiful. From the backgrounds to the sprites and of course, the CGs! Lemme tell ya, these CGs are just too cute! With the exception of the brothel CGs lol. Those were still well done but I mean... Brothel xD (No worries, they are all very tame).

The MC Fuka, or whatever you decide to name her is very adorable to me. She is simple, cute, and very sweet. But she is also extremely dumb. But its not in the way that most otome MCs are portrayed. The reason for her lack of sense is explained in the ending of the game. 

As far as love goes in the game, its pretty well done. At first, I thought the confessions and acceptance of the main three men; Axel, Caramia, and Kyrie went a little to fast but then realized that hey, these people have been living together and spending every single day with each other while we only get to see the important parts of the story.. They HAVE been together more than we see after all. For this very reason, the other characters progression moves more slowly. 

The overall plot moves very well if done in the correct order. I'd suggest Caramia > Axel > Kyrie first. Though that can be switched around (: Also since these three have so many endings, remember to save at certain points so that it doesn't become bothersome later on when trying to get all endings and CGs. Trust me, each ending is worth it and they even add a little more behind the scenes script on each try. (Just skip until you need to get to the next answer, if there's text you haven't seen before, it'll stop.) Brothel > Robin Hood > Hamelin should be done in that order since Hamelin can spoil some of Robins key points. The Brothel.. Eh. It should just be done before because its a bit odd and honestly its the only part of the story I didn't enjoy very much. Though it does give insight into that part of the town.  Scarlet and Pashets routes can be done either before or after those three routes. Though, Id recommend doing one before then one after just to keep things light. Caesar > Soh should be done LAST and in that order the epilogue and Grand Finale obviously.

My favorites where Kyrie, Caramia, Caesar, and Axel. Pashets was pretty refreshing since she is a girl (no yuri, just friends). I adored Scarlet but wished there was more to his story. It lacked key points to me and I don't really understand why he wasn't given a little more. I just felt there could have been more added to his part of the story. I also felt, at first, that Hamelin needed more in his route but as I kept going through the game he was given the recognition in the story i felt he needed. Same goes for Robin. And well the Brothel route was my least favorite. Some may like it but it was just a bit of "let me get this over with already" for me. 

Overall, I loved this game. It's actually one of few otome games I feel could be played, left alone for awhile after finished completely, then played again later on down the road. Like a good book. I laughed quite a bit and shed a few tears here and there. I bought this on sale but feel its well worth the original price. Though, if the price is a bit to stiff for you it wouldnt hurt to add to your wishlist and wait for it to go down in price (: No regrets!

author: {'steamid': '76561198339545040', 'num_games_owned': 8420, 'num_reviews': 493, 'playtime_forever': 3381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3381, 'last_played': 1531073557}
review:
OZMAFIA!! - визуальная новелла в отомэ жанре, то есть проще говоря, новелла для девчонок. Проходил я её чисто из спортивного интереса и ради сюжета, никаких гейских наклонностей не имею, такщо не надо тут xD

Ну значится так: играем мы за девушку (кто бы мог подумать?), которую зовут Фука, она внезапно оказывается в каком-то незнакомом ей городе с потерей памяти, город поделен на сферы влияния мафиозных кланов, названия и персонажи которых взяты из различных сказок и выглядят все как на подбор красавцы як тот вампир из Сумерек, в общем все девчонки (как я вас ненавижу) ссутся и текут от восторга с данных рисованых кунов. Все мафиозные кланы есесена жить в мире и согласии не могут и постоянно бодаются за влияние в городе, во всем этом клубке интриг нам и приходится вращаться, попутно пытаясь замутить то с одним, то с другим красавчиком-сладкопопиком.

В игре очень много концовок и рутов, все их пройти я, конечно же, не смог, хотя, если бы был девчонкой, то скорее всего обязательно бы это сделал, кажется что их бесконечно. Если рассуждать объективно, игра действительно очень качественная, как с сюжетной стороны, так и с графической - персонажи отлично нарисованы, каждый обладает своей индивидуальностью и загадкой, на самом деле у меня сложилось такое ощущение, что даже мальчишечьи новеллы не рисуются и не прорабатываются так тщательно, как вот эта, серьезно, здесь нет стандартного набора архетипов новелл а-ля цундере, яндере, староста-тян, подруга детства, очень много внимания уделено деталям каждого героя, и каждый из них, по-своему, уникален. Звуковая составляющая тоже на высоте, большинство диалогов озвучено, музыка играет всегда в тему, даже опенинг выглядит как начало какого-то популярного сериала на ТВ.

В этой игре есть все: романтика, страсть, интриги и любовные треугольники, колоритные персонажи, много действительно хорошего юмора, сказочная атмосфера игрового мира, игра действительно крутая и заслуживает внимания женского (может быть и не только) круга аудитории любителей визуальных новелл, отличный гаремник для девчонок, добавить, пожалуй, больше нечего ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198090612611', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1886, 'last_played': 1601526029}
review:
I love this game so much, more than any game or VN ever. I loved absolutely everything about it! I love the dark elements even more, and my favorite route was the brothal route. I'm so in love with Ozmafia. I adored all the characters, and the art was so beautiful, Yuka was so gorgeous! I was pretty much gushing and screaming the whole time.
Do all the Oz guys first, if you're looking for route suggestions.

The only thing I didn't particularly like, was how stupid the MC was, a complete airhead, for most of the routes. If she spoke out of place several of the men would be like "A lady like you shouldn't say things like that" Like boy, watch your mouth. I'd say much worse things if it would let me you naughty kitty. 
But yeah in some of the routes her intellect was allowed to escape, so that's fine. Most of them see her as some pure and innocent canvas not to be tainted, which was frankly, quite annoying. Which is why i found the brothal route empowering, and  painted her quite the defiant manipulative mistress. 

I have so many amazing things to say about this game, I rave about it to everyone, and it's 110% worth the money! It's so intricate, and has so much to offer. Though oddly, i find it quite comical no one seems to care about where she came from or who she is, but who am I to judge.  I still have like one more route, but I just wanted to share with everyone how much I absolutely loved this, and I wish there were more games like this. Like, guys please make more of these so I can sink into these fantasies over and over. I'll just keep replaying this one for now, I don't mind at all!

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198168719429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1126, 'last_played': 1558701722}
review: Bought this game since it all appealed to me and i was NOT disappointed, the voice over is really great and the visuals are beautiful the story/plot is also really great, has alot of characeters to pick from, it really gives one the feel of controlling ones own anime which i definitely do enjoy ! Only issues i really have is the "pause" screen that shows up a bit too often, and that the main character girl seems to be honestly a bit too stupid, at some points during the game really gives you the feel to facepalm beyond imagination as to how someone can be that stupid, besides those two things its a great game and i am very happy i bought it! Would definitely recommend it! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198189270667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2582, 'last_played': 1530322856}
review: Like all otome games, some routes were definitely better than others. The art and voice acting are the best parts of this game. However, the choppiness of all the dialogue really breaks the immersion. There isn't much of a coherent plotline, nor much romance with each suitor. The whole game seemed like a bunch of small scenes sewn together. And most scenes don't even have a proper end, which sucks because I really wanted to see some of them :( I did not hate the entire game, it's mostly just the presentation. The characters were interesting as well as the setting, but the way the story was organized was a huge turn off. I really hated having to skip through the entire game A SECOND TIME just to see a 3-4 line scene so that the story became more clear. If you can get past the choppy dialogue, then I do recommend this game. It's not the WORST experience. But if you are like me and want an immersive and coherent plotline, then I would try looking somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035955380', 'num_games_owned': 130, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1984, 'last_played': 1526848171}
review:
This is a very good otome game. It has basically ten different routes, with three of them having three ending possibilities while the others have two. All characters are very charismatic, with their own personalities that are respected during the whole gaming story. 
The heroine acts stupidly sometimes, but she's still very likeable and cute, and you figure out a lot about her life from the true ending.
The only "bad side" is that if you really want to understand 100% of the story, you have to play every character route for the true ending. But trust me, it's totally worth your time =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198045536164', 'num_games_owned': 2831, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 3580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3495, 'last_played': 1476572767}
review:
I love this game, mostly.

The artwork is super pretty and soft and I could stare at it for ages! There are a lot of CGs to collect, and some of them are among my all time favourite CGs as far as Otome games go. 
It's a shame that the game doesn't have steam achievements, I think it would've been a nice touch, considering you can track your CG progress in game, but hey, it's not a deal breaker!

I enjoyed most of the characters, there was the odd one or two that I thought were a bit meh, or just not my cup of tea (and no it's probably not the ones you're thinking of!) and the MC really annoyed me at times. She can be frustratingly dumb and I wanted to cuff her round the head more often than not. That being said however, I still enjoyed the routes and the 'story' as it played out. I know some of you may not like the idea of the love triangle routes, but you don't have to play them :) I would though, they're pretty darn good!

That brings me to the story. It's set in a fairytale type of world, hence the characters personalities and names etc. Which is great in itself as I love fairytales and that sort of thing, however the overall/canon ending, or epilogue, or whatever it gets called (I forget) is a bit pants. I feel kind of let down with the overall story, I won't say much more as I don't want to spoil it, or make it sound like I didn't enjoy this game, because I really did.
I just feel that it could've been so much better in places.

The price I feel is absolutely fine for the amount of work that must've gone into this game. There's a lot of routes and endings, many quality CGs and voice acting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198236025352', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 7607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4383, 'last_played': 1560595636}
review:
I'm currently too lazy to write a legit review (though I might edit this later) so I'm just going to say that I really enjoyed the game. It's one of the better otome games on steam.

The heroine is pretty standard (naive, pure and happy) but the guys' designs and personalities make up for it. And there were some mechanics that you don't usually see in otome games such as if you replay a route you get extra scenes from the guy's POV and in the Oz routes it's possible to change the pursued character part way through which leads to a different story than that guy's standard route.

Anyway, long story short, one of my favourite otome games on steam and I'm so so glad it was translated in to english.

author: {'steamid': '76561198448020641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1523607178}
review: I haven't beaten it 100% yet, however everything I have done has been incredible. The routes were really meaningful, and I love the music. Especially the opening. I recommend the game for those who love oz stories and other fairy tales. I will warn you that one of the routes you can take is ...very dark. The Brothel route shocked me. I suggest this game whole heartedly. Enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048805982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1938, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1938, 'last_played': 1521585348}
review:
i haven't cried at an otome's final end in a long time, and this one really drew the tears out of me. 

the art is phenomenal and gorgeous, and while the story may seem disjointed at times, it rewards you for going through routes again by feeding you extra story slices that fill in the gaps the second time around. also, the skip button is very handy!

however, both the brothel & robin hood's route are not for the faint of heart. there is sexual assault among other things. please tread cautiously.

despite all this, i enjoyed this otome very much as someone who has been into otome and visual novels for close to 8 years now. it may feel like a slog to collect all the endings to unlock the epilogue + grand finale for newcomers to jp otome, but for me it didn't feel very tiring. the skip button is your friend!

i highly recommend ozmafia.

review:
I felt all sorts of wonderful emotions while playing this game.
I felt happy, I held resentment because of what characters said and did, I felt betrayed, I felt so sad; as if my love was torn from my chest, but most of all I felt utterly attached of deeply fond of all the characters and the story.
The voice acting is astounding and the OST was soothing if not at times perfect to set certain moods beautifully.

Thank you for this amazing experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354558121', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1519100919}
review:
因为是用汉化补丁打开游戏，所以没显示游戏时间。没有中评想来想去还是不推荐。
首先画风我真的很喜欢，BGM也不错，可惜语音只有70%左右。结局也非常多，线也多。
说说剧情是黑手党+带点童话色彩，毕竟主角不算人。说真的完全感觉不到黑手党氛围，完全是打闹着玩，而且战斗场景描写的非常苍白！！！人物之间的感情递进和心理描写我也觉得很粗糙，可能跟流程长短和篇幅的原因有关。
按照设定其实可以写的很有剧情，但玩起来确实很像白开水，剧情也有虎头蛇尾的感觉。
因为我是自己玩，我玩这类不看攻略，第一次就不小心进了出轨线啊啊啊啊，虽然是可以打纯爱线，但对于我这种一次一个人的感觉WTF，而且要打全CG不得不吃是三角线，如果雷出轨的慎入。
总结外包装来说很不错，但剧情对于我来说很苍白。
但我还是要说，Caesar小天使我爱你！

author: {'steamid': '76561198365575334', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1516511808}
review: Going into this game I thought, [b] "COOL - Cute opening song, adorable art, promising storyline and handsome men - what could go wrong?" [/b] Well, after playing a few routes I can say that while some are satisfying, this game has crushed my soul (particularly Soh's route) [spoiler] Both of his routes are bad. You get a taste of a happy ending and then it's ripped from you, leaving you feeling empty, sad and just straight disappointed. [/spoiler]  It has left me asking [u] W H Y. WHYYYY SO CRUEL. [/u]  If you're looking for a super happy/super romantic story, this is not for you. It's still worth a play through if you don't mind tragedy, though. I'd definitely suggest waiting for a steam sale though, if you're set on purchasing this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116668487', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1649095024}
review:
[url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34863696-Some-Novel-%2528s%2529-called-Otome/?appid=787970] Follow me to see more reviews like this [/url]

[b]Type of Game: [/b] Visual Novel – Reading & Choices
[b]Length: [/b] about 30h (not finished with the main routes)  
[b]Story: [/b] 10/10 (for side characters); didn't play Axel's route because Kyrie's route annoyed me (5/10)
[b]Art: [/b] 10/10
[b]Warning: [/b] This game allows you to switch your partner within a main route. I do not support these types of games to be honest because I personally do not like it. Especially because you can still get "a happy end".

The art of this game is it's strong point. The backgrounds, the characters and the CG's are gorgeous. I would even say that the art makes my review that positive. 

But the writing isn't as good as the art. Somehow, it may seem like they tried to be poetical, but at some point it's just switching between the normal dialogue to the poetic description and it's rather confusing. I mean, you shouldn't make a 3rd person narrator in a romance visual novel that talks like an old novelist, while the characters talk like they would in our time. For me it was something that made me chuckle, so that I couldn't take the story serious and wasn't immersed in it. 

Next point is the story. Like the writing... Well it's not a strong point. Many people like a large amount of choices in a game. Well, I'm not that picky, so I don't care, if there are a lot or almost no choices to make. Rather it annoys me, if I have to look up a walkthrough to finish a game because I keep getting bad ends. 

I haven't played Axel's route yet (I'll do it later because I heard this will be the best route of the game), but seriously...

I mean, it's great that you have a lot of choices and that, when you play a second time the character gets more scenes in the game and that he talks to you, when you open the game (it's a great idea BTW)... BUT it's just not good pacing for me, if the scenes get switched to quickly, if you always have to choose with whom you wish to spend time with and, if there is this second choice thing, about whom you wish to date. 

I went for Kyrie first, knowing how I don't like those type of guys, but I like them more than those goody-goody like [spoiler] Lionly [/spoiler]. Well, it's a good thing that you can choose, who to date, a second time, but in Kyrie's route it's almost impossible to get the answers right. Had to look up a guide because my girl was trying to leave him all the time... 

After that I finished Caesar’s, Robin Hood’s, Scarlet’s and Hamelin’s routes.

Hamelin’s was far the most impressing, although it was so short. I truly liked his personality and, how the MC and he interact [spoiler], although both endings are quite sad. He is the main antagonist and this route explains his perspective, why he did the things he did and, what a person he truly is [/spoiler].

Scarlet is [spoiler] the assistant, so to say, of Hamelin and he’d follow him anywhere. Until he meets MC, of course[/spoiler].  I think this is the most not-logical route of all: [spoiler] First the MC is all lovely and talks with him a lot, trying to be his friend, but after she is forced to join the famiglia, she is like another person. She completely avoids him for no reason. WHAT’S UP WITH HER?! It was painful to watch… [/spoiler]

Robin Hood is the doctor [spoiler], a quite huge psychopath, who wants to revenge the death of his wife. Ah, yes, he keeps his wife alive in a tube next room. Pretty normal, I guess [/spoiler]. He has a nice route, quite enjoyable to read. He’s my favorite character from this game. After finishing this route, you know, what happened because of [spoiler] Hamelin. The story is, if I’m not wrong, that Hamelin liked Robin Hood’s wife, or something, so he went to their wedding and shoot her. After that he went all berserk on the townspeople, so that Scarlet had to shoot him down. Hamelin was exiled since, but comes back, after the arrival of the MC and tries to lead a rebellion again. Robin Hood tried to revive his wife, but he couldn’t. So he kept her comatose in a tube, until Hamelin arrives and he is finally able to get his revenge[/spoiler].

And another thing: It may be good that there are this many routes... BUT it's hellish annoying to play them, when you play without walkthrough and have to play through the whole game to get the answers right. And playing with a walkthrough sucks for a lot of different reasons e.g. one of them being that you keep clicking between game and site and can't concentrate on either on them.

SUMMARY:
There is gorgeous art
There isn't a very good writing style and the story lacks pacing sometimes
-> They tried to make it look like a story book, but the dialogue is more like 21st century than "fairy tale-ish"
There are characters, who have their own personalities without being "too great, too prince-like"
-> But they also suffer because of the weird pacing
Most likely you will need a walkthrough
-> getting good ending without it will be REALLY difficult
(The main is annoying because she is naive and stupid in actually every route I played so far)
You have a lot of choices
-> you need like 4 hours to play through every variant of ONE route

====> So, if you want a game, which is good, not that expensive, if you think about the time you going to invest in it, then it's great. If you want a gem, something that will make you think, make you cry for hours or simply be your favourite visual novel for ages, this is most likely not it. It's good, but it could be better. It's far better than those cliché novels, which don't have any plot or any story behind it, but it's more something that you won't replay after finishing. <====

author: {'steamid': '76561198144770039', 'num_games_owned': 93, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4416, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3431, 'last_played': 1516074817}
review:
I was seriously enjoying this game until crossed a line where I felt that I cannot in good conscience recommend it. 

There is a route in this game where the main character is drugged and there is a stereotypical fade-to-black. The next morning the text literally says "the marks hidden beneath her clothes were proof of the time they'd spent together." The character is literally drugged and assaulted by this man. Even if you don't believe that she was sexually assaulted, she was physically assaulted enough to leave evidence. The things said by the man during this scene were also disgusting enough to turn my stomach.

While we must be wary of viewing another culture's art by our own moral metric, we must also remember that sexual violence is an epidemic, and this sort of situation is an all too common occurrence. We shouldn't normalize it and call it love.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211520780', 'num_games_owned': 2259, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 2023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1672, 'last_played': 1514018733}
review:
This otome is a beautiful, often mature, rendition of a classic, The Wizard of Oz with a gripping twist. Along with Oz characters, you’ll be introduced to many memorable fairytale characters, all set in a town where groups of fairytale characters run their own mafias, pitted against each other. The premise is interesting and well done, and the story does not disappoint with its romance, storylines, characters, and plot twists. OZMAFIA!! is sometimes cute, funny, tragic, or a bit risqué. But it is all beautiful and memorable. 
+Positives+
	-Beautiful character designs, bgs, cgs, and general designs. Plenty of save slots and no clunky game play and easy navigation. 
	-Voice acting (Japanese) and specific options to turn off voices if you don’t like one of the voices (I never had to use that option because I liked them all).
	-Excellent storyline, if you love fairytales, romance, or story depth, this is for you. When you replay a route, there will be extra scenes added in that give a behind the scenes look to give you more insight into the characters. That is a huge plus because every ending, though not always happy, was worth reading, personally.
=Neutrals=
	-The MC is a lovable but naïve girl, she can change slightly from each character route. But she has amnesia, so she can, in some cases, come off a little blank. BUT, in the hidden true ending (the Grand Ending), she gets a really good resolution to her character and becomes much more defined. Her character makes sense and is very lovable anyway. I loved her, but some people might feel differently. Give her a chance.
	-The price is high, but I actually believe it fits the product. High quality equals high price. This otome has a high replay ability and a long play time. (I spent over 60 hours in-game and I don’t care what the counter says.) I haven’t found all the extra scenes yet and these characters WILL make you come back for more. IF IT IS ON SALE, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR, GET IT!
--Negatives—
	-I wanted steam achievements. That’s all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261006837', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1403, 'last_played': 1550438500}
review:
Sinceramente no le tenia fe jajaja, pero al final me termino enganchando el juego.
Los personajes varian un poco, hay algunos que me gustaron sus rutas pero otros que los hice nomas para obtener los cgs o por curiosidad. La protagonista es un poco torpe pero te logras acostumbrar y el arte es hermoso, hay unos cgs muuuy lindos.
Hubieron un par de plot twists que hicieron el otome mas interesante para mi (spoiler jaja)primero hay varios finales que te hacen creer que sacaste bad ending y despues de los creditos en realidad todo esta bien, ya me paso un par de veces me angustie al pedo jaja y la segunda cosa que me encanto es que en el caso de que elijas cualquiera de los top 3 protagonistas (kyrie, caramia o axel) siempre va a llegar un momento donde va a haber un triangulo amoroso y que dependiendo de las opciones que elijas, podes terminar tu ruta, por ejemplo de caramia, con otro personaje. Lo que si hay que tener cuidado en caso de que no quisieras que cambie de una ruta de personaje a otra.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999732661', 'num_games_owned': 1752, 'num_reviews': 145, 'playtime_forever': 3621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3349, 'last_played': 1515806177}
review:
OZMAFIA!! is a visual novel that I simultaneously love and hate.  While there are several things I absolutely enjoy in the otome title, there are some rather troubling issues (both story and presentation related) that prevent me from giving it an overwhelming thumbs up.  I do recommend the game, but with a few large caveats.

First of all, I love these characters.  As much as I wanted to hate a few of them, they're all incredibly well-developed, well-written, and a  joy to watch interact, especially the 3 Oz men who have rather entertaining relationships with each other.  Yes, there are a few points in which characters do pretty despicable things (and it hurts my heart that my favorite is guilty of some nasty stuff), but my overall enjoyment of these characters, with whom I've spent 50+ hours, overcomes a few extremely infuriating moments.  But just barely. 

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1204386597
The visual novel has some rather controversial moments which include emotional manipulation, drugged sex, drunken sex, and BDSM elements (ahem, the Brothel route) which likely won't appeal to all readers.  The non-con stuff was extremely off-putting for me personally, especially since the writing doesn't make it out to be an issue at all.  On the contrary, the scenes are written in an almost titillating manner, which made me very uncomfortable.   So if you just read through that and are like, "NOPE, I'm outta here!" I can totally understand.   The humor may also come off as vulgar and risque to some. However, I felt  it worked just fine given the characters' personalities and disposition in the world.  And this is coming from someone who's usually put-off by trashy comedy.   At least the guys keep most of their comments away from Fuka's ears...for the most part (I'm looking at you, Kyrie)!   

That said, the story has a lot of issues in both plotting and structure.  While the translation is one of the best I've come across in any visual novel with incredibly fluent writing, very few typos, and cultural references that all feel fitting and natural, it's not enough to cover up the disjointed narrative that is exacerbated by an overly long common route that feels like a string of unrelated scenes that don't add up to much.  Things get a little better once you finally reach the characters' individual routes, but oftentimes the stories feel like they end before they've even begun.  I guess I was hoping for more than what I got, and I wanted a LOT more because I really do enjoy the world and lore that Poni-Pachet created.  I love the setting, the fairy tale characters, the mafia families fighting for control, the magical elements of the town, and the unsettling way the darker themes have taken root in this pastel-colored wonderland.   It just feels like it could have been so much more had they just tightened up the plotting and removed the many "loading screens" which do nothing but interrupt the narrative flow.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1203254308
Fortunately,  the artwork is absolutely gorgeous and brings Oz to watercolor life with its soft hues and delicate detail.  Drawn by the talented Satoi (Diabolik Lovers, Norn9), everything glows from the pastel backgrounds to the gorgeous CGs.  This is one of the BEST looking otome games on Steam with very little variance in artwork quality (although some CGs seem to have slightly better coloring than others).  The voice work is also phenomenal with a few familiar seiyuu lending their talents to the game.  Unfortunately, only about 75% of the lines are voiced, but the more important scenes are fully covered, and it's nice to get a good feel for how the characters sound even if they're not talking through every single line.  

Wow. That seems like a lot of criticism for a game I'm recommending, but I probably wouldn't be as critical if I didn't feel like there was untapped potential here.  OZMAFIA!! is a great idea that falters due to haphazard execution, but it's still a tale worth experiencing as long as one can push through the jumbled mess of a story and raunchier plot points.  And if you can skip the Brothel route, cause...yeah...

[code][h1]Curated by: [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7593237/]Otome Rakuen[/url] & [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33004802-Chudah%27s-Corner/]Chudah's Corner[/url][/h1][/code]

review: This game is a visual novel which brought the unlikely combination of multiple fairy tales like the Wizard of Oz and the Shakespearian masterpiece, Romeo & Juliette. The music is cute, the drawing style is beautiful and the characters are intriguing (and SO HOT !). With so many different endings to unlock and characters to romance, there is very little chance of getting bored with this game. So, why don't you take your chance with some handsome bishonen :D

review: I loved this game and got a full 100% of routes/CGs. It manages to balance out between whimsical and lighthearted, and dark mafia stuff (the brothel routes are downright disturbing, in a good way). Caramia was my favourite guy by far, and he has an awesome violin "theme song".

author: {'steamid': '76561198382407068', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1753, 'last_played': 1533592192}
review:
After reading some negative reviews for this game with not even 10+ hours into the game and wondering why they're giving it a negative before even giving it a try. I've wanted this game forever and I did finally buy it a couple weeks ago, I've yet to finish all the routes but I'm enjoying it nonetheless.

Here's my review as to why I consider OZMAFIA!! to be an otome I'd recommend:

[b] Pros: [/]
- It's so beautifll drawn, the colours aren't like usual visual novels. It's different and different is good, it stands out.
- The characters are well written and each have their own individual personality which reflects very well. Even though Fuka (your character) is quite dense, it makes for a lot of humour especially in Robin Hoods' route.
- The storyline isn't perfect however it is quite lovely. Each route has 2 endings (except Caramia, Kyrie and Axel who have 4 each I think) I wouldn't call them "good and bad" endings but then it depends on the route honestly as some are "bad".
- It's not actually that long. It has a lot of routes to take and you'd spend most of your time doing the Oz boys but it's truthfully quite short and sweet.
- The music is beautiful, the theme song is played instrumentally throughout some parts of the story. I personally find it difficult not to sing-along as it's so catchy! However the music does set the mood/atmosphere of what's going on.

[b] Cons: [/b]
- I can't really think of negatives for this otome besides the fact that the endings are quite short, I'd love them lengthened more as I adore all the characters. It'd be nice to have a longer epilogue.
- I'd have enjoyed being able to romance Hansel and Aelling as well as have a longer route with Hamelin.

[b] Overall: [/b]
I love every second I play this game, it always makes me smile when I watch Kyrie, Caramia and Axel's banter. The laughs are always there and even the seriousness can make you feel like you're there. There isn't a set way to do the routes though some recommend doing the Oz boys first (Caramia, Kyrie and Axel) however I did Caesar, Scarlet, Robin Hood and Pashet - going to be doing the Brothel, Soh and finally the Oz boys. Honestly do whichever route suits you first, it doesn't matter.
This game is a blast and you wont feel cheated, if you love the fantasy world then buy this game!
- Pashet isn't a lesbian route, just a friendship route.

author: {'steamid': '76561198174487218', 'num_games_owned': 182, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3179, 'last_played': 1509559816}
review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198025297329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2738, 'last_played': 1583894310}
review:
I found Ozmafia to be a delightful game. The artwork was enjoyable and they had many poses/faces for the characters to help set up the mood. The story is based around fairytale characters (set in different Mafia groups) and you, as the female protagonist can hang out and romance quite a few different interesting characters. As with most Otome games, your character has the brains of a earthworm and gets herself into dangerous situations where you have to be saved by a strong-strapping-young-hero. (Example: Mystery dude tries to kills you for reasons you never bother to sort out. You find out he lives in the woods with ruffian vagabonds. Conclusion: LET'S GO EXPLORE THE WOODS AND POKE A WOLF-GUY WITH A STICK!) But I suppose drama makes the heart grow fonder. My favorite characters were the three main Oz boys, which makes sense because the game is mostly centered around them. The other routes aren't as long or well thought out, and most leave you with more questions than answers. Believe it or not, they DO answer most of your questions once you get the super-secret-ending (follow a guide if you need to) but even that ending left me displeased. Yes, it answered questions, but it wasn't satisfying. Still, the rest of the game made up for the lack-luster ending, so I can forgive it.
If you like Otome games, pick this one up. It's an enjoyable ride.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042791972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1403, 'last_played': 1479102285}
review: This was my first Otome game and I loved it! There were a few sections that dragged a bit during replays, but since you can kind of "fast forward" those parts it wasn't a big deal. Overall, the routes are diverse, the art is lovely, and the endings are satisfying. Highly recommend :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198202964246', 'num_games_owned': 98, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3224, 'last_played': 1666885781}
review:
Ozmafia!! Ist eindeutig mein liebstes Otome-Game von allen!
Wundervolle Musik, hübsches Game-Menü und hervorragendes Artwork!
Übrigens vom gleichen Zeichner wie Diabolik Lovers.
Eine zuckersüße Märchengeschichte mit so vielen, liebenswerten Charakteren.
Die Charaktervielfalt und verschiedenen Endings lobe ich hierbei besonders.
Das einzige Manko ist aus meiner sicht, die fehlenden Stimmen an manchen
stellen des Games, was das Vergnugen beim Spielen allerdings nur sehr gering senkt!
Super gelungenes Game für Einsteiger und Kenner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052511058', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 300, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1484415164}
review: Beautiful art, but the story is really lackluster. I feel like they went for more content and routs but the story quality suffered heavaly for it. Considering that it's a bit expensive. I'd wait for it to be on sale to buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012371252', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1531052196}
review:
After playing Amnesia, this game was pretty disappointing. Things just keep happening and you don't get why. I have played a bunch of endings but haven't learned anything about the main story of being in this strange Oz Mafia country. I don't get the route system, too. Sometimes the story skips important parts and you can only read them, if you play the same route again, sticking to the same decisions. I don't get it. Even with walkthrough this game is difficult to play and pretty annoying, because nothing happens at all. 
At least the playtime is really long so you've got hours and hours to play.
I would not buy it again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128689007', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 3056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3056, 'last_played': 1501158041}
review:
So many characters to play through.
Each has a different story.

Fun: 7/10
The main routes, Sou and Caesar's are the most interesting, but cos I played Sou and Caesar's last, I was already a bit drained from having played so many other routes that I didn't have the mood to enjoy them fully.

Some routes feel like a chore to go through just to unlock their CG.

My opinion on how fun the routes are: main characters > robin, caesar, scarlet, soh, hamelin > manboy > pashet

Story: 7/10
Interesting overarching plot, though it's a chore to unlock it with so many characters. Most of the story is found in the main characters' routes, but nothing much is revealed from the supporting characters.

---

I'll recommend getting it on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198356082472', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 892, 'last_played': 1549420915}
review:
看了动漫来的，立绘和BGM超赞~\(＾－＾)/

但是没有剧情深度，有些结局很草率；没有原文/中文字幕也很影响体验，只冲着画风可以考虑入。

author: {'steamid': '76561198339223379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1950, 'last_played': 1501112708}
review: Inicialmente fiquei bastante dividida se recomendava o jogo ou não. Confesso que nas minhas primeiras rotas (a rota da família Oz) fiquei bastante entediada. Nenhum dos 3 personagens eram interessantes o suficiente para mim e achei o desenvolvimento das histórias bastante monótonas, apesar da proposta diferenciada de você poder trocar um personagem pelo outro no meio da história, mas acredito que isso seja mais questão de gosto pessoal. Depois ter me aventurado nas rotas dos outros personagens, minha opinião mudou drasticamente! Posso dizer, com toda certeza, o quanto que valeu a pena adquirir este jogo. O Grand Finale e o epílogo vão te deixar bastante comovido e com um sentimento de "quero mais".

author: {'steamid': '76561198345967588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1865, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1865, 'last_played': 1503846333}
{'steamid': '76561198208479477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2695, 'last_played': 1503314090}
review:
I'm sorry to be a party pooper, but I just can't give this game a positive review. [i]The art, voice actors and the concept of the game are amazing, but sadly that's probably all.[/i]
The game itself wasn't bad, but there are several major drawbacks forcing me to disagree with all of those enthusiastic reviews. 
I could write a long text about things people already mentioned, like painfully stupid and unreasonable MC or annoying loading screens, but I will better focus on one thing that pained me the most which is the storyline.

The game gives you drastically more questions than answers, which I didn't mind at first but after finishing the game I feel just empty. Half of the routes just leads to nowhere and the endings are quite disatisfying and neglected. The most annoying thing is that the game forces you to play everything over and over and over and over again and I honestly admire people who got all of the endings without walkthroughts, I would never have the nerve to go through it more times than I had to in order to unlock the grand ending.

Some of the characters have a great potential, but they just don't have enought space, the routes feel rushed and unfinished. After first few routes I stopped counting how many times I was just staring at that dark screen like "please tell me it's not the end yet" [spoiler] Hamelin's route was just one big joke. During the entire game I believed Hamelin will be that kind of "fated" partner for MC who is much more wounded than he looks like. But nope, that guy get's like 30 minutes of gameplay while both of the endings are again pretty disatisfying. On the other hand he might be the only character that really got my full attention...just to have me totally heartbroken when I got to know his route is more like a trailer for a whole TV series that is never coming. [/spoiler]

In overal I don't regret playing it, but I belive that with this potential it could be much better than this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198313573885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2082, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1643, 'last_played': 1631457618}
review: Totally recommended. The storyline is so rich and not only focus on romance. author: {'steamid': '76561198349891522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1556, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1594567293}
review:
Hey there, ladies and gentlemen.
I highly recommend Ozmafia because the story is nice and the characters are prety authentic. I like the artwork very much (I guess I know from somewhere (Not sure if Anime or another game) and the sound of the game is fitting and nicely done. I just wish there would be an OST on Steam (sadly it is not and you have to import fan merch as far as I know). 
But anyway...
The story is quite unique and you seriosly get a lot of different views. I am not sure but I think there is one route missing (Caesar's) because if I remember correctly the Japanese PSP/PS Vita version of Idea Factory(?) contained that as well. But I am not certain because I am not through yet. 

Artwork: 11/10
Music: 9 1/2 /10
Characters: 10/10
Story: 9/10

Conclusion: 39 1/2 of 40

author: {'steamid': '76561197997074904', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 481, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1498536907}
review:
I'm trying so hard to like it, but every passing minute I'm growing more and more frustrated by how absolutley stupid the MC is. Losing your memory doesn't mean you have to lose common sense. You live in a town where mafia families are constantly fightning, and are specifically told to NOT go out at night. Pretty obvious what she decides to do. I'm gonna go for a walk! Idiot...

The visuals, voice acting, and my curiousity on the background story of WHY they're human, and y'know...mafia, are the only reasons I haven't uninstalled yet. If it ends up being one of those games you have to play every single route to get a tiny bit of information on the 'big picture' I'm not even going to bother.

Also the whole love triangle thing you have to go through for every route is really annoying. I didn't realize this was a love triangle game. I thought maybe one route, sure. But to get the 'true ending' you literally have to go through every route, with every other guy as the love triangle intrest. There's like 7 guys, and that's not to mention the Oz boys have 2 different triangle endings each, on top of the 2 pure endings.  

An example: You're pursuing Caramia, then Kyrie comes in. Chose Caramia, reload, chose Kyrie. reload, reject Kyrie, reload, reload reload.

The walkthrough I'm using for Caramia is just so ridiculous, they have to actually tell you when to make new save files, so its easier to go back for all the other routes. Caramia's route page is so long, the scroll bar is a sliver. And this is the same for EVERY. SINGLE. GUY.

Did I mention the MC is a literal doorknob? Actually no, a doorknob would be smarter than her.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348598806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1629, 'last_played': 1563210887}
review:
非常推荐！CG都非常美，只有一两张的细节处有纰漏。声优的演绎也十分到位（为兴津打call！Kyrie的各种情绪都完美表达了出来<四谷吹难以自拔>）剧本上，每个可攻略人物的个人路线其实都不算长，但由于双结局及OZ三人组劈00腿线及最后大结局的加入，文本量还是可观的。剧情非常不错（我会说Soh的HP和最后的true end都让我老泪纵横嘛T T，当然，BGM也起到了推波助澜的功效）而二刷时出现的回想能帮助读者加深对攻略对象的了解，之前埋下的伏笔也多在此时水落石出WW最后，作为一个15r，福利(☆▽☆)是必不可少的【兴奋.jpg】除牙白的娼馆线外，这部游戏为你开启了黄段子探索之旅，各种各样的搞笑黄段子等待你去发现，也给推线之路增添了不少乐趣。印象最深的是狮子劈腿线中的一个剧情回想，糟糕到不行(/▽╲)（快去看啊啊啊啊笑死了哈哈哈哈哈）总结下来，这部作品原价购入的话我认为是非常值得的，它能为你带来一段又有温馨又有欢笑也有眼泪的旅程\(^o^)/
PS:BGM真的吼吼听！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198274747200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 4925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4925, 'last_played': 1495438872}
review:
A mafia, in an otome? Well, how insane, right? But how unique. For the first time, I throughly enjoyed an otome without the worry of repetitiveness, because it was actually an endearing story that was written well. So before the title throws you off, maybe you could learn that uniqueness isn't quite so bad.

Ozmafia really brought some old beloved characters from 'The Wizard Of Oz' back to us all in the same art style as Diabolik Lovers. While the game really did seem to have a lot in common with the other, more popular game series- they used their own devices to make a very heart wrenching story with beautiful characters. A world that is painted in a special way that you can see both sides of every story allows a more in depth experience. You can easily become attached to these characters, and it makes for all the better impact in the end.

In terms of negative, this, like all games- does fall into the repetitive. There's no real commitment to the game or story other than however empathetic you are to the characters and story. It is, unfortunately, another 'just click to get your man' kind of game. There is also a story you can follow that tricks you into thinking you can have a Yuri relationship- but it is not the case.

author: {'steamid': '76561198129127335', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4297, 'last_played': 1490783638}
review:
The art is obviously very good (Satoi's art is gorgeous, c'mon) and I like the localization a lot, mangagamer always does a great job in my opinion. The problem is the plot, it has a lot of holes and feels like a QuinRose's Alice ripoff for the most part. What put me off the most was the constant contradictions. It's almost like the writer forgot about some elements of the world and it's characters. 

Still, it was enjoyable, it's pretty funny too, if the amount of hours I spent on it is anything to go by, I like it. 
We don't have that many otome games localized, it's not the best but it's definitely not the worst. If you like dating 2D boys (and a cat girl) and enjoy mobile kusoge you probably won't mind the plot flaws that much, if you prioritize a good plot... Then you might not like it. If you love playing otome games and want to play a lot of them, then by all means play it, especially if you don't have a psvita (like me </3), besides, if we buy otome games, we'll get more otome games, Ozmafia sold enough to get a physical copy and now mangagamer is localizing another otoge (it's a +18 too), so if this says anything, helping the industry sounds like a good deal.

Also, don't watch the anime before playing this thinking you'll get an idea of how the vn is, you won't, the plot is completely different and the only good thing was [spoiler]seeing Hameln happy (please, just let him be happy, I'll forget all the flaws if you just let him be happy I don't care about the rest).[/spoiler]

An end note: I'm not an expert and that's just my silly opinion, I like it and I don't regret buying it, that's enough for me to recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139961773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1422, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1489390112}
review:
Quick Look: Ozmafia!!

So, the summer steam sale came and went and Ozmafia!! was on sale for a whopping 15% off. But I was impatient and grabbed it anyhow. $5 savings is $5 savings after all. And I couldn’t wait any longer. 

Genre: Visual Novel, Fantasy, Romance

Oddly enough my first two tries I ended up with a minor character. And not on purpose. It was a tad frustrating. I did eventually figure out what I was doing wrong, but it wasn’t as clear as I would have liked. 

Artwork: The art is lovely. There are plenty of CG’s to entertain you. 

Characters: There is a good variety of characters. And they all seem to have an actual branching path. Which is my favorite. Some games get repetitive when the only thing that changes is who you go places with and not the actual story. All the characters have a very pretty look. So, if rugged and whatnot is your style they aren’t going to appeal.

I’ll give you a quick rundown of the characters whose routes I’ve done.

Oz Family:

~ Caramia: Very sweet in personality, very kind to heroine, The Cowardly Lion

~ Kyrie: Likes to play games with people, kinda twisted, The Scarecrow

~ Axel: Very cold and  oblivious, The Tin Man

Grimm Family:

- Hameln: Fairly flirty, in trouble with the law, The Piper

- Scarlet: Wishes he was more manly, soft spot for heroine against better judgement, Little Red Riding Hood

Stival Family:

> Pashet: Strong and confident, teaches the heroine skills, Puss in Boots

Wolf Gang:

* Caesar: Acts tough, threatens heroine on regular basis, The Big Bad Wolf

*So: Very friendly, wants heroines dreams to come true, and I’m not certain who he is suppose to represent

There are a two more routes, but I’m not interested in playing through them. 

Plot: It’s actually pretty solid, but the big question doesn’t seem to be answered in the main game play. I guess there are two ending scenes that you unlock  by playing every route. But that is a lot of hours in and not all the routes interest me.

Replayability: There are some scenes added in as you complete routes.  I don’t think that truly adds to the replay value. I’m not all the interested in going back and playing routes to see a couple extra scenes. But since each route takes time I don’t think lack of replay value actually is an issue. Most visual novels have decreased values in replaying them.

There were a couple cons I just want to get out there. One: There are a ton of loading screens. It gets a little tiresome and since they are all pretty much the same it isn’t visually interesting. Two: The story is in third person perspective. You can get over that, but it isn’t the norm for visual novels. It didn’t phase me after awhile, but I know it bothered other people. Three: It isn’t fully voiced. While there are many scenes that are voiced sometimes the voice acting stops before you are done with a scene which can be a bit jarring. Four: There are no romanceable ladies. Which was a shame since one of the routes that was the best was with a woman. But you can’t romance her. 

While I did enjoy this game……. with the hefty price tag and the cons I have a difficult time recommending it to folks at it’s set price. Not to say I think the price is unreasonable for a visual novel as big as this one, but it’s really a matter of how much you like the premise that will determine whether you love it or not. I liked it. So, thumbs up from me. Use your own judgement to decide if it is worth if for you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060069828', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2786, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2786, 'last_played': 1496453302}
review: OZMAFIA!! is my number one favorite otome game of all time. I enjoyed every characters route and gained all endings twice. This is a game I could play over and over and never get sick of it. I loce this game! Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054798264', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1496282469}
review: I am a big fan of Amnesia and have been looking for something jsut as good. This isn't it. It honestly got pretty boring. I feel like there were a lot of places they could have went with this story, but it was pretty unexciting. I wasn't particularly interested or attached to any of the characters. Overall, just... meh.

author: {'steamid': '76561198335431969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1589, 'last_played': 1505349822}
review:
Theme song is 10/10 boss level, it's been stuck in my head and I actually restart from begining every time just to listen to it. It took me a moment to get into the game, and I dislike how random the voiced parts are. The way they organized the CGs was a little odd to me, many of the character's CGs were listed under ' Other ' which just seemed odd. It was really hard to tell which options gave you more affection with certain characters, which made staying on route without guide difficult in my opinion. However, all these little things didn't amount to much in my opinion of the game! By the time I completed the Oz boy’s routes I was definitely happy with my purchase. I lived for the moments of ' team hazing ' to embarrass another character, the artwork was really decent, and the voice acting was good too. I really recommend playing the oz boys first, helps when you want to skip texts. I played in this order - Caramia > Axel > Kyrie > (Then did all the triangles) > Pashet > Scarlet > Robin > Brothel > Cesar > and LEAVE SOU FOR LAST. There is no good or bad endings, but B endings were pretty hard for me to swallow. Outside of Caesars I actually liked his B ending more, Kyrie's line about Fuka x Caesar was great. I saved the Epilogue and Grand Ending for last, and I really recommend that cause I feel like the Epilogue might spoil some routes a bit?

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198084121995', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 903, 'last_played': 1495827862}
review: I just purchased this game and would really like it if I could play it.  From what I'm seeing in the forums (which I probably should have checked before purchase) there has been a couple different debug messages that have been going around when you launch the game.  I was really excited about playing this game, but it appears that I have found a new debug message.  I think the producers of this game need to create a new patch (since I don't believe I see that a new patch has been put up).  I would probably change my review if this gets changed.  I'm really hoping for the best here, becuase I was really excite to play this game and find that I might have wasted money now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080134730', 'num_games_owned': 176, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1581, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1522, 'last_played': 1495588901}
review:
Personally, I was disappointed with the whole plot (or maybe I'm just picky with the stories in games I had high expectations for). After the grand ending I do understand more about the MC and her purpose, but every route and ending left me unsatisfied. The MC just had random adventures here and there and, disregarding the epilogue + grand ending, never bothered to try and figure out how and why she lost her memories. She was a brainless optimistic girl with no depth and I wished she was more assertive for herself. Most of her actions were dumb and some of the guys' actions were dumb too. Honestly, would it kill you guys to COMMUNICATE with each other. It's also a pain to go through the "love triangle" multiple times in order to get certain CGs.

I do love the voice acting, the art style, and the music though. The CGs are fun to collect (except when you're missing 1) but I wished there were steam achievements.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171336346', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2347, 'last_played': 1493409865}
review: This game has such a huge cast of characters and so many routes and endings to explore. The art is drop dead gorgeous; the entire game looks like a watercolor painting. I had such a fun time navigating my way around it. It's a very serious game while also being a really silly one at the same time. I had a great time and loved all the characters and the stories a lot.
